description:
My uncle made reservations for a family dinner, after being told where we would be going I went looking online to see what others had to say. 

Although I may agree that it was a little slow, the food was worth the wait!!!! Everything was super hot and tasted AMAZING! 

Our table had the beef brisket, the fried chicken, the hamburger, the risotto, and another chicken dish that I can't remember everyone ate all their dinner. We then shared 2 desserts, the Strawberry trifold and the ice cream sandwich. 

I would recommend everyone to go for lunch or dinner.
author: Ryah T.

description:
The tuna on the $17 Niçoise salad was WAY off and I returned it. Very disappointing, not to mention a bad mouthful. If this is their signature lunch item, they should make sure the seared tuna is spot-on. I suspect it has to do with improper temperature storage, which is something the health department takes very seriously. I hope they read this, and make certain to address the problem. 

Otherwise, Soluna is a Civic Center mainstay.

Edit: What's that smell?? I told my lunch guest that it smelled like a dairy farm when we walked in.
author: Amy R.

description: Sorry I don't have a better photo but this was at Dreamfest2018 for Salesforce.  The restaurant is under the beautiful mural in the background.  They gave us the most delicious dinner!  I can't wait to go back.  The staff was so professional and friendly.  The food was very flavorful!
author: Fahar S.

description: I really want to like this place but THEY NEED NEW SERVERS. I live nearby and have been there many times in the last few months but have decided to stop going because one of the bartenders has consistently been rude. He consistently made it difficult to order anything, criticized my group for wanting to split the check, and has forgotten parts of our orders. He made my group feel unwelcome multiple times, so I stopped going.  Also, the place could use a simple renovation or spruce-up.
author: Sydney W.

description: My go to place for drinks and dinner before heading to a show at the Opera, Symphony, SF Jazz or Bill Graham, as it's right across the street from City Hall. The drinks are stellar and made with care, the winners are KILLER and the fried chicken is to die for.
author: Katya B.

description: I don't have a ton to say about Soluna. Beer is a bit pricy though the selection is alright. We didn't end up eating there either. It might just be the closest bar to my office, which is always a strong factor though. I'll update if I end up eating there.
author: Misha T.

description: I think this may have been the worst restaurant experience I've had in years.  nothing was good. My crab and clam pasta was salty, and boring. I am far from snobby but at $24 a bowl, you would think I would get a shellfish fork.  Hot, ridiculously overpriced Avalon California cab (you can get it at a supermarket for $9.99) at $40 a bottle is just insanity. It was crazy hot in the bathroom, and it wasn't much better at the table.  When we came in, we were treated to a scoff from the bartender, and then had tables pushed together even though there was a big booth that remained empty for the duration of our meal that started at 8:30pm. Only reason for the second star was the movie Ex Machina they put on a screen near the end of the night.
author: Bradford G.

description:
Thank you! Thank you!! For making my special order 
"Birthday Banana Bread Pudding" they don't normally take orders like this but when I told them Is that I am getting this pudding for a special occasion for a birthday! They made it for me!! Thank you chef! I really appreciate it and yes he liked the pudding especially with banana. 
Not just banana bread pudding but their dishes are very good with excellent service!!
author: Mika I.

description: This place has the best burger in the bay area for me, but having driven there several times (from Pacifica) to find the kitchen closed, it has become too frustrating.
author: Todd S.

description:
First thing-- the SMELL. The smell of the place alone makes one uneasy because it smells like an old antique shop mixed with food (I don't know about anyone else here, but antique shop smells give me  a chill). There's also some old hangers in the corner...?

Civic burger is one of the most amazing burgers I've tasted (they add brie, which I've never seen in a burger before). I asked for them to cook it medium. Unfortunately, they brought out a burger that was very red and looked like it was just dropped on the grill for a couple seconds. The inside was COLD and very, very rare.  

Service was OK, but I had to wait for about 10 minutes before someone came out and acknowledged my presence. Didn't seem friendly at all.  Would highly advise not going to this place if you want to have a good dining experience.
author: Sasha V.

description: Not a reliable eatery like it used to. I have to admit, the last time I came here was more than 3 years ago, but the cook staff must have changed. One shining dish was the mac n cheese, which came out with a perfect balance of different cheeses and a consistency that was neither too creamy or too curdy. I ordered the fried chicken entree, which I regretted. It had a funny sour, pickle taste that I later suspected to be tobasco sauce used in the batter. I am pretty adventurous when it comes to foods, but the flavor didn't go well and kind of repulsive. The pork ragu was underwhelming. Both entrees were recommended by the waitress. Soluna is no longer my go-to place before a performance at the civic center.
author: Calforever C.

description: They were clearly unprepared to handle a pre concert rush.  Even though we had a reservation, the service was slow and not particularly friendly.
author: M L.

description: Cozy, laid back, lovely. Glad this little cafe was open today when it's normally closed (thank your SF Pride!). The food was satisfying. The drinks were good. And order an affogato. It's not on the menu but they'll make it for you.
author: Daniel H.

description: Some friends and I stopped here to have drinks before a concert. My friend had macaroni and cheese and said it was amazing. I had a vodka soda water and it was well made. Not a complex drink, but everyone else who had more interesting orders was satisfied. Our server was great and service overall was great!
author: John R.

description: I orderer the Civic burger and fries and it was on point.  It was honestly one of the best burgers I've had since I  moved up to the bay. I sat  at the bar and the bartender was really friendly. The bartender taught me a thing two about whiskeys in general and had introduced me to some great drinks that I never had before. Thanks Soluna, I'll definitely be back.
author: R B.

description:
Where do I start? If you have a wedding at City Hall, DO NOT book this restaurant for your lunch. I should have known this place was going to be bad when I first tried to book it. Soluna was a referral. First it was soo hard trying to book this place. There was a lot of back and forth because you cant call to book the venue. Everything is done online. First the website wasn't working. Long story short it took a month to book it. They kept saying they never received my card info for the reservation. They finally found it the day before we were supposed to eat there. 

They wouldn't let us be seated early. The reservation was for 12:30. By 11:15 we were done at City Hall. They said they couldn't seat us until 12:30  because of the contract we signed. Then they wouldn't let is order drinks at the bar. If anyone ordered drinks before 12:30, it was going to be on a separate tab. Mind you, we had to reach a $1000 minimum. We were at $930. 
When it finally came time to being seated, they said we couldn't order until 12:30. They didn't take our order until 12:40 -___-

One of my guest wanted to order fries on the side and the waiter told her they we're going to start the fryer for 1 side order of fries. ( remember we have a minimum cap to reach) do these damn people not want to make money????!!!

Amongst the other problems and terrible service heres a good one! My best friend and a few other people ordered Sangria's. The waitress comes back with 1 and says,  "we ran out of Sangria". How do you run out of Sangria on a Friday when your restaurant opens at 11:30am? Its dead inside and my reservation was for 12:30? So then she says they made it two days ago snd thats all that was left ! Wtf?!!! Don't come here they suck!
author: Kandi B.

description: Wonderful dinner menu. Excellent service. Thoroughly enjoyed it. I ordered the sesame ahi tuna and he the brisket. Tuna was seared rare. Brisket was soft and flaky. Bar at entrance was lively and responsive.
author: Kirsten F.

description:
If their food was any good, this place could make a killing because they're so close to the all the show venues ... actually they probably still make a killing even without having good food.

The shishito peppers come with some weird sauce that has no matching flavor, and no seasoning. The patatas bravas are dry and flavorless. The halibut is subpar. The bread pudding is super dry, oddly congealed and disgusting. Does any of that sound good to you?

Do yourself a favor and go somewhere else.
author: Akash K.

description: Cockroach!! Stay away came in for drinks and saw a huge cockroach crawling up the wall behind us ! Stay away . You have been warned
author: Mike E.

description:
When I came I haven't had a steak in a long while, so I decided to try the filet mignon! From what I remember it was cooked perfectly with the sauce that added a lot of flavouring to the filet mignon. Also the whole dish worked nicely together to create a coherent piece that made you want more.

Everything was cooked perfectly together, and I'd love to come back and try something new. Even though the Filet mignon was extremely satisfying!
author: Christopher L.

description:
Service - Excellent.

Interior - Sweet, cozy, comfy, and intimate. It's a place to impress a date for the setting rather than the food. Do not bring your extended family here. This is a place meant for parties for 4 or less. 

Location - Perfect if your main event is at the SF Opera, Orpheum Theater, or Bill Graham afterwards.

Brussel Sprouts - Soft, boiled, tasty, and chewy.

Mac n Cheese - Spiral noodles, soft, cheesy, and more powdery than saucy.
author: Ee Vonn Y.

description:
My husband and I were hesitant to try this place because of the many recent poor reviews. We are so glad we chose this spot for dinner, though. Yes, it is very convenient to the Orpheum for a pre-show dinner, but that was actually not the deciding factor in our dinner choice. After looking at many menus in the area, the sample food and drink menus that Soluna offers on their website seemed like the kind of food and drink we would enjoy. So we went despite the terrible current reviews, and despite the fact that the menu online is only a sample and not an actual current menu.

Our experience was wonderful, thankfully. We had reservations and were seated at a nice little table immediately. Drinks were ordered and received promptly, and I do love a good creative cocktail! My husband and I shared the mac and cheese to start and it was very tasty, no complaints there. I had the spring vegetable risotto and my husband had the pork ragu for our entrees. Both were delicious, and I the risotto was enough to take half home for later. We also indulged in vanilla ice cream and chocolate mousse for dessert, again, both treats were delicious. 

We have absolutely no complaints about the quality of the food, the cocktails, or the staff. We felt everything was friendly, polite, well paced, and tasty. And a 6pm reservation was the right time for an 8pm show at the Orpheum considering we wanted a leisurely 3 course meal. We also noticed that this place was well attended. Not overly crowded busy, but most tables full and enjoying themselves. I think we would consider this for a pre-show dinner again in the future.
author: Evey G.

description: This is a miserable restaurant...starting from the rude host when you walk in to this dated restaurant. The restaurant also has a smell which reminded me of my grandmother's basement. The food is way over priced and is just medicore. The only redeeming aspects of this restaurant was the server. She did an excellent job and was very engaging. There are so many wonderful restaurants in San Francisco, but this is not one of them.
author: David S.

description: I usually have the civic burger here, which is a feast for the eyes as well as the mouth, but your belly usually feels yuck afterwards due to the grease.. so today, i tried the tuna nicoise salad. When it came out, i was shocked at the amount of tuna.. where is it? Only four tiny slices? For $16, that's all i get? Overall the taste was good, the fried capers were interesting, but at $16 for 4 small slices of tuna, i dont think i'll order it again..
author: Sal K.

description:
2 stars because other waiters/bartenders are better than the one I am about to describe, so that makes this 1 star review a 2 star review.

Edit- I just returned to pick something up, and since the Bartender by then had read my receipt, instead of apologizing, he said if "If you think I was rude, then you don't have to return" in front of his staff, to which I replied "I don't want to" and then he said "Good" as I left. Wow. 

Why bother being rude, if you can't handle being called out?

--
I am in the restaurant as I type this from my iPhone because the Male Bartender with the Grey Vest and glasses is rude to me each time I visit, and today is the last straw.

He constantly ignores me to take orders of people who arrive after me. Like literally as people are walking in he seats them and gets them drinks, and takes away their menus which shows they have already ordered. He gets them water and their water glass, and ignores me even though I sit right across from him.

Today, when I made eye contact and he finally came over, he took my order cold as ice. Then when he returned to give me water he slammed the glass on my table.

I almost asked "why did you do that?" But he seems like the type to try and play it off like it was no big deal...

Anyways, after he provided me with the food I noticed there was a Human hair on the dish...
I didn't bother to say anything because I am on my work lunch break and I don't want to be late returning to work.

He never bothered to check if everything was okay... even though he checked with others, and it wasn't that busy.

Another waitress also ignored me and it was clear this was a them thing, so after politely and quietly eating my food to ensure I get out as quickly as possible, I decided to post this review as I fill out the receipt making a note to acknowledge that he was mean.

Maybe this will get them to realize bad service reflects on them, and they need to try to be at least neutral if they cannot be bothered to be nice.
author: Mitch U.

description:
I'd have given a 2.5 but not a 3; more a 2.  Hubby ordered 2 beers and they didn't have either. Settled for a Stella.  I ordered a champagne cocktail and the only thing the waiter could relate to was Kir Royale. Good bread, interesting grilled shishito peppers with romesco sauce.  Hubby ordered a Tuna Nicoise ... no dressing. Seriously?  I ordered steamed clams. Yum. Had Spanish chorizo and large white beans. Nice surprise!  Good cappuccino!  

Be aware: online menus are samples. No truffle fries tonight. Waiter looked like deer in headlights when I asked.  I was looking forward to it too.  Oh well!
author: Chary P.

description:
You only get one chance to make a first impression. 

We stopped in for a quick drink and snack during happy hour.   The service at the bar was warm and friendly when we were ordering.  We are not really drinkers and didn't know what to order or what we were doing.  The bartender could have been snobby about it, but he was super gracious and genuinely nice and funny about helping us pick a cocktail.  They were delicious too!  You are good at what you do, so thanks for that, Mr. Bartender, who is tall, with black hair and thick/dark rimmed glasses. 

We also ordered some fries but they were a huge disappointment. 

This one dish told me everything I needed to know about this establishment and maybe management or an owner should take note:   Your kitchen staff does NOT care about food it is sending out of your kitchen.   If they do care and it was just a major error, then perhaps more quality control is needed as dishes leave the kitchen.  Seriously. I would have been embarrassed to serve these to my family. let alone paying customers. 

What came out of the kitchen was an admittedly generous sized bowl of fries for $7; however we were given the serious dregs of the batch. They were mostly the little tiny pieces left at the bottom of the fryer.  On top of that, they were not AT ALL fresh and had obviously been sitting around for awhile, barely even lukewarm.   I'm not being snowflake picky, this was egregious.   These were not fit to serve guests, they should have gone straight in the garbage. Kitchen staff that cared or took pride in their work would have taken a minute to make a fresh batch.  

We each only ate a couple bites and left them because it wasn't worth the calories to eat the stale, bottom of the barrel leftovers. 

The tables were bused behind us and in front of us, but we were ignored.  It would have been nice if someone checked on us to ask if we wanted another drink or asked if everything was OK since we obviously left 99% of the fries.   

The bright side is that at least it was happy hour and so it wasn't an expensive disappointment.  There are so many other food choices in the area so we won't be back.
author: T J.

description:
Came here before going to see a show at the Orpheum. It was pretty busy since it was during happy hour on a Friday and we didn't make reservations so we decided to sit at the bar to eat. My husband and I both ordered the Civic Burger & Fries, I added an egg and avocados on mine. It's a good sized burger and it's pretty well seasoned. 

The service was a bit slow but at least the server acknowledged us and apologized for the delay. There's bread available upon request and they're served warm with butter and sea salt. The location is convenient to the theater. I could see the beautiful City Hall from where we were sitting. Despite being busy, we finished just in time to make it to our show.
author: Candice J.

description:
REVIEWER # 443

I never knew this place existed until my girlfriends and I came here for happy hour!

Soluna Café is conveniently located near the Civic Center Bart and just blocks away from the City Hall this place is truly legit to be in such a rusty area!

When I walked in I noticed that the decor is really interesting and dramatic there's lots of reds, neat-looking seating, and beautiful lighting the original artwork on the walls just tops it off. Many foodies hear about this place as it's located near the Opera performances, good for late night eats, or after visiting the Asian Art Museum across the street. 

If you are not able to park on the street (Can be very difficult) there is parking at the McAllister underground parking across the street. 

The menu provided plenty of options from appetizers to entrees. The signature cocktails were exciting and innovative!! We tried several appetizers; each one was a local seasonal delight.

Happy hour is weekdays from 2:30PM-7PM. I sat at the bar and was able to chat with the amazing bartender Ron, who I have to admit, he makes AMAZING drinks! This was my first time at the restaurant and once I sat at the bar I was approached immediately. Currently they have a check-in for a $5 drink and I was able to present that at the bar and Ron had no problem making me one of those fancy dranks! I tried those Truffle fries which were DELICIOUS!

Customer service here is PHENOMENAL. After my ladies came to meet me at the bar we went  back and forth on if we wanted to continue receiving great customer service with Ron or head to a table but Ron persuaded us to enjoy ourselves at a table and we would receive the same phenomenal service, and we did! 

What a great restaurant! Love the decor and atmosphere, and the food is PHENOMENAL.

It's an undiscovered gem! Definitely check it out if in the area! The happy hour is legit! 

Review # 37/196
author: Porsche C.

description:
Literally some of the worst service I've ever received. My husband and I ate here last night before Hamilton. I work close by and go to Soluna frequently for the happy hour, but have never ordered food before. It took our server 10-15 minutes to even acknowledge us after we were seated. Instead of greeting us properly, he turned to us from the table adjacent to ours and said "since I'm over here, did you want to order something?" It was evident that this place was a mess so we quickly put our food in. It took another 5-10 minutes for our server to bring us a drink menu, and probably another 10 minutes after that for my husband to receive his beer. Our food arrived about 45-50 minutes after we arrived. The temperature of my food was inconsistent and the portion was tiny. I'm sorry, this isn't a fine dining establishment. For $23, I expect more food. 

Everyone around us was irritated and having a similar experience. There was a lot of eye contact happening between our table and other customers. At the end of our meal, we waited 10-15 minutes for our server to bring the check. When it became clear that this wasn't happening, we went to the front to pay. 

Awful service and mediocre food. There are too many good dining options in this city for me to ever even considering stepping foot in this place again. One and done!
author: Jen S.

description: We had the best experience here! Got some scotch flights and lunch before going to the symphony. The fried chicken sandwich and fish and chips were on point. Mom and daughter day in the city for the win!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Soluna Cafe and Lounge might just be the perfect place to have a quick, affordable, and unassuming meal before you head to a show at the nearby Orpheum Theater or the San Francisco Opera or Symphony. 

My friend got tickets to "The Book of Mormon" and we needed a place to go to get a quick bite before the show. After rattling off a number of places to try, my friend suggested Soluna mainly because of the happy hour burger special is considered a good deal: $18 for what they call a "Civic Burger" along with a side of fries (or arugula salad), a huge pilsner sized draft beer and a shot of bourbon. It's a good deal and well worth the price. Judging by previous reviews and other articles I've looked at, it looks like that 18 dollars is an increase in price from just a few years ago. But I digress, you get what you pay for I suppose.

I have to admit, I get jaded by burgers living here in the Bay Area after all we are the food capitol of the world, yes that includes gourmet hamburgers as well! But for some reason I thought the Civic Burger at Soluna Cafe tasted amazing! In hindsight, I know why this was true: it was topped with triple cream brie cheese! It tasted like something that I've never had before. (Which on a burger, I hadn't!) That combined the house-ground all-natural beef with arugula, crispy onions, black garlic aioli served on brioche bun all the more tantalizing. I couldn't believe it myself!

The fries were adequate, the ale beer was fine, oh and the bourbon shot went down very very slowly! But that burger was a true revelation! And if you check in on your yelp app you get a "Check In Drink" for only five dollars! For that Thursday it was a combination of tropical flavors with a tinge of beer. I don't exactly know the name of that drink (because on my receipt, it only says Check In), but I have to admit it it tasted really vibrant and actually quenched my thirst! (More than the beer and the bourbon did, but hey that's just me) 

Now is Soluna the best place to dine in the Tenderloin/ Civic Center area? Probably not, but it was an affordable and tasty option within walking distance to our theater and my friend and I were both pleased with the meal we ordered and the bill we paid. This place is a real hidden gem in what could be considered a tough neighborhood in downtown SF. I'm just glad it's there so people can have options while enjoying themselves in the so-called "theater district" of the city.
author: Jason F.

description: This was a good place for dinner before the ballet.  Short walk to either the Opera House or Symphony Hall.  Great food, service and a full bar if you just want cocktails.
author: Catherine F.

description: I am a frequent customer of Soluna. I love the food, the drinks and the staff. They have great cocktails, and the chicken sandwich is bomb!!! In contrast to a recent review, the bartender in question was great. He checked on me frequently, joked with me, and I enjoyed my time there. Perhaps if the recent reviewer tipped, or acknowledged the staff as human beings on any number of his previous visits, his service would have been better.
author: Nikki A.

description:
Was hoping to find a fun little place with interesting food when this restaurant was recommended as a pre-theater dinner spot. It was not.
It was quite empty when we walked in -- only a handful of people at the bar and no tables filled yet. We (all women) were given the only table I would not have chose. My seat looked directly at the men's room door. Strike one.
The cocktail list looked really interesting and I was looking forward to trying the rhubarb margarita. When I asked for them to leave out the jalapeno juice (I can't tolerate pepper/s of any kind), I was snootily told that we could not "compromise" the bartender's drinks and my only option was the regular margarita. I respect that bartenders work to create their art, but the response was a bit over the top. The drinks we ended up with were fine, but none of us ordered a 2nd drink (which is highly unusual for this group). Strike two.
I ordered the ahi tuna and I ate it. It was room temperature. It was fine -- but not great. The greens on top had sat there too long and had soaked up the tuna taste making them unappetizing. One friend ordered the cheese & meat board and was pleased with the cheeses, but left the salami saying it was only average at best. No one raved about their meal. Strike three.
We didn't even give dessert a chance here, and left as quickly as possible. What I expected to be a leisurely dinner with drinks and laughter to fill a few hours before the theater turned out to be a tolerable meal with little redeeming value. 
(Thankfully the show at the Orpheum was a blast and our evening was saved!)
author: Betsy A.

description:
Came here for GNO with one of my fave girls who suggested this spot
All in all it was a chill spot with a lot of variety of drinks and food. I have to say the drinks were so good! Very tasty and loved the random concoctions they came up with...
so why 3 stars you ask....
we saw a mouse running in the restaurant!!
And what killed me was the servers reaction.. he said " oh ya that happens every now and then"
yuck! no thanks
author: Natasha I.

description: This restaurant is around the corner from my office, so we often have business lunches and happy hours here out of convenience. I've been here dozens and dozens of times over about ten years, and I can wholeheartedly say I've NEVER had a great experience. I only go when coworkers insist. The service is sub par, the staff is not welcoming or professional, the food that comes to the table is often different than what you ordered. And last but not least, almost every single time, no matter what time of day, they have been out of staple ingredients listed on the main menu. It's a dreary outdated restaurant and I'm surprised this place is still open. However, the location attracts so many passer by from the museums and theaters that they must make enough of a profit to stay open. Just not enough to replenish their inventory! If you are looking for a place to eat near the theater, go to Corridor or Villon instead.
author: Steenie K.

description: I came here for lunch and got the Civic Burger (add bacon and egg) with the soup of the day. The tomato soup was forgettable, but the burger was delicious. You don't want the burger anything other than medium - nice and juicy that way. One thing I would change about the Civic Burger is to opt out of having brie in the burger unless it's your favorite cheese. It was not fully melted when my burger arrived, and also had rind on it (maybe this is intentional?), and it was just not a very pleasant addition. Would definitely get the burger again though.
author: Austin W.

description: The food was not very good, and way over priced. They didn't have anything on the menu that particularly stood out but the food seemed to be a little over pretentious considering the location and the style of restaurant. 17 for a salad without chicken was a little high, which I would be ok with paying if they gave me more than one romaine heart... and dressing.. needless to say, the food wasn't very good, the portions were incredibly small and the pricing is high for what you're getting (the cheeseburger was about 20$).
author: Jannet H.

description: With so many options, why go here? Our waiter Brennan was a bit of a jerk. Seriously, you can't muddle a piece of fruit in my drink? After 4 attempts I just skipped it. Dinner was meh. The entire staff just needs a manager and a menu overhaul. We won't be back. Do check in on yelp though for a drink special... we didn't get it because I checked in when we were leaving.
author: Maureen B.

description: Meh (mostly as to the food).  Even in the Civic Center area, there are better options.
author: Gene G.

description: Excellent fried chicken... absolutely delicious! Crispy on the outside, juicy inside - just what I felt like! Soluna lost a star because they wouldn't serve white meat only.  Unfortunately, I don't care for thighs or drumsticks, so I had to give away 2/3 of my meal.  I had a bite of the Mac and cheese and that was really good too!  Good service and convenient to the opera.  I'll be back.
author: Amanda H.

description:
Great spot to get food before a show at the Orpheum!  I had the black cod with creamy polenta, tomatoes and pesto, and it was absolutely delicious.  My friends raved over the butternut squash risotto.  We shared the brown sugar brussels sprouts, which were among the best brussels sprouts I've ever had... perfectly caramelized with lots of crunchy bits.

I like that the small plates, which are all so tempting, are also sides for the large plates.  

$5 Yelp special cocktail with check in!  I had the wine instead, which allowed my friend to have two :)   

Make a reservation.
author: Linda M.

description:
My boyfriend and I went to dinner here before I surprised him with the Lion King at the Orpheum. While the wine, the app, and my boyfriend's dish was quite excellent - I ordered the cod and it may have been the most flavorless thing that I have ever tasted. Nothing on that plate had flavor. Not to mention I had several bones I had to pick out of my mouth. I think it was also the most expensive thing on the dinner menu - or at least close to it.

The women next to us didn't seem to have a great experience either because one [also] had a bunch of bones in her dish and the other had some piece of WIRE in her dish. The stand in / acting manager was "pleasant" to them and I was able to hear the conversation - keep in mind the tables are so damn close together there is no privacy... so I wasn't just eavesdropping (although I would have if I heard someone found wire in their food).

We definitely will not be visiting this establishment again.
author: Tabitha T.

description: Had the tuna salad, the tuna was really fishy, when I returned it the manager "informed me" that the chef had validated the fish was fine, so basically I was wrong to return it. On a $200+ bill they refused to take off the salad...  I gave it 1 star because I can't give it 0 stars.
author: Michael J.

description:
Had dinner here with my girlfriend before going to see Hamilton.  Shortly after we sat down, I was shocked to witness a mouse scamper from somewhere near under our table and run across the walkway under our neighboring diners' table.

I wrote an e-mail to Soluna Cafe to let them know about this.  They did not even extend the courtesy of a response (even after I followed up with a second e-mail).

Stay away from this place.
author: Ben S.

description:
I've been to this place on more than one occasion as a law student. Now as a graduate, I write this review. This place has on more than one occurrence served my needs for alcoholic beverages (as one might expect; lawyers drink). But each time I can remember getting food here, I have had horrendous experiences. 

I only give this place 2 stars because I have had good experiences with the bartenders and waiters before, who are usually very courteous. The drinks are usually pretty satisfactory, although seemingly a little steep for the tenderloin. This is SF after all.

I recall two particularly terrible experiences ordering food here. 

During my first week of law school back in 2012, I remember getting a chicken salad (it wasn't Caesar, I cannot recall the exact salad) with the students in my legal writing class and our academic advisor.  This salad was horrible. I felt nauseous and wanted to puke right there in front of my classmates. Nervous and ashamed, I said nothing, but couldn't hide my revolt from my other peers. They asked me what was wrong and finally they got me to admit what was bothering me. With their help, I managed to send it back and get a replacement order. I felt horribly embarrassed and did not return there except to meet for drinks after a class. 

Another time, which I had hoped would prompt my friend to write a review (he is also an avid Yelp reviewer), was particularly memorable. On the last Pride of this year, 2015, my friend and I, faced with no reasonable alternative, happened upon this place near my school. I recommended this place because I thought others in my school liked it, and I had forgotten my previous experience at this time. We went in and fortunately got a seat. My friend ordered a chicken burger and I do not remember what I ordered. My friend had to send his order back because for one reason or another the chef had ignored specific requests (it was something less picky than "no pickles please"). 

The chef then sent back the order partially RAW. Fortunately this was discovered before consumption. My friend and his female companion cut the sandwich in half to discover that it had been not fully cooked. He sent it back, understandably disgusted. In this moment, I had uncovered the repressed memory of the salad.  To this day he gives me flack for having poor taste (for that, I blame the inflated review status on yelp). But I digress. 

If ever given a choice, I would much prefer Lalita's down the street. They have really great bar food and places to sit and talk. 

In any case, I strongly do not recommend ever ordering food here if you must come here.
author: Robert M.

description: Host isn't very friendly. Waiters said ordering food is on hold cause the bar is too busy. Bar tender is nice enough though.
author: Danny L.

description: Only two stars because the customer service was disappointing.  Despite the lack of attention from our waiter, smug manager, and the missing meal....we enjoyed the food.
author: Veronica Y.

description: This place is just plain awful.  The bartenders are slobs who don't clean the bar.  The couldn't get service there - they actually took my credit card to start a tab and never came back to take my order.  After 15 minutes, I asked to speak to the manager.  He said they were really busy.  They actually were not.  The restaurant was half empty and so was the bar.  I had to ask for my credit card back several times because he wouldn't give it back to me.  He wanted to argue on whether it was fair for me to expect prompt service after they took my credit card.  It was ridiculous.
author: Christine A.

description:
Soluna is our go-to restaurant in the Civic Center area.  It is conveniently located, very close to the Orpheum Theatre (2 minute walk). Davies Symphony Hall, SF Jazz and the Opera House are less than half mile (10 min walk).  

The ambiance is upscale casual, with delicious food and attentive service.  We had a 6:30 reservation on a Tuesday night,  due to traffic we were a half hour late.  We called to let them know of the delay, when we arrived we were seated immediately, they took care of us and go the entrees on the table in 15 min, after fighting traffic for 90 minutes, it was a great to relax a bit before showtime and the food was delicious.  

Tip, if you get up there at 7pm you can park in the permit-only spaces across from City Hall.
author: Mr Kitty K.

description:
The service is... well, nonexistent.  Really, believe the other reviewers when they say the service is bad.  The waiters just walk your table without making eye contact to avoid you.  Our water glasses were empty, our cocktail glasses were empty.  Even getting them to take our order took forever.

I chose this restaurant for its close proximity to the Orpheum, which was great.

Food was average.

I will not be going back, as the poor service trumps location and food.
author: Jessica C.

description: So I came into this thinking ok maybe the service has improved from what People say in the reviews...nope. The host was chatting away with the bartender as we stood there waiting and the bartender kept looking at us and said nothing to the host. Finally we were greeted and seated. We were sitting there waiting for our waiter. I saw all the waiters talking to each other and kept trying to get one of their attention. Finally 10 min later- no joke 10 min she came over to greet us and offer us water. The food was shockingly delicious but unfortunately the customer service was majorly lacking. I had the pork chops and it was delicious except it said it was going to have butternut risotto and it had a green pea risotto instead so big bummer.
author: Heather S.

description: I've been coming to Soluna Cafe for years, especially before shows at the Orpheum. I've always had a terrific time, especially at their happy hour (which fills up quickly). Last week I had my first experience needing help from them after a small issue with my bill, and they were extremely responsive, resolving the issue quickly and easily (thanks, Dave!). This remains one of my favorite spots in the city!
author: Royce C.

description:
Really liked this. Stopped for lunch, nice gourmet comfort foods.  Grilled cheese with gruyere and tomato soup, fresh goods, house made.  Found a nice granache-sauvignon, 
Nice chill spot while touring.
author: Stuart R.

description:
Customer Service is lacking. Would like to give a higher rating, but was very disappointed with the service, bar & manager. 
I do have to say, food was good.
author: Trish W.

description:
Decent experience before a night out. I feel as though it's a bit over priced though. 

Really great Mac and cheese, the drinks where fancy, and was pretty fast and good service considering I think they were trying to close.

Would go here for a small bite and a drink or two not much more.
author: Kathleen D.

description: We just got drinks here. But the $5 check in drink was amazing and the happy hour special was $7 for a delicious whiskey concoction. If you need a spot to catch up with a friend and have a drink this place works.
author: ReG C.

description:
I was skeptical at first why this place only received 3 stars, but I was recommended by a friend who had been there before.

They have an awesome combo for happy hour - Beer, Bourbon and Burger.  Great idea.  All three were excellent.  In hindsight, I would have chosen the cheddar instead of brie for cheese.

Will definitely come back again.
author: Lawrence G.

description: Loved this small little gem. You need reservations because they don't serve food at the bar but we were able to get one in 15 minutes on Open Table while taking BART in to see Hamilton.   I don't get the bad reviews, at all. Food and fun cocktails were great, as well as the service. We told them we were rushed to make the show and they totally accommodated us. I will definitely go back!  Thank you Florindas!
author: Joan P.

description:
I really used to love this place, and I don't want to be saying what's coming but I can't hold my tounge any longer.   I used to go here somewhat often, like once every other week.   Matt and Carlos were amazing but they have since moved onto their next amazing adventure which is actually delicious and great.  In their wake, sadly, lies Solana.   I've gone 3 times to Solana since my dudes moved on, and each time it's been the same issue.   To begin, I order their great deal, the burger bourbon and beer combo.  I sit at the bar, waiting for a server to order,  today I waited 10 minutes,  then I wait to get my drink, today I waited 30 minutes, as I tried to get the serves attention, I get a wonderfully curt, just a second,  before he disappears for five minutes.   Finally he comes by and before I can ask for my beer he tells me, your burger is on the way.   Great, but I'm still waiting for my beer.   As for time, I ordered my food before my friends go there, they were able to order and drink their drinks before I even got my first one, I tried to signal to someone to get it but no.   Finally I have to basically reorder it, and he sees he didn't snag my beer and says looks like I already poured it, here ya go.  I said no, I don't want stale beer I want fresh beer please pour me another.  He does so, I eat my food and that's that.  

Here's the essence of why I'm mad,  not once in the two hours I was there did the guy apologize for delays.   I used to work behind the bar, and I knew when I messed up, I owned up to it, and it usually led to getting a decent tip.  Maybe I'm a hard ass but my rule is no apology, no effort, no tip.  The only time he came to talk to me after I ate was to see why I didn't sign my check.   I wanted to, but it was taken before I could.   So I wrote be better, didn't tip and left.  I got home and a friend text me saying I'm banned. I'm not sure why, but honestly, I'm fine with that because I'm so done with this place.   Service is literally the worst I've ever seen.   Food is fine, a little salty, but otherwise good.  Just sad to see how far such a great place has fallen.
author: Ryan B.

description:
Do not make the mistake of passing this place up!!

My boyfriend and I came here for our anniversary, partly because the open table rating was so high. Upon arrival, we noticed the restaurant was almost empty (8pm on a Thursday). I prepared to make the most of it, but expecting a less than stellar experience. I was wrong.

I was born and raised in San Francisco, so not only am I a bit of a "foodie," but I am a stickler for great service.  I could not have been more impressed.

It was a blessing in disguise that we found this hidden gem because we almost had the place to ourselves, and not 10 minutes after we got there, they lowered a projector and started playing office space with subtitles.

The servers were ON POINT, and the food was some of the best I've had.  Again, I'm a SF born and raised food snob.  Could not have been happier.
author: Sara H.

description: It's been awhile but I checked out this lounge/cafe for happy hour before the symphony yesterday. Had a wonderful experience. Very good wines by the glass and tasty bar bites. Cocktail menu looked awesome. Interiors are a pleasant escape from Civic Center area, which I happen to pass through frequently. I will have to go to Soluna more often. Good, friendly service too!
author: Sue D.

description:
This would be the Cheers of students at UC Hastings (seriously). The number of times I walk by this place and see at least one--if not more--of my friends in here getting drinks or food is insane. We come because, not only is it convenient, it's also a great atmosphere!

I won't make this a long review (shocking for me), but I will not leave without giving you this important information: order an old fashioned and order the fries. That's all. Be on your way... To Soluna, of course!

Plus: The bartenders are ALL super nice and really get to know their fans. Yes, we're fans.
author: Gabriela K.

description: Rude and unfriendly staff, online menu different from house menu, no substitutions, food and drinks overpriced for what you get. And to top it off the food was lousy. Wouldn't give any stars, but Yelp doesn't give that option.
author: Josiah P.

description: It's a bigger space than I initially thought. Made reservations for 5 thinking it would be busy, definitely not needed. Maybe because we came on a weeknight during the holidays, but it was completely empty except for 2 local patrons.  Food was good and drinks were amazing. Would definitely come back but hopefully on a livelier night.
author: Smita B.

description:
I've passed by this place hundreds of times in the past decade, but I've never been inside - until Friday. 

What a treat! Surprisingly roomy and attractive space. Yummy appetizers, terrific wine and excellent service! 

I'll definitely be back.
author: Kim C.

description:
Went to Soluna recently on the way to the Orpheum. Didn't have a reservation, so ended up in the bar, with a limited menu to select from. We had the special which I think is a standard =- $16 for a cheeseburger, fries, draft beer and a shot of bourbon (?). 

The burger was DELICIOUS, and so was the beer. You're going to get a fancy beer, not something gross from Milwaukee that no San Franciscan would ever drink. More importantly, the people working at Soluna were so very kind, to a one. 

My only complaint is that it's probably time for new tables in the bar area - the existing ones are pretty dinged up, and the bathroom has seen better days too. But I look forward to returning and having a proper dinner in the dining room!
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
I saw a rat scurry across dining room floor.

Stopped in on 11/23 with a few friends before a show at Bill Graham. On this particular night, presumably because of the holiday, the place was empty. As my friends took a spot at the bar, I went to use the restroom. I then spotted a rat run across dining room and under a table. I immediately turned around, grabbed friends and left.

Never again.
author: Brian M.

description: Ewe this place needs to be checked by the Heath department. They seemed to think nothing of a cockroach running across the bar around my food plate. The waiter was kind enough to kill it. But they failed to even flinch or even apologize to us. I will never ever go back to this place.
author: Penelope S.

description:
My boyfriend and I were going to a show at the Orpheum (on a weekday), and we decided to come to Soluna because it was recommended by the SHN website along with 3 other restaurants. They also have a "free dessert when you present your Orpheum ticket" deal. 

We had been assured by the hostess that we would be seated with ample time to order, eat, get to our show, etc. We told her in advance about the dessert deal and that we were going to a show. 

We weren't seated until about 30 minutes after she had told us we would be. The server completely ignored us for about 15 minutes. The people at the table next to us were sending their food back because it wasn't thoroughly cooked. We finally ordered and waited..and waited...the server told us that it was a busy night, the kitchen was going to complete our order next, etc., but still nothing. 

Eventually, it was about 15 minutes to showtime and I flagged down a different server. He went to check and told us that our ticket never printed in the first place, so our order was never placed and was never started. At this point, we had to leave, so we left, very hungry, very grouchy, and with nothing to show for the remarkably long time we spent sitting there. 

Ultimately, we had peanut M+Ms for dinner at the show. They were pretty good! 

The SHN website also recommends SAMs American Eatery, The Hall, and First Crush. https://www.shnsf.com/Online/default.asp?BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::permalink=orpheumtheatre&BOparam::WScontent::loadArticle::context_id=#restaurants
author: Victoria K.

description:
Great place to go before the show at Orpheum. We started out with chesses and some kind of beef it was really good, I had Halibut it was about 4 stars
Service was nice and I couldn't expect anymore
author: Donald M.

description:
Wow, first of all, they have Happy Hour and that's not posted.  So close and convenient to the Civic Center so we tried it last night despite some of the bad reviews.  We really loved the 2;30-?pm happy hour prices, made good use of the drink and food specials and were pleasantly surprised.  

However!  This place is all about the view.  From the bar you get the glorious Civic Center at every seat and there's a small, City run community garden just out the window, so this was our view.  How impressive!  I highly recommend this place for pre- or post-theatre crowd, although it was closed by 11pm when we left the Opera.

~ Ms. Ali
author: A W.

description:
I have been here many times for lunch during the week, and would fully recommend it. Delicious food, great prices and a lovely atmosphere. 

I also booked my small, afternoon wedding reception here a couple of years ago. We had about 30 guests. The food was a small-bite buffet which turned out absolutely wonderful, followed by light dessert. We also had an open bar for our guests. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a delightful, yet relaxed wedding reception, especially if you're walking over from City Hall. Looking forward to spending my next anniversary dinner here!
author: Carly A.

description:
I wasn't super impressed with this place. One dish I had was the chanterelle mushroom polenta. You could tell the mushrooms were reconstituted and not fresh. They were very stringy and overly chewy. The polenta was billed as "olive oil" polenta and tasted overly rich yet bland at the same time.

It might be an OK place just to return to for cocktails.
author: Emily T.

description:
The food is pretty descent, but a bit overpriced.  There is one bartender who is good, but aside from that I have found the bartenders a bit disorganized.  There is one employee (I believe the manager) who sits at the corner of the bar closest to the door (often wearing a sweater working on a laptop/tablet) who we asked to put on the game, and he responded, "Potentially."  We were taken a back at the gall of this.  He never put on the game and simply remained in his seat.  Perhaps he was having a bad day.  

Regardless, drinks there are generally good.  They have a solid pour, and good variety of liquor.  Its also nice having a place that offers food as well.
author: Sudarat P.

description:
Had a terrible experience at Soluna last week. We arranged for a party of 25 to have a special event here and it was a disaster due to a lousy manager and service. We gathered here for a gathering from 4:30-5:45 and weren't allowed to sit in the dining section, "that's reserved for dinner patrons", I was told by the manager on duty, who couldn't have cared less that we just brought in 10x the people in the place at 4:30 in the afternoon on a freaking Tuesday. No one was seated in the so-called dining area and there were only 4-5 other patrons in the entire place! The manager said we could only sit in little tables along the wall across from the bar, "the dining area is for people eating dinner". Mind you, we did the same thing a year before at the same time of day and were allowed to sit there. The manager didn't care.

Wait staff service was nearly non-existent, even though 4-5 of them stood around with not much to do. We were told by the surly manager only one waiter could serve us. We had trouble obtaining staples such as water, let alone food and beverages.

Needless to say, I will NEVER return to this bastion of bad service.
author: J L.

description: The WORST service. Don't come here if you are in a hurry, or are an introvert and don't feel comfortable literally flagging down the staff for every single thing you need. Been coming here for years out of convenience but every time I get frustrated with the service, especially in the bar. Also my friend ordered a salad with no peanuts and they brought them, good thing she's not allergic. We ended up leaving when we all wanted another drink because it took them so long and we got over it.
author: Chelsea L.

description:
Came here 2 days in a row. First day was on a Saturday (of Pride weekend) with my best friends and my partner. We had been walking around for a couple of hours looking to get a couple of drinks and kind of chill for a while. When we walked in we weren't greeted at all but still came in and sat at bar area. Still no greeting. We were discussing what kind of drinks we would have and it wasn't until then the bartender (middle aged, dark hair) chimed in and told us this was not a bar and they served cocktails and if we were looking for shots we should find a bar. Kind of rude but whatever ignored it.

 We ordered 2 Easy Breezy's since 2 of the 4 of us aren't really drinkers and wanted to test it out before they actually ordered one. Turns out my partner really liked it so we ordered an additional one. The bartender asked to give him a second as he was in the middle of making a drink. Totally understandable. First come, first serve... but then a gentleman comes and sit at the bar and he GREETS him and asks him if he would like to order. He then makes the guy drink serves him and makes another ( not an Easy Breezy) and THEN makes our drink. .. Hmm. He does ask if I would like another drink, I decline, take care of the tab and we make our way out. We left a $5 Tip since our drinks were good and got OK service. 

We come back the next with a few more people than the day before. This time we're looking to eat since we missed out on breakfast trying to catch the Parade. This time it's a lot more busy and a lot more crowded. We order our food at the bar and found a table. We're sitting at the table and a waitress walks up (dark brown hair, red lips, fair skin) to tell us we can't sit here since we ordered for take out at the bar and would have to have a card on file if we wanted to sit there. Never heard of it. I instantly picked up this snotty vibe from her. I thought it was crazy but my partner agreed to give her a card since it was "Policy". 

We are sitting for about 20 - 30 minutes and haven't heard anything about our food. Our waitress does not check on us. Not once. So I walk up to the bar area to politely ask a waiter (about 5"11, dark hair, brown skin, glasses) if he could check our order for us. His reply," I didn't take your order." ... Really? Like... I'm fed up at this point. Before I could get a word out a woman asks what my order was (I believe her name was Allison). I told her she said it wasn't ready yet. When it was ready she did bring it out to our table and asked if we needed anything else and even offered to put our food on plates and give us silverware. We declined because we were trying to make it an in and out thing. For the rest of our visit we were ignored and our waitress just looks our direction and rolls her eyes. Definitely did not leave a tip. We weren't serviced at all. 

Worst service ever. I will never come back here. Definitely need work on their customer service skills. At least towards their colored customers.
author: Kiara K.

description: Food was good but I lost my appetite when I saw A MOUSE running along the top of the booths!! A waiter saw it too and said the restaurant knows about the problem. He acted as if it happens all the time and like it wasn't a big deal. If that doesn't ruin your experience, the service definitely will.
author: Michelle D.

description:
The decor is nice. The service was attentive. The food was good. The location is good. 

I am not quite sure why Soluna only has 3 stars. However, I enjoyed the Ribeye steak and they even kept my group up to date on the Giants playoff game. 

Definitely take advantage of the $5 Secret Cocktail just by checking in on Yelp! It was very good! 

The server gave a great recommendation for a nice Kentucky bourbon and interacted well with our group of 7. The bar had a few patrons watching the baseball game but other than that, we were the only ones in the dining area. I don't know if Soluna just does most of their business on weekdays with the Civic Center crowd or was having an off night. 

The bottom line is that it was a nice spot, not super overpriced like some other places in the area (see Absinthe) and it can accommodate large groups or intimate meals. I'd recommend Soluna to others and I'll be a repeat customer.
author: Mark H.

description:
My friends and I had a reservation for 5:45 pm. We informed the wait staff that we had a show to catch at 7:30 pm. We did not get our food until after 7 pm. 

WHAT. THE. HELL.

We actually had to wave down our server so we could order. When the server was taking our order, she knocked over a glass of red wine all over my friend's purse -- AND she barely apologized! 

She came back with a towel to wipe up the table and offered my friend a HALF-GLASS of wine to replace what she spilled. Talk about cheap! 

Because of the wine fiasco, she never finished taking our food order!  

By 6:45 pm, we flagged down another server down to find our waitress so we could order and reminded them again that we had a 7:30 pm show. She ended up taking our order instead.

At 7 pm, we asked about our food and were told it was being plated. At 7:05 pm, our food came out -- oh, except for mine! My entree never came. I had to ask about my entree and the manager said it was going to be quick. I did not get my food until 7:15 pm. I pretty much had to have it boxed so we wouldn't be late for the show. The manager deducted my meal and one glass of wine. 

Overall, it was a pretty bad experience. We never saw our original server after she brought the towel. No one was rude or yelled at her; she just never came back to our table. The attempts at making things better were so minimal -- from the apology, to the half-glass of wine, to my entree. BOO.
author: Valerie C.

description:
I came here after the St. Patrick's Day Parade.... It was rather unimpressive.

Their beer list was full of the mega breweries that I avoid at all costs, so I ordered a brand name vodka martini.   My martini showed up, I kid you not, in a plastic cup.   The waitress said "sorry, we are all out of glasses".   I would have believed her, but when I went to the bathroom, I noted there were NO glasses being used in the entire facility.

A little latter I ordered another Martini but told her only if I was to get a standard glass.  Martini came, in a glass... but it was obvious to me they didn't pour the brand I asked for.

The food itself was all fried and unimpressive.

In a city full of awesome food, impressive beer lists and bartenders that know how to make a simple martini, I really see no reason to return.
author: David W.

description: Sitting down for dinner before a show. The overtly rude bartender was clearly unhappy when the hostess sat us in the bar for food. He abruptly approached the table and was increasing hostile to me and my partner. Unless the food blows us away, we won't return. We aren't especially precious but the eye rolling and histrionics felt unwelcoming.
author: Tadpole Z.

description: From the greeting to the check, this restaurant was fantastic!  We were seated quickly in a really nice area of the restaurant. It was a friends birthday and I'm so glad we picked Soluna.  Our waiter was spot-on, our drinks came quickly, and once we ordered, our meals came at a nice pace so we could talk a little. I had the chicken sandwich which was a gourmet treat!! I got it with a side of their halibut chowder. Both were to die for. My friend had the Thai salad and a side of fries. The fries came with wasabi ketchup...excellent!!!!!  We will return to Soluna!
author: Sandra P.

description: Great food, good service, perfect location close to Civic Center.
author: Elisabeth S.

description:
Soluna, is probably one of the only legitimate restaurants near the bill graham civic auditorium and I like it. Before going to a show one night, my bf and I were in a pickle, because we hadn't had dinner yet. We decided that because Soluna was so close by to the concert venue that we would give it a try.

Monday night they had some excellent happy hour specials. $1 off glasses of wine, and a burger, shot of burbon, and a pint of beer for $15. The burger was pretty darn good. I was so happy that when I ordered it "medium" and it actually came out cooked "medium" (no bloody ooze.) My bf ordered the mac and cheese minus the bacon, since he's vegetarian, and I would say it was only OK. I"m sure it is much better with the bacon.

The reason Soluna gets 3 stars instead of 4 or 5, is because of the weird service. Our waiter/bartender, who looked like he was also the owner, was super nice to us. While he was nice to us, he wasn't nice to everyone else that walked in the door. I will cut him some slack, since he looked like he was the only one working there that night, aside from the kitchen staff, but he did give some of the people walking in some serious attitude. He even told a couple of ladies he wasn't serving food anymore, even though it was only 6 p.m. and he had given them the bar food menu. If you aren't serving food, you don't hand people the food menu when they walk in. The way he told them he wasn't serving food was also pretty rude.

Overall, I'll probably be back here the next time I go to a show at the Bill Graham, but will need to arrive super early in order to avoid not being able to get a seat, or order food.
author: Mona H.

description: I went in today to have lunch and had my baby with me. I sat myself down in the bar area after i asked the bartender if that was ok (the back dining area was too small for my stroller) and he said it was fine. I didnt get a menu or had anyone come up to me to see what I wanted to order. Five minutes pass by and other people sat down in the area i was in and were quickly given a menu and water (I got neither) so i flagged down the waiter and asked for a menu and a cup of coffee. He brought me my coffee and no sugar. I had to flag him down for some. Then another good amount of time goes by and the same waiter doesnt come to check in with me but takes other people's orders. I finally had to flag him down to take my order. After I eat, he doesnt check in with me at all! I wanted water and he wouldnt even look at me. I got the bartender to get my check so i could finally pay and leave. I told him the waiter was completely ignoring me and didnt get an apology. Horrible service! I felt completely discriminated against. It felt as if he was ignoring me on purpose. Matthew is the waiter i unfortunately had today. Still left you a tip though, even if you didnt deserve it.
author: J Iliana L.

description:
I had a miserable experience at Soluna Café.

Our server was rude.  She made us wrong for the overly salty dinner selections we made.  She told us we should have arrived earlier to avoid any issues with making our show time at the Orpheum later that night.  She predictably DOUBLE CHARGED us on the tip after we left.  I'm almost certain this gal is running a racket.

The food was salty and the service was insulting.

Soluna banks on the Orpheum crowd to fill its tables.  I strongly recommend you dine elsewhere prior to your show.
author: Tiger S.

description: i work nearby so this place is convenient. the food is usually good (i love the fried chicken sandwich and the thai chicken salad) but the customer service leaves much to be desired. i've waited 10+ minutes after being seated for someone to acknowledge me. i've requested condiments that have never made it to the table. i recently i made a reservation online using opentable and left a note requesting a high chair. i didn't hear anything from the restaurant so i assumed all was good - wrong. they informed me when i arrived they don't have high chairs, something they could have called or emailed me to clarify prior to my reservation. the customer service is just not good.
author: Erin E.

description:
My husband and I came here for lunch on a Monday.  There were only 3 or 4 other parties during our time there so it was really slow.  I'd like to see how the energy is like during dinner service.  

We sat the booth-like area where the seats were couches, which gave a homey feel - but they were stained.  Points deducted for that.

Our server Roberto was really great.  He was friendly and knowledgeable about the dishes we asked about.  He even gave us a tip on a recipe my husband is eager to try.

My husband had the Civic Burger - really, really tasty.  The bun so was so light, the meat was juicy and the picked red onions added just enough saltiness.  It was presented on a little cutting board, which I thought was cute.  I had the mac & cheese, of course I opted to add panchetta.  It was OK.  We shared the truffle fries, which we enjoyed.  I thought the preserved lemon aioli was awesome and the ketchup with jalapenos and cilantro was pretty tasty.

For dessert, we ordered the White Chocolate Bread Pudding.  Roberto (addressed us by our names after he learned what they were - nice touch) warned us that the bread pudding takes the longest to make of all the desserts.  We weren't in a rush so we didn't mind.  Honestly, the wait didn't seem to be long at all.  Probably because after we took our first bite, we got so lost in the bread pudding that we weren't thinking about anything else.  The bread pudding was accompanied by a scoop of homemade vanilla bourbon ice cream - creamy, not too sweet, and the bourbon was not strong at all.  The bread pudding itself was awesome.  I loved the contrast in textures but especially loved the toasty, crunchy parts of the bread pudding.

Although the ambiance was lacking, we really enjoyed our meal.
author: Rose A.

description: Civic Center Burger: Best burger in the city. The meat is amazing, juicy, house ground.
author: Niki S.

description: LUNCH:  Terrific food paired with some of the slowest service I've ever experienced does not make a great time.  Sure, the carrot ginger soup was served hot with an interesting balance of spices; I really liked the ice tea; the shredded chicken salad with cranberries and blue cheese with green goddess was plenty big and delicious.  I also liked the environment, too.  But, OMG, the SLOW SERVICE!  We had to wait 10 min to get something to drink!  The waitress kept forgetting to bring items.  If the service improves significantly this place will be dynamite.
author: David S.

description:
Just like another reviewer, we too had a mouse experience.  We had a reservation before Hamilton and were seated in a booth.  Shortly after sitting and placing our order, I saw a mouse pop up and go back down from the corner of the booth.  We called the waitress over and as I was explaining what I saw the mouse popped back up and ran across to another booth.  The staff acted as if it was not a big deal and appeared annoyed that we did not want to sit there.  They said sometimes they open the back door and the mouse may have come in that way (the back door was closed at the time).  They then offered to seat us in the booth that the mouse had just jumped down into.  They said they would talk to the manager and we insisted we sit up front at a high top, not a booth where the mouse could hide.  (Yes, we probably should have left).  Once seated up front, no one made any comment about the mouse, the manager never came over.  Again, staff was not apologetic and rude when we had to ask for new waters and bread that we left at our initial table.

Aside from the mouse, the service was poor and the food was mediocre.  Even when the bill came, they just put it down and walked away as if nothing happened.

We called the next day to speak with the owner about what happened and they didn't care.  Their excuse was the mouse probably came in from nearby construction.  
Now this restaurant has two separate mouse spottings in less than two weeks...
author: H R.

description:
I was looking for a place to eat before going to the Orpheum and found this place. It's a very short walk from Civic Center BART & the Orpheum. I didn't know how busy it would be so I made reservations. Good thing I did as it was crowded.

Our server was great - friendly, efficient... check on us throughout the meal to see if everything was OK. Gave us another jug of water when she saw me emptying the 1st one. We ordered the civic burger & fries, brown sugar brussel sprouts, and creamy olive oil polenta. They were all great. The civic burger comes topped with triple creme brie. I thought the brie would get lost on a burger but I was wrong... it was heaven. Added a nice subtle flavor and nice mouth feel. My husband loved the fries but couldn't eat them all because the burger filled him up. The polenta was grainier than I usually like but I didn't mind. The agave gave it a hint of sweet which was a nice surprise and went well with the onion garnish. The brussel sprouts were caramelized just right - with slightly charred bottoms. Together the brussel sprouts and polenta were so rich that I couldn't finish them all. To finish, we had the fresh peach sorbet. It was refreshing with a hint of peach. After such a rich dinner, it was a good ending. Neither of us nodded off at the theatre either.

They serve water and bread upon request.
author: s k.

description:
Great bartenders. Drinks are unique and  different to stand out. Spicy bourbon drink was a treat. 

Just ordered a steak and tasted off. No questions asked - replaced with amazing patrole sole. Best fish dish I've had in a long time. 

They made me feel like I'm a long time regular. No doubt recommended.
author: Ryan E.

description: Not sure why this place is currently only 3 stars--I LOVE Soluna.  I came here while in law school and I still come back for those burgers and fries.  Bartender is hilarious and everyone is friendly.  Number one item is the burger and fries (seriously such an amazing burger).  I got the halibut with creamy polenta and it was absolutely delicious.  They were also very accommodating about our large party of 17 or so.  Don't let the location to deter you!  Great place for drinks or food before seeing a show at Bill Graham (or the other event venues nearby).
author: Susan T.

description:
Underwhelmed by our recent experience here.

The food was quite tasty, but portions surprisingly small for the pricing, which I suppose I should have expected given the locale?   But - delicious nonetheless.  The brussel sprouts and the celery root puree were especially spectacular and definitely worth ordering.  We did not order any items with meat or fish, so I can not comment on those.  

The cocktail I ordered was small and underpowered - supposedly contained a habanero tincture, but it was mostly absent in what was otherwise a pleasant but not very exciting drink.  

We visited on a super warm evening - let's even say it was *hot* in SF that day - and this restaurant offered no respite at all.  No fans, no nothing.  I am a small, slender-bodied person and I am almost always cold and thus enjoy when places are a little on the warm side...but this was straight up uncomfortable, even for me.  I get that it's hard to ventilate a place like this though, so I mention it only in hopes that the proprietors might take it into consideration. 

The service was earnest, but hurried, and maybe a little overzealous.  All of us agreed we felt a weird sense of urgency from our server right from the start, who came back to take drink orders we were not yet ready to place at three times in a roughly five minute period.  Over the course of the meal, the continued service was pleasant, but a little intrusive.  Without hand-wringing too much over more small details, I will simply suggest that the waitstaff could use a little re-education on the art of observing customers from afar, and facilitating a great dining experience and moving things along without being pushy.  And don't get me wrong, everyone was pleasant and respectful.  

But - for the location, the menu pricing, the style of cuisine and the overall vibe, we all came away from our meal feeling generally "meh."  Would be willing to give this place another shot, but I'm not banging the door down, you know?  Plenty of other nearby establishments to check out as well.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Ok bar though quite loud.
Mediocre food.
Won't go back
author: Duane H.

description: Very similar to other poor reviews, so you would think by now these issues would be corrected by management. Party of 6, 2 teenagers, 4 adults. My husband and I both made reservations and didn't know it.  I booked mine for 6:30- his 5:45.  Restaurant called me; I told them to split the difference for 6PM, but with unpredictable traffic unsure as we are coming from Walnut Creek. Was told they would hold our table.  I called from the Bridge at 6PM; accident - be there asap.  Arrived at 6:18PM.  Seated at 6:20PM.  Took 20 minutes for the server to come back to tell us our drinks should be here soon.  Told him we had theatre tickets and needed to be out within an hour.  He took our order then.  Still no drinks after another  10 minutes,  so got up to alert Server. Apparently, drink ticket didn't go in - we got drinks in another 10 mins. (40 mins for drinks to arrive.) Sidenote: We asked for bread in the meantime - 4 adults/2 teenagers, sitting at a table for 40 mins with only water is unacceptable.  We got 1 small board of bread- gone in 3 secs.  10 mins more, still no food.  Server peeks at us, but doesn't offer 1 thing to keep us comfortable during the wait.  More bread? Soda refills for teenagers? Dinner arrives 60 mins from time we arrived. We have 5 mins to eat now. 3 of liked our food - except the teenagers: they said their burgers were still mooing and bleeding, (but no time to send back, and they were starving so they ate them anyway) and my Cod smelled like old fish.  We talk to manager.  He said that we should have made our reservation on time.  Really???!! He offers to comp dessert. No more time. Manager sends over a round of comp drinks.  He leaves out a drink for my husband.  (The guy who is paying the check. Hello?) We chug the drinks, pay the check, (they deducted 15% for the wait..$22,) and despite the horrible service, we leave a $50 tip on a $147 bill.  Imagine what we would have left if the service was close to tolerable. In short: We were really excited to have a great dinner in the City before the Theatre.  If that is what you are looking for, look elsewhere.
author: Jen C.

description:
In a nutshell the food is good, the service is not.

We were with a group and the waitress did not write any of our orders down. No problem but three of the six orders placed were wrong. When we noted that there were problems with the order, the waitress acted like we made the error.

We also waited forever for our drinks and the server appeared to be disinterested in assisting the clientele.
author: John D.

description:
We had a quick dinner here before catching a show at the Bill Graham Civic Auditorium. There was one gentleman working the bar and the dining area. He commented that they had missed that there was a show that night and thus were a bit understaffed.

Service was definitely a bit slow and rushed. The happy hour special of beer, bourbon, and a burger for $15 is awesome. Great way to start the night. I wish they did similar specials for more vegi friendly entrees - but oh well!

Very minimal beer selection, but what they had was good.

My vegi entree (mac and cheese) was solid but my sandals were not launched off my feet. But still pretty good.

Overall, a solid place to visit in an area that has pretty minimal evening selection.
author: Michael N.

description:
underwhelming.... food and the overall experience.
Service was downright bad.. got ignored by the staff initially. Had to actually call someone over to bring us water. When we finally got the waitress attention she got the order wrong, but said she will make sure to take the food we never got off the bill. 
To my surprise.. when she brought the bill, she never removed the food. 

Food quality was just ok, and way overpriced... $22 for some fried chicken is a joke.
author: Ilya g.

description:
I haven't been back at the Loin for 18 years but I was there last week for business. My friend suggested Soluna for lunch.  The last time I was here, Soluna was occupied by a Chinese Vietnames restaurant.  Yes, the outside is nothing to look at but inside is quite nice.

We got a booth table in the back. It wasn't noisy so that's a plus.  I had the grilled chicken sandwich with fries.  They smeared some kind of garlic marmalade on the sandwich that made all the difference between a meh sammy and a great one.  I loved the garlic marmalade!  Chicken was cooked just right and not dry.

Service was adequate.  I don't want to be bothered when I'm catching up with friends so I'm glad this is not in your face service.

Neighborhood is still depressingly dodgy but at least there is a nice place to go for lunch here.
author: Wendy H.

description: Drinks are nice and burger,beer and shot of bourbon as happy hour special is d'lish, but customer service during a busy Friday happy hour was terrible. I was there with some colleagues yesterday and we had to go up to the bar several times to order drinks, beside the fact that we were at a table and there were plenty of servers standing around. Before leaving I asked to speak with the manager and he turned out to be the one with the biggest attitude. We will not be going back there and we will let our coworker know not to frequent them either. Too much attitude.
author: Isela F.

description:
Visited Soluna before a show at the Symphony with my friend. 

Service was above and beyond, our waitress had an excellent suggestion on wine, and we were really happy we listened to her recommendation. We ordered the heirloom tomato and watermelon salad, which was a nice little starter to share. Friend had the salmon which she said was really good. I had the burger w/ brie and it was outstanding! Perfectly cooked, yummy onions and a generous amount of brie. So delicious. The fries were a nice accompaniment but nothing special.

A great spot for a pre-show dinner.
author: Margaret I.

description:
I am always on the look out for a standout veggie burger and Soluna is my current favorite. First of all, I am not a vegetarian, I love a good beef burger, but I feel that veggie burgers are an amazing opportunity for a kitchen to get creative and think outside of the Boca box. Soluna's veggie burger is made of a combination of chickpeas, mushrooms and other tasty ingredients. My tip is to order the veggie burger, but ask for it served as the "civic" burger. That way you get the crispy onions, arugula, brie and black garlic aioli. Seriously, I dream about this burger.
