I'd like to say I've tried many other dishes at Soluna, considering it has become a go to spot for me and my colleagues when we decide we want to sit down and get served for lunch. The truth is, once I tried the burger, I've never gone back. My colleagues rave about the Thai Chicken Salad and the grilled cheese.

Highly recommend Soluna Café for a nice, reasonably priced lunch during the workday. If you work in Civic Center or Mid-Market the location is very convenient. Four stars rather than 5 because the service can be inconsistent and a little slow at times. Make sure you have a good hour to spend or else there is a chance you may need to rush through your food.
author: Ariel M.

description:
iAm a huge fan of random indiscreet bars and this lounge is exactly that. Just walking past on the outside before catching a performance over at Civic Center we popped in for a little drink. 

Matt our hot bartender made his way over to help us out as soon as we sat down. I had a cucumber martini, which he put his foot into! It was soooo yummy! 

Soluna also has a menu filled with many options if you are a little hungry. My friend and I both ordered the Prosciutto Mac & Cheese which was mouthwatering!! Definitely coming back here just to order the Mac & Cheese.

Its located right in the heart of the Civic Center area, so its a great place to pop in for a drink, dinner or just hanging out before or after a show or performance. 

Fun Fact:
Check in here and get a little drink surprise :)
author: Hillary H.

description: This place is extremely overpriced for the horrible service they provide.  The managers are not nice people.  The previous nice managers left and opened their own bar in the mission.  The only reason Soluna does well is because it is located by several theaters and a school.  If there were more options nearby, it wouldn't have any business.  I suggest going somewhere in Hayes Valley before the theater instead.
author: Elle W.

description: Used to like this place and go regularly. Dropped in for cocktails and appetizer at 5:30 before meeting friends at SF Jazz. Last two seats had just been taken at the bar. Manager would not let waitress seat us in empty restaurant area, even though we wanted to sit right next to bar and promised to order cocktails and an appetizer and leave in 45 minutes. We tried to be very friendly and jocular, but manager was firm and nearly rude. Will NEVER return, not worth it.
author: Cheryl A.

description: Tickets to Phantom and Soluna Cafe showed up as close and reasonably priced.  We got stuck in traffic on 101 and showed up 20 minutes late for our 5:45 reservation.   They were unbelievably kind, honored our reservation and the food turned out to be great.  Extremely well prepared and delicious.  I had trouble deciding what to order so we're going back when our next play in SF comes up in November.   Great service.   If you have a problem with this place, its probably you.
author: Rich F.

description: The manager here was terrible. After we received our lemon drops (in a plastic cup). The waitress apologized for the small size of the drink. Another person in our group (who happens to be a manager at The Four Seasons) politely asked her if she could double check on the size. After 5 minutes or so minutes the manager came over. We had never met him before. The first words out of his mouth were, "there's no way in hell we can make those any bigger without you ordering a double." Our jaws dropped and we were stunned by his rudness. Honestly, I have no idea how he became a manager with that sort of customer service. We found out from the waitress that other customers have had similar experiences with this manager.
author: Beeson N.

description: Quaint little cafe and eatery tucked away near civic center. Service was prompt even for NYE dinner. We had early dinner reservations before the symphony. Walkable from BART. Menu options offered an artistic but rustic spin on dishes like fried chicken, butternut squash risotto, and steaks.  Portions were just the right size, and not too much. Our table had the fried chicken and it was reported to be delicious, as was the Filet served with mashed potatoes and topped with mushrooms and peppers.  Cocktail menu was creative and with Yelp check-in you get to try a secret cocktail not on the menu! Hint: it has bourbon and orange peels.
author: Tiffany T.

description: Staff is nice, food is really good. Tried the chicken sandwich, new items that I didn't know, didn't change anything... it was delicious. Not 5 star because its expensive, expected in San Francisco.
author: Zulma N.

description: Wow, really loved the Fall menu selection and so close to the Davies Hall, excellent pre-symphony dining!  We ordered the crab pumpkin fritters and manila clams to start, both very creative and delicious. The broth in the clams was so good we kept ordering bread to soak up the love! DANG! Chorizo topped the clams and made for a very innovative dish, never had anything like this ever. Clams are normally just white wine and garlic broth, but their take on this appetizer was truly something to write about! The fritters are a treat, too, light and puffy little fried goodness, very tasty, crab is delicious and not local. Our entrées were the black cod with polenta and the mushroom risotto with grilled chicken, very hearty Fall selections for a crisp, cool weather evening. Loved it and the atmosphere is lively and cozy inside this little café. Service was attentive and very friendly even though they were pretty busy. Right across the street from the Asian Heritage Museum. Will return next time I'm in the area. Nice views of City Hall's backside.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
My sister recommended this place before going to the theater. The entry way is a little cramped, but the dining area is not and that's important as the meal was paced quite leisurely. The menu is simple in the quantity of choices, but complex in the offerings. We split a caesar salad, I had never had grilled romaine and the flavor was intense. I had the seasonal risotto and my sister went with their burger, neither of us was disappointed in our choice and the food was plentiful so we could swap a bite or two. 
The only downside to Soluna is that the check was slow coming and slower still to be taken and returned. I have definite plans to make return visits.
author: Anne S.

description:
I came here to grab a quick dinner before going to Book of Mormon with my boyfriend, and I was worried that such a nice sit-down place would be crowded and/or make us late for the show. 

To my pleasant surprise, we were seated immediately and when I told the waiter we were in a hurry he made sure our drinks and food came out very quickly. I must note that you should expect to pay 20+ for your entrees, which I think was a little too high but the convenience made up for it.

I ordered the fried chicken, and it was juicy and flavorful. I also enjoyed the "Tiger's Milk" egg white cocktail, which I thought was light and refreshing. I think this will be my go-to spot any time I see a show at the Orpheum.
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Me and 7 other friends went here after an event at City Hall. It was close and walking distance. But we didn't know what we were in for. It was almost empty expect for a few people getting drinks at the bar. But it still took up 5 min to be seated. After sitting down we were given menus and time to figure out what drinks we wanted. Our horrible waitress (more on this later- wish I got her name) returns to get our orders and 3 out of the 4 people that were ordering drinks, that weren't water, they were out of. And she claimed we all got outdated and out of season menus, weird, just our table. 
We ordered appetizers and a cheese and meat board sort of a thing, only getting weird jokes and attitude from our waitress. 
When we asked for bread she at first said 'No' with a lot of attitude, I'm guessing as a joke, then faked a laugh and a smile and said 'just kidding'. 
We then took our orders, and food arrived 30 min later, it was no crowded no mind you, it was early, around 6. 
2 out of the 7 orders were messed up, and someone's salad came undressed (and that was not requested). 
The person that ate the salad then asked what a particular food item in the salad was. And due to her lack of knowledge then made up a name (Purple Ninja Turtle Radish to be exact). But her manager was standing near by with the correct name and corrected her. 
She continued giving bad service through the rest of the night.
Dark and dingy with dirty old bathrooms. 
Small menu, and not much is good. Trust me we tried 10 of the maybe 20 foods. 

Overall wouldn't send my worst enemy here.
author: Laura D.

description: The food here was really good but I would definitely say it was overpriced. I was here before going to see a show at one of the local theatres. It was a pretty relaxed atmosphere. Online it said that reservations were recommended but there were plenty of tables available when we arrived.
author: Derek K.

description: Pleasant staff... However, they burned the fried chicken. To the extent that the batter tasted like ash. The other dishes were passable but nothing amazing.
author: Nathaniel H.

description: My friend and I stopped here today. We each had a glass of wine, which was excellent (that is why I am giving this restaurant one star at all). The food was less than satisfactory. I ordered the spinach salad and the spinach was all wilted. It looked like left over salad. The blood oranges were tasteless.  For that price??? Give me a break. My friend ordered a hamburger rare and a side salad. The burger came well done with fries, no side salad. One was brought, but too late to eat it. We were the only two people eating there! (that should have told us something...). NEVER AGAIN!!  Not one person said good bye when we left. Sorry, Soluna. You'll have to get your act together in the kitchen before I'll ever eat there again. What a rip off! ;-(
author: Melisisai L.

description:
My friends and I had a great experience at Soluna. We went before a show (it's very close to the Orpheum) and were extremely late for our reservation (we called and notified them). Once we arrived, they were extremely helpful and got us a table right away and asked if we were headed to a show. Since we were late, we were in a bit of a hurry, and they accommodated the fact that we were. 

I had the civic burger and it was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. Wonderful to the very last bite. The brie and crispy onion straws really made the burger. Wine by the glass was a bit expensive, however, the pinot noir was delicious. The rest of the table was satisfied with their food, but they seemed a bit jealous of my burger!
Give it a shot!
author: Katie K.

description: The nicest people ever! We wanted to come in for one drink, and they opened their establishment to us and our friends!! Love neighborhood spots like this!! And the drinks were amazing!
author: Lauren L.

description:
The Ribeye steak there is awesome, must try! (Only for dinner, the lunch one sucks)
The second cheese on the cheese list is my favorite.
author: Louie Z.

description: If I could give this place zero stars I would! Walking in we where not greeted by the host(who's job is to greet people), then we requested a table for five and instantly in a snobby stand offish way we where told that tables are only meant for eating (hello Sherlock obviously it's a restaurant). We where then asked to wait for 20 mins when the entire place was empty but we wanted a nice sit down dinner so we waited.... Fast forward to and hour and a half later we are finally sitting at our table and our food was still not delivered. Our waitress was also very standoffish and every other table who got there before and after us where getting the best service, drinks, bread etc. I really wanted to just pay for my drink and leave but I was with friends so I couldn't just leave them. Finally after hours I went up to the manager and told him all of my problems with this establishment and his response was sorry we are understaffed and it will be right out. My problem was that we all ordered simple items like Mac  and cheese and salads and it took and hour and a half to get served in the mean time during that hour we where never attended. To top it off my friends SALAD took and extra 10 mins after we all got our food! Seriously tho it's a simple salad. Oh and after we where done with our meal we finally received bread! Come on! To top it off my party of five received a gratuity charge for THE WORST SERVICE OF MY LIFE and on their menu the charged is advertised as 18% charge but in reality we received a 20% charge.I even signed up to yelp right now to leave this bad review. Oh and the cherry on top was a charge for splitting our checks. WOW! For a "high" end restaurant the service was the lowest of the lowest! And their food to ratio portioning is small and the food was way over priced for what it was! If you really want a nice dinner next time go to Olive Garden or something! My group and I might of been younger for their demographic but don't discriminate on age, we are all fashion designers and I will tell all of my clients to never eat there and I'd much rather take the for a Big Mac. I could tell right before we left other tables where not so happy with the service and they where actually helped unlike us so looks like this place needs and attitude makeover! Or just close down!
author: Armando O.

description: We came in for a quick dinner and they were completely indignant about not having a table available. I'm totally cool if you aren't accepting walkins, but don't be rude about it.
author: Spencer R.

description: We came here for drinks while waiting for City Hall's light show. Service was terrible and it took over 30 minutes to make five drinks between two bartenders. It seemed like they didn't know what to do with so many people and it was definitely under staffed. It also took forever to pay. Other than the service, I really enjoyed their fire and brimstone drink which consisted of Bulliet bourbon and pineapple. I would come back to chill at the bar and watch them create these yummy cocktails.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I went here last night prior to the SFGMC performance. My reservation was for 6:15, I really wanted a drink...so I showed up 15min early thinking I'd sit at the bar while I waited for my friend. When I arrive, there aren't any seats at the bar but there's plenty of room to stand. I let the host know what I'm going to do. The host responds with "I'm sorry, there aren't any seats at the bar, you still have 15 min until your reservation since there aren't seats at the bar you could go for a walk around the block." NO JOKE. So I looked around the restaurant, there was at least 10 open tables. I said to the host, I came early for a drink, if I wanted to go for a walk I'd do that near my office, why don't I get my table early and relax there. He still fights me.

Bottom line - the food was great. A host can make or break a restaurant. I will never return to Soluna Cafe & Lounge. As we were leaving there was PLENTY of people standing near the bar. 

I really wanted to give just one star but because the food was great, I bumped it up a star. There's never a reason for a host to tell a customer to go walk around the block especially when that block is McAllister and Larkin.
author: Teresa J.

description:
I was excited to be able to get last-minute, 6 pm reservations here before symphony. We were not welcomed at the door for such a long time that I was suggesting we just hang our own coats, choose a table and seat ourselves. We ordered glasses of wine as soon as we were seated, and we waited, and waited. Eventually the waitress came back and took our food order and we reminded her about the wine, and asked if maybe we could get some bread. She said the bread was in the oven and would take a few minutes - I imagined that they made it themselves. We waited and waited. Dinner came, and the food was very good, but we were still not complete. We again asked for the wine. Keep in mind that the place was not busy. After a while I was weighing whether I should just get up and go pour a few glasses at the bar... no one would notice except the other patrons, and they might all be in the same boat. Finally, the bread came... it was one piece each, and looked and tasted like a roll that you'd pick up at a no-frills corner store... mystery solved... someone must have been at the store looking for bread. About a third of the way into our meal, two glasses of wine came to our table. The one handed to me was correct, but the other was not. The people at the next table spoke up and said that it was their order. The wine given to me was taken out of my hand and handed to the woman next to me. Fine. It was wine they'd been waiting for for ages, they had ordered before we ever sat down, and they were nearly done with their meal. Unfortunately, the staff did not go back to the bar and bring us the wine we'd been asking for all along. It took another 5-10 minutes for our wine to come. We asked the busboy for more bread, and were plainly told, "No. We're out." How in the world can a restaurant in a city known for the quality, variety and availability of its bread run out for the early dinner crowd on a Saturday night? 

The food is really good, but the place is so poorly managed that it became the focus of our entire dinner conversation, and we will never be back.
author: Erica B.

description: So many good choices around the Civic Center, but Soluna missed the mark. Our reception was less than friendly and rushed. The drinks were the highlight of dinner, but we only had soda. The entrees were tepid and under, sides tepid and over. Desert was over on top and under on the bottom. Then the coffee arrived. It tasted like it was a day old and had been reheated. By this point I was tired of everything being poorly done so I asked if we could get some 'fresh' coffee. I was told it was fresh, there was no alternative, that's how the coffee is! My advice, skip Soluna, they don't seem to care and can't even make a decent cup of coffee
author: Gary R.

description:
I go to Soluna out of convenience more than anything, but it's a good place to grab a drink and chat with friends. It can get pretty packed during busy hours, but other times it's completely empty. The bartenders are not super friendly and sometimes you really have to get their attention for a drink. They have happy hour from 3:00 to 7:00, but it's happy hour all the time for Hastings students. 

The dining is pretty good. It changes every season depending on what's fresh. I had their tuna salad once that was really good, but I don't think they offer it anymore.
author: Jamie C.

description:
We chose Soluna for our NYE dinner, as we'd not been able to settle on a party or restaurant to go to after a lengthy vacation.

I tend to choose less "trendy" restaurants to dine in as some make me less comfortable than I'd like for a good dining experience. With Soluna it wasn't really that bad. Our server was attentive and very friendly and we were seated fairly promptly.

The prices for the New Year prix fixe were probably standard for SF, though the menu does seem a little pricey for what it is. We both had the orange-soy glazed king coho salmon, with brown sugar roasted brussel sprouts and the butternut squash, applewood-smoked bacon and caramelized shallot hash. We also had the nicoise salad with ahi tuna, which was quite good, though I'm not really much of a fan of ahi tuna (I wanted the greens).

Soluna deserves five stars for what we had of the entrees. The salmon we requested medium rare, an option that I would encourage others to get if they hate their salmon dry and overcooked the way it sometimes tends to be in some restaurants. It was nicely done, tender and juicy with the slight umami sweetness of the glaze complementing the salmon perfectly, and perhaps the first order of salmon I've had here that managed to make my standard in terms of how well done it was. What really made the meal outstanding was the addition of the butternut squash hash and the brussel sprouts. While it's not the recommended combo it's well worth the try just to taste the salmon combined with the warm, earthy flavors of the bacon and sweet squash, and the brussel sprouts were excellent, though a bit too oily. Delicious.

My only complaint was that my salmon was served somewhat lukewarm. There was some confusion with the bf's order of hash which had been mistakenly switched to the chips, though he did manage to get a little of the hash which they'd run out of at that point. Our orders also took quite a long wait to get there, but once the food started arriving it wasn't so bad.
author: Kit A.

description:
So entitled.  So arrogant.  So inattentive.

Just because you have the location...it can only take you so far.

If you are so comfortable to serve the bridge and tunnel trash, on random weekends then good luck.

One, two, three UN RETURNED phone calls.  Two personal visits.  Emails.  And NOTHING.  An empty restaurant.  A Bartender that is high as a kite. Staff eating at the bar.  GROSS.

Lame excuses, a weird vibe, and a smell that is indescribable.

Eek.  Methinks not.
author: Mike M.

description: Amazing clams. We ordered the Mac and cheese fries and buffalo wings which were all amazing!!! Not all of the staff was friendly but Carlos the server is amazing!!
author: Jesus S.

description:
We had reservations for a party of nine at 5:30 in order to catch Carol Burnett at 8:00 .  No problem getting sat at our time because the place was almost empty (should have been a clue).  Decor - There is nothing chic about the restaurant; it's a little dark to notice much.  The bathroom was old, but clean.  Seating - Just long rows of tables, which meant we couldn't converse with anyone except the people next to us.  Libations - No draft beer that night because the taps weren't working - on a Saturday night?  Food - Five of us had the halibut.  It was an extremely small serving (4 ounces, maybe) on polenta.  The halibut was dry until the very center and I learned that polenta is just a fancy word for corn meal mush - no flavor whatsoever - $26.  Two people chose the fried chicken; yep, greasy fried chicken was the only chicken choice.  My husband had the chicken and gave me a leg, which I ate because I was still hungry after having the halibut.  There were three pieces of chicken, but the potatoes served with it amounted to a two-tablespoon serving with a small hard biscuit.  My husband said it tasted like a Bisquick biscuit - $25.  Two people had the ceasar salad and I didn't ask them about it, but there wasn't even an option of adding chicken to it.  Dessert - The two people I sat next to ordered vanilla ice cream.  One asked for a chocolate topping, which they didn't have.  I will be generous and say that the serving size was 3 ounces for $6.  Service - Just okay, but I waited an hour for a glass of water.  

First, let me explain that I included the prices because you need to know how much we paid for food that in no way met our expectations.  It was edible and that's the best comment I can make about the food.

Second, we were there to celebrate an 80th birthday.  Normally, I would have returned the food, but I didn't want to detract from the purpose or embarrass the person who had chosen the venue.  It is so unlike me to not speak up.  I was a waitress for ten years before becoming a teacher.  I give restaurants and waiters a lot of slack and still leave an above average tip.

Third, I gave it one star because I will never go back.  For me, two stars means there was something about the place that might make me return.  I have looked at other rating sites - tripadvisor, opentable, zomato, facebook, and I don't know how this place gets more than two stars.  It makes me very skeptical about trusting any reviews.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Soluna has a cool locale and has always had the opportunity to be an awesome establishment. (They have little if any close-by competition; view of City Hall is beautiful; nice community garden out front too.)

Yet, Soluna wallows in the very average range because their customer service is just not good. They are more concerned about folding napkins than acknowledging your existence. Friendliness sells more drinks; this they must learn. 

Food is pretty good, especially for snacks.
author: Ronco B.

description: After a horrible experience this week, I was totally validated seeing all of the other negative reviews for their service--they clearly do not give a sh*t about customer service because they are guaranteed business due to their location. I came for a business meeting at 5:00 PM and had reserved a table because we wanted to have a quiet conversation instead of being at the bar. Please note, there is nothing on Open Table or on their website that says that reservations can only be made if you are planning to order dinner. My colleague and I sat down at the table, ordered drinks and when asked by the waiter if we were going to order food, we said no, we'd probably just be ordering drinks. The waiter gave us a weird look and seconds later, a VERY haughty manager of some sort came over to us, literally looking down his nose at us and said "I am sorry, you are going to have to move to the bar. The dining room is only for guests who are ordering dinner." Then, as we moved to the bar he said "Yes, we are really busy all the time, so we'll really need that table".  Also, just FYI, we had moved the napkins and touched the silverware already, and the manager instructed the waiter to just rearrange the stuff we had touched instead of putting down fresh napkins and silverware. So, whoever sat at that table next, hope you enjoyed my finger germs all over your spoon! We then sat at a high boy table in the bar area and were brought our drinks. We asked for water, and this very odd man with a beard (I honestly cannot tell if he was a bartender or what) came over, slowly placed the water on our table and then stared at us as he dramatically slid them towards us. Super weird. Then, over the course of our meeting, we were asked about 12 times if we wanted anything else, like they were trying to hustle us out of there. By the time we left, it was 6:30 PM and I made a point to look in the dining area. LO AND BEHOLD, it was EMPTY! Looks like they really needed our table. It's all good though, I'm never going back, but thought I'd provide others with this cautionary tale of exceptionally poor customer service.
author: Miquette T.

description: We are always on the look out for someplace new to us to eat near the Civic Center and Hayes Valley so we were excited to try the Soluna Cafe. The interior looked great, Bar looked good and maybe that is what you should plan on. Got a nice table in back and promptly ordered.  Cesar salad had a twist to it by adding fresh crab. which was quiet good. Dinner went down hill from there . Everything else tasted burned. Fried chicken had a burned flavor, rice pudding had a burned flavor and so did the coffee. Sadly the service was worse. Our server was more interested in the table next to us than us. We had ton ask three times for water which another server finally brought.  The last straw was our coffee finally came after we had given up on finishing desert. Maybe they were having a bad night but with all the restaurant choices in SF we will never know because we wont be going back.
author: Kerry B.

description:
So delicious!!!!!! Seriously. I came here for the first time because my best friend was planning my 30th birthday dinner. She selected this restaurant and I have to admit as most probably do, that I was skeptical about it. One for the location, two for the way it looks on the outside, but i was pleasantly surprised because the food was AMAZING!!! And this is coming from a very picky eater! My friend ordered an antipasti plate for everyone to share while conversations over drinks before we ordered our entrees. That alone had me happy. Most of my party ordered the rib eye which was so good that my mouth is still watering over! I can't say it enough, if you're interested in trying Soluna Cafe, DO IT! Plus our server (forgive me I forgot his name) was so nice to bring over birthday shots for me and all my friends! 

All in all, great food, great service, intimate setting and a must for any and everyone!
author: Amanda J.

description: Been here several times before going to the theatre. Last night was a big disappointment.  Sat at the bar. It was not very busy but the service was very slow!  Dinner a disappointment.  And I don't understand why you can't order a 1/2 glass of wine. Just wanted to finish my dinner and get to a play on time!  1/2 sale is better than no sale - most bars/restaurants are accommodating!!'
author: Jamie G.

description:
i would never ever go out of my way to come here, but if you work at the court house / federal building or go to hastings, it's not a bad place to stop by after work or class.  soluna looks dingy from the outside, but the inside is quite nice.  you'll almost forget that you're in civil center / the tenderloin!

food i recommend:

kennebec fries
mac & cheese (it's an appetizer, but it's enough for lunch)
herbed polenta fries (i've never had anything like it, but it's good!)
crispy wings (so much better than hooters... but for real)

civic burger & fries (SO BIG... and there's some deal w/ beer and a shot w/ this burger that's pretty cheap)
butternet squash risotto (pretty big portion, too)

rather than spend money on individual entrees, it's probably a better idea to just get a bunch of appetizers / bar snacks with some drinks.
author: Jennifer L.

description: So we came in at the Big Bus Tour and at first we ordered the No. 209 gin and Tonic it was HORRIBLE!  You would think why 5 stars well its because Matt the bartender didn't let us leave until we were happy with the outcome of the drink.  We were very very happy with the new drink and he was great!  ;) stop by here for a cocktail!!
author: Ambar B.

description: Very uninviting! My husband and I came here while we were waiting to go to a concert at the Bill Graham and the staff was so uninviting and so Unfriendly!
author: Meghan K.

description:
I was craving a cobb salad.  

A $15 mistake. *small sob*

I picked out all the romaine lettuce that was old and red. It was about half a cup of old lettuce in my salad. 

-- gross --

There was a lot of meat and cheese in the salad. Some people like that. I'd prefer to have fresh greens and not a meat n cheese salad.
author: Jacquee P.

description:
The judge speaks..."You have an hour for lunch. You are to return to the courtroom by 1PM. Do not be late."...She bangs her gavel. Jury duty. Oh yes. I have intractable pride in a free, democratic society that allows me the fulfillment of this civic responsibility. Hmmm...how do I get off? "OBJECTION OVERRULED."

Where to go...where to go. Saigon Sandwiches? Ugh...that line. Hot Dog guy in front of City Hall? Nice guy but...pass. Soluna? Hmmm ...haven't been in a few years when I came here to meet former colleagues after work. Hey, it still looks good inside. The crowd is quite sedate at lunchtime. I told the maitre d' that I needed to be back at Superior Court by 1PM, and he mentioned the fail-safe items I could order to make it back. "OBJECTION SUSTAINED."

I went for the $7 Caesar Salad with grilled chicken (plus $3), which was presented nicely on a triangular plate with plenty of parmesan reggiano and fresh anchovies on toasted baguette slices. It was tasty. I also went for a cup of their Rosemary Corn Chowder ($3.50). A totally reasonable place to get a quick lunch, but I always forget what a fun menu they have for dinner like the "Tuna, Tuna, Tuna" tapas ($14) which is tuna prepared three different ways, and the hearty lamb t-bone chops ($23). "YOUR HONOR, I OBJECT. THE WITNESS OBVIOUSLY CANNOT BEAR THE WEIGHT OF ALL THOSE CALORIES"...."OBJECTION SUSTAINED".

"EVERYONE ARISE FOR HER HONOR"...(Belch!)...sorry.

FOOD - 4 stars...I forget how good the food can be here...more American bistro than Spanish if that's what you're really hankering for
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...darkened, kinda Baroque but nice...and they appear to have Monday night double features, so that could be fun!
SERVICE - 4 stars...attentive especially when they knew I was in a hurry
TOTAL - 4 stars...if you're not quite in the mood for Little Saigon, you may want to cough up a few more bucks here.
author: Ed U.

description: Easy elegance; casual or suited, this was a comfortable and happy place to have a couple drinks in the early afternoon. The bartender, Matt, was not only friendly - he is an excellent mixologist who has created some impressively unique cocktails. Highly recommend the 'el guapo' - a deeply layered, smokey and yet still refreshingly light cocktail. Matt was a pleasure to talk with, and we'll be back - for more cocktails, for sure, and also to have a quick meal.
author: Evokative S.

description: I ordered the fried chicken dinner and it was excellent. My server Mya, not so great. But Nathanial  was awesome, super nice and knowledgeable.
author: lathina h.

description: My boyfriend and I stopped in tonight and we had a great time. Maya was our server. She was knowledgable and very sweet. We loved our food. Everything we ordered was so good. The burger was my favorite. I love this place and will for sure be back.
author: Emily E.

description: Really great selection of drinks and appetizers, elegant and casual ambiance, and a wonderful manager who wants to please his guests!
author: Monica S.

description:
I was torn between 3 and 4 stars.   This spot is very close to the Orpheum, which makes it a great middle price range spot for dinner beforehand.

My dinner - fried chicken - was quite tasty.   And piping hot, and crisp.   The side was a squash hash with bacon - given a biscuit was also included, I would have preferred a non-starchy vegetable.    

My date's dinner - fish and chips - was a big soggy.   This where I'm torn between 3 and 4.   If they could have better coordinated our meals coming out of the fryer it would definitely be four stars.

My two glasses of wine varied tremendously in the size of the pour - this is something management should take reign of.   You don't want a scanty first pour to prevent someone from ordering another drink.   Consistency is everything in this area.

I would totally eat here again  - that is where the 3/4 oscillation gets stuck in my head ;)
author: Oaklandish a.

description: Went here for anniversary dinner before a show at the Orpheum.  Very close by and convenient.  Was very happy with food and décor.  Wife and I shared a wonderful glass of wine as well.  I had read some previous reviews about service but I think that is at their busiest time.  We went mid-week early, even showed up 1/2 early for our reservation and were seated right away.  Service was attentive and helpful.  Will definitely dine here again.
author: Jerry M.

description: We chose this restaurant because it was within walking distance to the theater and BART. I have to say the food was good, not great. But, unfortunately two things stood out as disappointing: it was stuffy, and they didn't have any Chardonnay! Whoever heard of that??!! Our waiter had to be reminded about bringing a few thing, too. Unfortunately, we probably won't be back...
author: Sue M.

description:
Service was pleasant, it's a lovely atmosphere, but they do need to run a swiffer duster over the light fixtures.  

I had the thai chicken salad, it was lacking in chicken and was just boring iceberg lettuce that looked like it came from the Costco bag, with a couple of peanuts thrown into the mix.  The vinagrette was good, although the salad was overdressed, and I had to ask for a side of siracha because the few bits of chicken had no flavor.  I think about 1/3 of a chicken breast was present, maybe less.  My dining companion had the mussels which she really liked.  

I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here again but it's a decent enough spot for a quick lunch if you are in the area.  Maybe I just got the wrong dish.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Inspired by yelper Melanie N's review, I had totally blocked the experience I had here from my mind. I had a friend who had a bday dinner here. Apparently this is big with the law crowd as it's not far from Hastings and there were a good sized amount of attorneys in the fold. We were in a pretty large group and thought the dinner was going well. Drinks were flowing, people were dancing. All around a good time. 

I thought it was a bit on the warm side but when I went to the restroom it was heat stroke inducing! Holy cow. Turns out it was so warm one of the girls in the group had a fainting spell. We took her outside, got her some air and things were ok again. However the door man decided that we were a "liability" and decided to repeatedly tell us to leave. In fact he kept coming after me (for some f'd reason) and told me I had to get our group out of there. Wow. I've never been treated that way ever. It's crazy how one ass can basically ruin the night for one group. To top it off, after all this drama, we got to the parking garage a few mins after it was closed, with my car being locked there until the next morning. Arghh. That's a whole 'nother story altogether. 

Anyways, what started out as a really good time turned to crap. No point patronizing a place when they're going to harass you after you've dropped a ton of moola for what was supposed to be a celebration. I'm not saying the rest of the staff were like this but again, it only takes one to royally fuck things up.
author: Kim N.

description: Mommy dearest and I had reservations on a Saturday evening before heading to the SF Opera. It's conveniently located in the Civic Center square, so just a short walk to the opera. I had been to Soluna several times before for dinner and drinks. The food is alright. Our server was very mindful that we were headed to the opera after dinner so she was prompt in bringing out our drinks and food. A great way to start the evening!
author: Liv A.

description: This is a good place for a pre-show meal, the host and wait staff were conscientious of their early "diners with deadlines." Located conveniently in the Civic Center, Soluna boasts a full bar and some very tasty entrees. My grilled bone-in pork chop was simply delicious and my companion raved about the duck carbonara. Dessert consisted of watermelon sorbet (summertime awesomeness) and peach-thyme ginger crumble (heavenly). On prior occasions I've eaten the burger (yum), tomato/watermelon salad (deelish). But you can be certain I'll be back soon for the hot Mexican chocolate pot de creme!
author: Chris E.

description: Thought we'd get some dinner here around 8pm after an event at the SHN. Took a while for the staff to come greet us and check us in. Then we told that they do not sever dinner on Monday and only had a bar menu. But they didn't have a table for 4 at this time. They were barely about 5 tables in use.  The guy who spoke to us was rude and didn't seem interested in our business. Also didn't see it anywhere about dinner only being served Tuesday- Sunday. Guess he didn't like the way we looked. Never going here again.
author: John-Ashley P.

description:
Went there for the second time to have dinner before the opera.  The food was some of the best in the city.  The menu isn't very big but it did have to be.  The bar was great and has a good selection of top shelf makers.  

The service was good until... Something got mixed up with the table next to us which delayed us from getting any service for dessert before we had to leave for the opera. The service was good the first time we went so I hope this was just someone new making a mistake.  

We will try it again next month.
author: Paul C.

description: The food is amazing. Our server was perfect eye candy. Made my experience just that much more awesome.
author: Megan P.

description: Love this place! We've eaten here several times before heading to a show at the SHN Orpheum. Specials are great! Pork Chops are a favorite of the family. Can't go wrong with Fried Chicken too. Great place to me just for a drink too. Can't wait for our next visit!
author: California V.

description:
My two friends and I went here on our annual Christmas outing. Suzie waited on us and she was smart, friendly and appropriate. 

The food was delicious. The menu had just changed from what was on the website and they had run out of steak, even though we got there at 6:30pm - seems early to run out of steak, someone must have forgotten to order it. 

So I was forced to have this meat ragout w/ gnocchi and I'm glad they were out of steak - it was amazingly rich and had depth of flavor. Recommended by our waitress. My friends both had petrale sole that was also rich yet delicate. Outstanding experience - we all said that we will be back before next year.
author: Rew C.

description:
Civic Center; damn. Tough place to find yourself.

After a romantic day spent with Jamie M. at the federal courthouse regarding an anti-trust case about pharmacy, we stopped here for lunch with the rest of the legal entourage from the day. Kind of had the capital "i" mead hall shape going straight back architecturally, and 8 or 9 of us were seated. The ambiance was nice and the wait staff, albeit maybe understaffed, had our best interests at heart.

That said, we waited quite a bit of time for food, but the food was of high caliber. I'm saying this as I admit I had a grilled cheese sandwich and tomato soup, but really, that and an Amstel Light was a refreshing meal. Some mistakes were made, and admitted to by the staff, which resulted in the forgiving of the cost of one of the meals by the house.

All in all, not bad if you're in the area.
author: Davey R.

description: Came to Soluna tonight with no reservation. I was sat immediately and thankful, for a Saturday night and no reservation. Our server was amazing. He immediately had recommendations and was so helpful and knowlegdeable of the menu. I had grilled chicken and risotto and my friend had the burger. Service really makes a difference in a restaurant and I was more than pleased with our server and the food was fantastic. When a server can execute food, cocktails and knowledge of the restaurant....you always wanna come back.  Happy night. Good food. Spectacular service. Thanks Soluna!!!!
author: Rachel W.

description: It's good for lunch. The place feels like it is in the middle of a soft opening, even though it's been around for a long time, in terms of the way it's managed. But since I care more about food than management, I'm happy showering it with four stars.
author: Morris R.

description:
Not really sure why it happens, but I always seem to find myself here for lunch (maybe because it's pretty close to my work).  I normally would have given Soluna 2 stars based on the usual inept service, but for some reason, they hired an awesome waitress who happened to serve us today.

The good:  Nicoise salad, ahi sandwich, cobb salad...most of the salads really!  They don't tend to drown the salad with dressing like most places, so you can actually taste the vegetable.  Velvet and  politicians-if you like that sort of thing.

The bad:  Inconsistent service.  Usually slow, or they are training someone.  The vegetarian dishes does not seem to please any vegetarian I've ever accompanied there.  Velvet and politicians-if you hate that sort of thing.  

Maybe the stars will get better if they improve their staff/service...looks like they're on their way.
author: Amihan M.

description:
Came here for lunch one day. It's a great place tucked in the swarthy confines of civic center / tenderloin muck --  but such a gem. We were pressed for time so we spent our lunch hour peering and waiting for our food. But it was well worth it and I want to come back again when I'm not in such a rush.

I ordered the mac n cheese - and with a description like this - who could resist?
fusilli pasta, house-pancetta, gruyere, white cheddar, pt. reyes blue, pecorino 
romano, panko bread crumbs. It was amaze-balls.

We were pinched for time and had to head back to work so I missed dessert and cocktails. But their cocktail and desserts looked amazing. Which reminds me... I really need to get back there soon....
author: Nicha K.

description:
If I were just reviewing the food and drink, then four stars no problem.  But that is unfortunately not the case.

I show up in a group of four with a reservation 1.5 hours before our show starts.  That was clearly not enough time.  We were sat relatively quickly, but from there it took somewhere between 10-15 minutes just to get some water, and another 5-10 minutes to see our waiter.  The room was busy, but it seemed pretty well spaced out (that is, not everyone seated arrived at exactly the same time).  At this point we were worried about time so we just ordered everything at once.  We did get most of our food, but only about 10-15 minutes before we absolutely had to leave.  We got the obligatory apologies from our waiter, but if he had started serving us at a reasonable time and if the kitchen could get out an order in a reasonable time there wouldn't have been this problem.

That's the shame with Soluna, the food is really good and prices are reasonable, but the service/timing is so bad that I really have no desire to try it again.  I'm all for 2+ hour dining experiences, but only when they're actually experiences, not just waiting nearly two hours for waiters to come and chefs to push through orders.  Perhaps getting a drink or two at the bar is the way to go.
author: Chris B.

description: Excellent food. Prompt service. Last time I was here which notably was awhile ago, I enjoyed the pot de crime. It was amazing! I'm looking forward to our company dinner there in June! Yum yum!
author: Shirley C.

description: The food is great, especially the onion soup (very different and tasty) and the mac & cheese.  Problem is that the kitchen is too small and they can't serve a full house effectively enough at crush times like 6:30 on a Friday before the symphony.  You'd have to allow an hour and half for dinner and be very patient.
author: David J.

description:
Had a WONDERFUL experience at Soluna Cafe last night and can't wait to share with my fellow yelpers.  

Arrived at 545 before an 8 pm show at the Orpheum.  We were greeted warmly and our waiter Chris took excellent care of us. 

The restaurant is beautiful with soft fabric on the ceiling and lovely colors and super comfy table and chairs and semi booth.

My friend and I both ordered a fish dish and a side of brussel sprouts and shared everything.  We loved EVERYTHING on our plates.  Fingerling warm potato salad-oh my! My black cod and  her arctic char was prepared to perfection.  The black cod skin was crunchy and the inside melt in your mouth soft and moist.  The brussel sprouts-fabulous.  Fried lemon!  Everything was exquisitely prepared and plated and a truly excellent value. So delicious!

No cocktails as we don't drink before show but there was a nice selection.  We know dessert is awesome but we had no room!

Look forward to returning again and again!  Oh, parking right around corner at UC Hastings lot was very easy!
author: Leslie K.

description: Best Turkey Club I have ever tasted. Great Fried Chicken. Wonderful salads and soups. I just had lunch here, and can't wait to go back for dinner. Nice, comfortable atmosphere, and friendly, helpful and efficient wait staff. Two forks up!
author: Jane L.

description: Went here for the first time to meet up with two friends who frequent this cafe/bar regularly. The bartenders and wait staff were personable and the cocktails were very well crafted. I only sampled one appetizer, the polenta bites, but they were very tasty, so I would bet the rest of the menu is too. I'd recommend this place if you have reason to be in the Courthouse district and want a good drink and light bite to eat.
author: Artina M.

description:
My wife took me to Soluna as a surprise before the theater tickets we had down the street.  While the atmosphere was quite nice, a trendy lounge feel, the service was abysmal.  It took 5-10 minutes after we were seated to get anyone to come take our drink orders and the timing continually deteriorated after that.  We arrived at 6:10, on time, and we didn't get out of there until 7:45.  The show started at 8.  All we ordered was 2 glasses of wine, a shared tomato/watermelon salad and the Mac & Cheese and risotto.  

Bottom line: 
The menu was kind of pedestrian.  
The food was good - nothing spectacular -  but flavorful and cooked well.  
The service was terrible and slow.
We expected a lot more.
It will probably be a while before we go back, if at all.
author: David S.

description: Awful hostess.  Tried to place a to go order and ended up walking out after being ignored by the too - busy bartender.  Won't go back.
author: Monica T.

description:
I stopped by Soluna with no high expectations - I was in the neighborhood and needed food to satiate my hunger. When I first sat down, there were maybe 8 other people in the place and I found a spot at the bar of my own. After a few minutes, a bartender waited on me; by that time, I had checked in on foursquare and Yelp and seen their check-in special ($5 gin/ginger/sour mixed drink). Go here just to get that drink - it's stronger than it tastes and it tastes delicious!

The food was decent for a cafe and lounge bar - I tried the brussels sprouts chips and half a dozen wings (extra spicy). The music that was playing was great and the bartenders were all very friendly. Ended up talking to three of them for a while before leaving. The food was a little pricier than I would have expected for a bar, but the atmosphere is a bit swanky, I guess. Decor was nice and the bartenders were very knowledgable and personable.

Happy hour ends at 7, but there are still drink options in the $5-$8 range after.

I will definitely be back.
author: Krysta G.

description: Came back and the service is much improved and the Brie and arugula burger is terrific.  Great job soluna!
author: Jo B.

description:
I live in the area and THIS IS THE WORST BAR in the area.  I have given it more than a fair chance, but I continuously have bad experiences.

Take this past time for instance:

I came in with a few friends and most of us got drinks and food, but two of us did not get anything that afternoon. We were sitting at a bar table, eating and drinking when the manager came up to us and asked us to "drink up" "we need this table" and "If you finished your drink, we need your chair." One of my friends was halfway through his burger and had an entire glass of beer to drink still and we were all taken aback by how rude it was for him to say that.  I mean seriously, what kind of establishment has people, nay managers, that talk like that to customers.

It's not the first time, nor the second, nor the third time that I've had an experience like that. Needless to say, I will not be going back, and I strongly suggest you don't waste your time on this place.
author: Bob F.

description:
The mac and cheese is pretty sexy and crusty. Creamy, crunchy, tangy, filling. The veg burger is pretty good too, the poppy seed bun is a bit large for it so consider enjoying it as an open face sandwich.  The mushroom based burger is tasty and substantial with  unique and tasty toppings. 
I would definitely recommend. Especially for the lack of nice places to eat at in the civic center area.
author: Chelsey G.

description: My advice is to avoid. We were late for a Lana Del Rey concert and thought... hey what if we grab some cocktails and appetizers before the concert? MISTAKE. Overpriced and not the tastiest for the price. DO yourself a favor and wait for the concert to end next time before you search for food. Or don't go there for a concert. I'm really not giving them the low score in relation to the concert - the food and drinks weren't worth the bill - that's all.
author: Nathan B.

description:
One star for happy hour that starts at 2:30.

One star for the delicious Yelp check-in deal secret drink (can't remember what it was called... it had Jack daniels and ginger in it, though).

MINUS three stars for the slow-as-molasses bartender chick who took forever to do anything, even though we were the ONLY ONES sitting at the bar at 4pm.  I actually left her an $8 tip for the three drinks I had because I didn't want to wait another minute for her to bring the check and then have to wait again for my change!
author: Eileen H.

description:
This used to be my "go to" before the ballet or opera, so I enthusiastically recommended Soluna to a friend who was new to it.  She tried to call for reservations.  After being put on hold for 15+ minutes, she had to hang up and call back 1/2 an hour later to make our dinner reservations for 4.  When she finally got through and told them what happened, there was no apology, just a curt "we were busy".

I arrived first and the bar was 3/4 full with an after-work crowd.  I waited at the abandoned hostess station for about 5 minutes, but nobody came to greet me.  So I walked to the end of the bar to try and catch someone's attention near the server's station.  I told the bartender  I had dinner reservations.  He smiled graciously, and said "someone will be right with you".  

While I waited, servers bustled around me, looking harried. A bar hostess, and 2 other wait staff elbowed past me seven separate times with menus, food, drinks and dirty dishes, but no one stopped to ask if I needed help.  I got a couple of dirty looks from the hostess for standing in her way.  Meanwhile, a movie was showing on a large screen over my head.  It was already frenetic enough.  And no one was watching it. This was definitely not Foreign Cinema.  Not even close.

It was 6:05, before showtime at both the symphony and the ballet, but the dining room was empty.  Not a good sign.  After another eight minutes, the manager finally emerged from the kitchen, looking slightly disheveled.  I snagged him, saying we had 6:00 PM dinner reservations.  He asked if I wanted to wait at the bar, but I had already waited 15 minutes just waiting to talk to him.  I asked to be shown to our table - we had the ballet at 8:00.  Honestly - 15 minutes to just get seated in an empty dining room?!

He took me to the worst table in the house, next to the kitchen door.  I asked if we could have a banquette instead.  He quickly set that up and seated me.  Presented with menus, I asked if they still had their prix fixe.  He brusquely replied that it's been a while, but no.  Too bad - this used to be a shabby chic, but full dining experience for the pre-show crowd, famous for their satisfying prix fixe menu.  (I had been craving their famous root beer float dessert.)

Our waitress was prompt. The cocktail menu looked impressive so I had a "Beet It", infused with ginger and beet juice - fragrant and delicate.  While waiting for my friends to arrive, I saw that the menu had completely changed - it was clearly a bar menu, not intended for a fine dining pre- show crowd. Many items were prepared ahead of time and only needed to be warmed and served. Unfortunately, they had kept the fine dining prices.

After we were all assembled, we ordered the Kennebunk fries with house-made aoili and catsup, green salad, clams, butternut squash risotto, mac 'n cheese, and an ahi tuna salad.  My friends ordered drinks, but the beverages straggled to the table. 

The food also arrived out of sync, so we couldn't really eat "together".  The fries were slightly soggy - cooked in oil not hot enough to make this appetizer work.  The aoili was bland, but catsup was ok. 1/3 of the clams were missing their insides, but the sauce was tasty - too bad you can't eat the shells.  The salad was uninspired, despite the slab of morbier -  blah presentation and a nothing dressing.  The risotto could have had more flavor and the texture was gummy as opposed to creamy.  Clearly, it had been sitting around for a while.  They used to be good at this - what a shame.  The ahi tuna salad what passable.  At least the sashimi was fresh.  But they completely forgot our mac 'n cheese.  By the time it came, my vegetarian friend was rushing to finish eating to make our showtime.

The manager graciously comped us their house - made truffles to make up for the computer glitch that lost half our order.  Too bad it was so late that we couldn't eat it at the table.  We ate one on the run and packed the rest to go.  It would have been nice to savor it leisurely, as these may well have been the best thing served that evening.  Sorry, but I will never eat there again.  Soluna, you broke my heart going from 4-1/2 stars to 1 star.  What happened?
author: Amy C.

description:
Magic trick.

Some say these are magic: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psilocybin_mushroom

All should say this is a magic: Homemade veggie burger featuring mushrooms and garbanzo beans. Hesitated ordering not being a fan of fungi. Server insisted it didn't taste like one.

It did not. Much more garbanzo flavored which no doubt was helped by the fried green tomato and brioche bun. Proved to be a magic combo.

Fries or greens on the side. Attentive service was quick to replace the salad when it didn't come dry as requested. One example of the very friendly and courteous staff.

Snuck a garlic thyme fry. Had to perform my own disappearing act not to have more.

With tax and tip it was close to $13. Food needs unique and delicious food to justify prices that high. There is no illusion it is here.
author: Jason B.

description: Great food but horrible service.  My friends and I went there, while we were there in the middle of our meal the waiter said "can you hurry up we have people waiting."  I don't recommend this place.
author: Derek B.

description:
The worst customer service I have ever experienced (thus far). 

I came in with low expectations due to its location, but boy even those low expectations were too much.

We came in with a group of 4, still waiting for 2 others to join us. At this point our server, Lea, was still nice and let us sit in the actual dining area yet still enjoying the happy hour menu/prices. 

Unfortunately, from then on it just went downhill. She came over to our table and just stood there, no "hi how are you today" or "could I be of any assistance." We ordered drinks and without saying anything she walked away before we even finished our food order. When we tried to get her attention she rolled her eyes and came over and yet again did not say anything after she took down our order (no confirmation that she understood our order or anything). 

When our 2 other friends joined in we had to walk to the counter to grab water glasses (they are just standing there, not sure if it's self-service). But even when she saw us get up for the water glasses she didn't come to our table to take their order. When we finally flagged her down she took half of our order and again just walked away. When she came back with their order the rest of the table ordered their drinks and she rolled her eyes again (probably because she was annoyed that she had to walk twice, but had she payed attention at first she could have taken the entire tables order at once). 

The burger from one of my friends came really fast (scary fast actually but that's a different subject), yet the burger from my other friend took a very long time and so did the chicken wings. After we had all our food she again never came and checked on us, eventhough we were standing on dry for awhile now. Mind you, the restaurant was NOT busy at all, besides our table of 6 there may have been 2 tops of 4 at this time and some single customers at the bar (and 2 servers). 

We decided to pay (had she actually done her job "being a waitress" she could have doubled the bill, but since no one waited on our table, we didn't order anything anymore). During this process she had at least rolled her eyes twice in front of us and once to her coworker when obviously talking about us (as she was pointing). Then she had the balls to walk up to our table (before we tipped) and say "just FYI I didn't add the gratuity, which we usually do" (her tone of voice was as if she was doing us a favor). Obviously this was the straw and by her saying that we decided to not leave her a good tip (we still tipped, which we shouldn't have).

On top of all this bad customer service one of us saw a MOUSE running through the dining area and was kindly enough to (quietly) tell our server Lea this. When she did, Lea just said "I'll let the people who take care of these things know," no apologies or "thank you" what-so-ever. I'm sorry but if customers see a mouse in your restaurant you should apologize and thank them for pointing it out. An actual good restaurant who cares about their reputation would have even offered to take some things off the bill if not everything, but at this point we obviously did not expect anyone in this restaurant to care. Later on we saw the mouse again. Yes, this place has MICE.

The sad part about our server's customer service (or lack of it) is that she dealt with a group of all hospitality industry folks, who on one side have more patience and understanding of servers as we know how it is to be on that side, but on the other hand, we also know how service SHOULD and COULD be and this was not nearly close.

I will not come back to this place ever again as long as Ms. Lea is still working here (& they still have mice).
author: Helen D.

description: Overall, the service was lackluster. The host did not greet us or acknowledge us at all. We finally sat ourselves and waited awhile before a snobby hipster waiter brought us menus, which seemed to greatly inconvenience him. A friendly but fairly incompetent second waiter took our order, which he messed up. His exuberant manner did not make up for waiting nearly an hour for a simple appetizer of olives and peanuts (we reminded him a few different times). The best part of the whole experience was a busser who actually remembered to bring us water when we asked. Cute place but too pricey for mediocre food and drinks and horrible service.
author: Jill K.

description:
After cruising by Saluna times more times than I could count, a long day at the office combined with their advertised happy hour finally found me wandering through the doors.

The clientele is suits by the ton, my guess the Civic Center business crowd out to unwind. With the decor of casual yet classy I assume this is their targeted niche. 

My drink of choice: "Amore" - Fernet Branca, black pepper infused Svedka vodka, lemon, burned orange peel. Positively delicious, jostled me right out of my after work slump. They have a small happy hour menu with a handful of small plates as well as equally creative drinks, discounted beer/wines.

Swankier crowd than normal for this neck of the woods, the bartenders were efficient but a bit cold in attitude for me. You know, the type that get the job done and get it done well, but no interest in conversation or cracking a smile.

The drink will get me back in someday I'm sure, the crowd I could do without.
author: Justin N.

description:
This hidden gem definitely deserves a 4-star rating overall, so I'm going to 5 to boost those numbers. I'll keep it short and simple:

-Excellent food: try the mac n cheese, the fries, the mussels or the burger
-Good drinks: The bartenders take their time crafting quality cocktails like the Blood Sour. Even the Foursquare special, a whiskey sour, is well made. (And $5!)
-Good service: they'll recognize you pretty quickly if you become a regular or semi-regular.
-Great environment: lovely lounge area in the back for nice eating with a young-skewing bar in the front. Gets really busy during happy hour when everyone in the civic center area gets off work. Can be really dead later on in the night and they close early, but a good first spot to hit up on a night out.
author: Dan U.

description: This review is very necessary.  Came here with 2 girlfriends for lunch and drinks this past weekend (pride weekend on Sunday).  We were actually excited to find this place...a place to sit down, have a few drinks in the midst of pride.  First come first serve seating so we grab a seat once one frees up.  Our waitress comes over...her name is MAYA... and from the jump I can sense a snotty attitude but didn't mention it until my friend said the same.  She tells us we need to put up a credit card to hold the table.  Kind of overboard (we are not in Vegas at night in an upscale lounge) but  we understood simply due to the fact that it's pride and I'm sure they don't want to take the risk that any drunks will bail on the billl.  Next up she tells us that the water bottles that all 3 of us have (again, its pride...we are hot and staying hydrated) and it truly was water need to go.  Either she can "confiscate" them or they need to be put away and not taken out....again comical..."confiscated"??  Sweetie you are a waitress not security.... but okkkkk.  We order drinks, appetizers and food.  Our appetizer comes out (wings) and I can tell we will need more napkins.  I ask up front "can we get more napkins please?"  Her response - "I brought napkins".  She brought 3.  One for each of us with wings?  Not gonna cut it.  Again, her attitude is crap...why not just "sure" or go get them....They are NAPKINS!  The food was actually pretty good, and the drinks were not bad either.  Here is the icing on the cake though....as we are finishing up our food the table next to us (with the same server MAYA) gets told (by MAYA) that if they are done and not going to be ordering any more food that they would need to leave since they need the table.  It was downright rude to paying customers.  It's not like they has been sitting there all day.  The experience would have actually been fine had it not been for the wanna be pin up model waitress who think she works in an upscale lounge in Vegas.  We were planning on letting her know she was garbage with her tip...but don't you know it we get the bill and gratuity was already included (for 3 people?) wow.  She did not earn that $13.00 tip she got.,  The other staff seemed ok and seemed to be treating their guests ok..including the waiter we asked for an extra plate since we didn't wanna bother our waitress.....I think we just ended up with a biotch who ruined our experience.  Do yourself a favor and get rid of Maya....I think she's making up policies as she goes and is ruining the customers experience.  I see I am not the first to mention her in a review...
author: Gina M.

description: Just attended a wedding at City Hall across the street. Decided to walk over since it was the closest cafe / restaurant around. We walked in with a group of 10 people. We saw a bunch of empty tables in the back that we thought would suit us just fine. We were turned away by a staff member telling us "sorry but we can't seat you, we're getting ready for dinner" Not feeling very welcome, we walked a few blocks over to O3 Bistro & Cuisine on the corner of Van Ness & Mcallister and were practically welcomed with open arms! Cheers!!
author: Greg H.

description:
I just attended a wedding reception here.  The whole restaurant was closed for our event, which made the environment very intimate.

I must say, their whole selection of sliders available to us were very tasty--beef, pulled pork, and ahi tuna. The pulled pork sandwiches were made with a buscuit that was so flakey, and melted in your mouth! Other hors d'oeuvres were great also--crab cakes, stuffed mushrooms, and flatbread.

The service was good, and bartenders were very friendly!!

Overall, I would recommend this place!
author: Shalainie R.

description:
OMG - what an unexpectedly pleasant surprise!
atmosphere is just so-so but service and food; unbelievably good

an accidental Yelp stumble got us here. menu looked interesting and it was only 3 blocks from the hotel, so why not?

hope it's still here next time I'm visiting
author: Angelo P.

description: Horrible service. Food is sub par. Napkins and forks are dirty. Again. The worst service and food ever.
author: B C.

description: My friend Robert and I had just seen Book of Mormon(loved it) at the Orpheum and Robert made a reservation here for dinner.  It's a short walk from the theater.  We started with the duck carbonara(fresh fettucine, duck prosciutto, organic duck egg, pecorino-romano, organic pea shoots) which we shared.  OMG!  It was so dam good! Then I had Mary's organic fried chicken with butternut squash, and Robert had the Niman Ranch grilled pork chop with butter nut squash risotto. Our entrees were very good, but nothing compared to the duck carbonara.  If we go back, we each decided to get the duck carbonara as our entrée.  The restaurant is beautiful, very romantic, and the service was great.  It's next to the amazing Tenderloin Community garden!
author: Blondie R.

description: Just ate one of the best meals I have ever eaten! My fiancé's steak was really rare-just the way he asked for it.  Everything was delicious (oh my gawd, the brown sugar brussel sprouts!) Dark chocolate mousse for dessert, and excellent decaf coffee (a measure of a good restaurant in my book). The service was impeccable. We will be going back, and recommending it to our friends. Thank you Soluna!
author: Linda C.

description:
For the wicked drinker, Soluna delivers a sermon of Fire and Brimstone in their fiery cocktail of the same name.  The concoction of bourbon, fire nectar, ginger brew, pineapple juice and lemon will deliver salvation to the drinker.  But be careful, too many will have you speaking in tongues.  

Read more at the San Francisco Examiner: http://www.sfexaminer.com/entertainment/Mixologist-Artisan-cocktails-right-next-to-City-Hall-86426762.html#ixzz0iabjRIvfv
author: Jeannette W.

description:
I've eaten here a few times in the last month, before heading to see a theatre play nearby.
It was a very good experience both times, with great food and excellent service. The atmosphere was lively, but there was enough separation from the louder front bar area and the more subdued back dining area. Enough separation, but not too much. We felt like we were a part of the action without having to yell over it....
Good tunes, good cocktails as well. Recommended for pre-Symphony, pre-Opera, Pre-Ballet and anything else in the area.
author: Patrick K.

description:
The worst service I've ever received in my entire life...hands down. Absolutely TERRIBLE staff on all accounts. Every single staff person that I came in contact with was horrible at what they did.  

On a separate note, the food was actually really good...but I would never, ever go back.
author: Lindsey M.

description:
This is a review of dinner at Soluna.  (For Happy Hour, see my previous post.)   Actually, my GF and I were supposed to just have Happy Hour at Soluna.  But the girl went, "Um, I want dinner now."  Sure, why not?.....

DATE:  September 10, 2009 @ 6pm, Girl-bonding dinner with Rebecca after work.

RECOMMEND:
Soluna is a decent, convenient but pricey dinner option before seeing the Broadway Show "Wicked" at the Orpheum which is a skip-hop away. 

VENUE/AMBIANCE:  
Plain outside but the restaurant is impressive when you walk in. The dining area is classy and nicely decorated in  burgundy-dark walls,  heavy velvet curtains and Renaissance-like hanging lamps.  Dark, cozy and romantic. Booths for intimate dining.  
THE SCENE:  
Mostly more "mature" crowd like people in their 50s and 60s. 40 something  Civic Center professionals in powersuits. Theatre-goers in velvet/silk dresses.  And the likes of me and my GF. :)

FOOD AND DRINKS:
GF:  BEER ($6) and ARUGULA SALAD ($13) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LsblUPwDEs9EruHSjPmiGg?select=_kgSfPgTuYm0QKI7xxNpeQ
Fresh Arugula, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Figs, Candied Walnuts,
Bosc Pears, Bacon, Red Wine-Pear Vinaigrette: 
*How could I have forgotten that my gf eats like a bird and dinner for her meant a tiny plate or salad?!)  

Me:  BLACK PEPPERCORN COCKTAIL  ($12) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LsblUPwDEs9EruHSjPmiGg?select=flodaXReIRBS7zp4nuYgbQ
*Interesting drink with bits of peppercorn floating but on the weak side. DUNGENESS CRAB STUFFED PETRALE SOLE  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LsblUPwDEs9EruHSjPmiGg?select=Cg1dR83hvE0itHKAK-ieLg with 
Cipollini Onions, Asparagus, Meyer Lemon Hollandaise ($24);
*Sole was firm and generously stuffed with crabmeat. Taste was just okay.

Dessert: LOCALLY-MADE MITCHELL'S MACAPUNO ICE CREAM ($6) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/LsblUPwDEs9EruHSjPmiGg?select=9bvpwJU_jZDRg2Q7bVHdfg
Macapuno (Sweet Coconut), Cranberry-Lime Biscotti
*My GF loved this dessert! She's never had Macapuno ice cream before which is a traditional ice cream flavor in the Philippines. Macapuno is a very tender coconut. Our spoons were happily digging into this dish.

TAB:  $60 something dollars including tax and tip.

OVERALL:  I feel ripped-off! If you're really going to  look at what we ordered, all the dishes were equivalent to just one person's meal:  1 salad, 1 main, dish,  1 beer, 1 cocktail and 1 dessert.  Luckily, my friend eats like a little bird. Otherwise, our tab probably would have been close to double ($100++)!

I think the dishes were pricey for the small portions and for the calibre of the restaurant.  The dishes were forgettable.  I will skip dinner here and stick to their Happy Hour next time!

Despite everything, it was fun girl-bonding with GF Rebecca once again!!!
author: Leah E.

description: My fiance and I recently were married at San Francisco City Hall. Soluna Cafe and Lounge is just a couple of long blocks from city hall, and so was a convenient site for our small wedding reception after the ceremony. Our wedding was early on a weekday afternoon, so we were able to host cocktails in Soluna's bar from 3:30 to 4:30, and then from 4:30 to 7:30 we had the back of the restaurant for dinner. Wait staff circulated among our guests with 5 different tasty appetizers throughout the cocktail hour. For dinner we had a choice of filet mignon, halibut, or rissotto, with soup or salad, and a dessert, all of which were very good. The service was quick and professional, and the waitstaff were courteous and friendly. Everything was well organized and our guests and us had a great time. We couldn't have picked a better place for our reception.
author: Ron Y.

description:
No. Hell no. This place effin sucks! Service was ridiculously slow.  I waited about 45 mins for my burger!!! Even after I asked my waiter to check on my order, it still took another 15 mins or so!  My girl only ordered french fries...and that also took 45 mins!  Wtf???  Our intentions were to just grab a quick bite before our evening event across the street. Their slow service made us late...very late. 

The burger was juicy, but for $12, one would expect neiman ranch or at least angus...not here.  Don't know what kind of meat it was but it wasn't so flavorful.

The biggest turnoff is that they charged me $2 extra per drink for ice! That's $9 for a little measured shot of whiskey and freakin $2 more for ice!!! Who the hell does that???

Never going back to this place!
author: Peter M.

description:
My experience here was horrible that it made me sign up for a yelp account just so that I could review Soluna Cafe.  I was there on Saturday night with a big group.  Granted I know that big groups can be annoying and difficult to work with, the restaurant was never full so I didn't think it was that big of a deal.  

The server was extremely rude from the moment she came to our table.  I asked her multiple times for more water and another set of utensils which she never brought.  We had the pork chop which was completely rare inside and the manager seemed annoyed when it was brought to his attention.  We ended up having to share utensil sets and napkins along with water glasses.  I would have said something to the manger but I got the distinct impression that he would not have cared.  

Needless to say, I will never be returning to this establishment and they should really work on their customer service.
author: Jennie C.

description:
I stopped by for a beer and free fries (from the daily dishout deal good through sept 18). At first I thought they had a decent beer list with about ten offerings but then I realized the majority were bottled, not on tap, which didn't seem to be reflected in the price. So that was a bit of a letdown. The fries seemed to be designed with a bit of a "kitchen sink" concept - truffle oil and pecorino cheese was probably more than enough already, but they also came with (preserved??) lemon aioli and chile cilantro ketchup. To my surprise, the ketchup was actually quite appreciated. It wasn't as spicy as it might sound, but it did have a little bit of a kick. The lemon aioli may be the first aioli I've met that I was pretty indifferent to. The serving is a pretty substantial cone that is nicely presented - a good appetizer/snack/side for 2.

Even though I had a coupon, everything seemed fairly overpriced. The atmosphere was pretty nice in terms of the lighting and music, although it was also fairly dead. If I were in the area I would rather go to burmese kitchen just for food or maybe head north to Olive for a lounge/bar - both of those places were packed when I went by.
author: Lisa K.

description:
6 of us were excited to try this place. but from the min we walked in, from the unenthusiastic manager/host to the rude and annoyed waitress (maya p) to the gloomy and dark interior, we should have turned around and left. 

the place wasn't even busy so not sure why they were in such an unfriendly mood. we were cheery and wanted to order food, but the waitress look unhappy we were making her work and questions we asked were answered in tones like "i know better than you".  because there were 6 of us, tips already auto added. maybe that's why she thinks she could have an attitude.  who knows but man, was it one of the worst nights and waste of money.  at one point, she even said she was bored.  

well, thanks.  that's what every customer wants to hear from someone who is suppose to be taking care of them.

and the food, super high price for overcooked meat and dry everything else.

save your money and time, stay far away.
author: Silver C.

description: Oh my god - the burger is soooooooo good (the crispy, fried onions and brie are a great touch)! Also love the fried chicken. And the steak... I want it all. All the time.
author: Serena D.

description: Very tasty food, nice drinks, good, fun, yet somewhat formal atmosphere (yet a bar at the front that made it more casual).  Great place before an opera, ballet, symphony, easy to  park nearby in Civic Center garage or possibly even street parking if after 7pm.  Small, medium,and large plates, varying in price and in your appetite, so very flexible.  Staff was attentive and pleasant.  Good menu variety.
author: Jennette C.

description:
On a scale of one to five, the creme brulee here deserves five stars!

My bf and I came here to make up after our first fight and the creme brulee was so tasty that it made us forget all our troubles.  

On valentines day, my bf had his friend pick up some creme brulee togo for a surprise dinner he cooked for me.
