However, instead of letting us borrow the container the brulee was made in, the server scooped it into a togo container.  By the time my bf and I opened the box, the creme brulee turned into soup but it was still yummy!
author: Le T.

description:
We ate here before going to the Orpheum.  Very convenient location as there is a parking garage behind the restaurant and a short walk to the theatre. 

The food was fresh and well presented, but the service could have been a little more friendly and consistent.  It was busy however.  6.15 pm, Friday, and I would say the majority of the people sitting in the restaurant area were probably heading to the theatre.

I would give it another try when I'm off to the theatre, but would not go out of my way to eat there otherwise.

We had fish and chips and pork loin.
author: Katrina E.

description:
My son and I were going into the city to see a show at the Orpheum.  I wanted a nice place to eat that was walking distance and decided on Soluna.  After reading all the negative comments on service, I booked my reservation for  5:00pm on Open Table to make sure I had plenty of time just in case.  The restaurant opened at 5 and there were 3 groups there.  Since we had reservations, we were seated first.  We were greeted within minutes by a lovely waitress named Adriana.  She took our drink order and gave us time to look at the menu.  She came back in about 5 minutes to check on us.  My son ordered the hamburger and I ordered the salmon.  She had great suggestions and was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  It took about 15-20 minutes tops to get our food.  It was amazing!  During our meal we had 2 other people plus our server come by to ask how our meal was and see how we were doing.  The restaurant at this point was full, but we never felt forgotten.  Since we came so early, we didn't rush and were able to order desert before leaving to get to the show.  We were out by 6:20pm. (keep in mind we took our time because we were so early).
The ambiance was great, the food was amazing, and our server was awesome.  I would definitely go there again.  
I would just say if your nervous about time, get an earlier reservation.  It allows you more time to enjoy the ambiance and the food.
author: Debbie R.

description: Went here with some friends after going to a matinee at the theater.. Our server was attentive and sweet, the ambiance is amazing.  I had the check in cocktail which was delicious and a steal at $5, It was a bourbon concoction with ginger lemon simple syrup and bubbly soda. Delicious. The wine list is impressive and the portions were reasonable. I had the fried chicken dinner. The chicken was DELICIOUS, the squash side was good (very crisp and well seasoned), and the sweet potato hash was just ok. I wish it had been a little bit more brown. The biscuit was out of this world delicious. Will definitely be back next time I go to the theater! Definitely do the check in cocktail!
author: Heather L.

description: We had mixed feelings before we went based on different review sites, but we wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt. People were right. Wait staff sucked.  At least our waiter did. My husband had risotto, delicious!  I had filet mignon, ordered medium rare, it came out raw with raw asparagus.  Called waiter over, he said hmmm, took to kitchen and same plate came back about 10 minutes later. Steak was now rare, but tough and side dishes that they removed while the steak was recooked were now cold.   Look, we know that shit happens, and things will not always be perfect, but when paying premium prices for meals, at least act like you care if your patrons are happy and satisfied.  There are a ton of restaurants in the city, do yourself a favor and avoid this one.
author: T L.

description: Service from Matt was exceptional. Too long since my last visit! Will be back sooner than later. The duck carbonara was really nice and the burger was outstanding!  Happy hour is really a good deal.
author: April M.

description:
My friends and I had tickets to the opera and decided to grab something to eat at the nearby restaurant. Soluna was close and looked good. I asked for a table but was told they are booked. A minute later, the host told me he'd be able to sit us in 30 minutes, at 6:30 pm. I thanked him and said that meanwhile we'd be sitting at a bar. We ordered our drinks at 6:15. The host then came back and said that the reserved party just showed up and we can't have a table. I said no problem and, since we can order from the dinner menu at the bar, that's what we'll do. At around 6:25 we ordered 2 appetizers and a soup and 4 exactly the same entries...cheeseburgers. At 6:45 we still did not get our appetizers. So we told the waitress that we must be out at 7:30 because the opera starts at 8. At 6:55 we told the waiter that we need to cancel our appetizers because we won't have time and just bring the hamburgers. Immediately, a manager came and apologized for the wait but it will be another 20 minutes! We were pissed, but still very hungry and out of time to eat anywhere else before the theater. We said ok but we need our food no later than that. At 7:15 the same manager came in and said that it will be at least another 10 minutes...At that point we just couldn't deal with them any longer and just left.

During the entire wait, we were not offered any bread or a water refill. We were told that their policy is to take care of those that made reservations first. I asked if those people also ordered in advance and that's why they were served first? No! They did not order beforehand...

Dreadful place. Absolutely NOT recommend.
author: E N.

description: It was ok.... I won't go back but had to review it. The best thing I had was the Mac & Cheese. I ended up ordering the grilled bone-in pork chop that was dry and  butternut squash risotto with some amazing brown sugar Brussels sprouts. I thought it was going to be something amazing in my mouth for the price but I was let down when I had to ask my better half  for his Mac & Cheese to finish my pork chop. It was just tooooo dry for me. I do have to add I tried the roasted garlic celery root puree and it was ok! It looked like Mashed potatoes and with added salt it was good. The restaurant is romantic and great lighting but the food just didn't do it for me.
author: Jess C.

description:
I went to SF to see Wicked and found this restaurant just by walking around Civic Center/Tenderloin.

We were asked right away if we were here to catch the show and after being seated right away, we were asked politely if our appetizer and main dish came together.  They were SO NICE about getting us in and out of there really really quick so we wouldn't miss Wicked.

Anyway, the FOOD was AMAZING.  I started with the duck liver ravioli and ended with the lamb and butter carrots and mint julep. OH MAN OH MAN was it amazing!!!! and the prices were NOT bad....too bad I don't live in SF, when I come back I'm definitely going back here again. mMMMM!!!!


p.s.
my cousin had the hawaiian walu and that too, was amazing.
tip: get the crab salad!!!!!
author: Frances Valerie C.

description: A friend of mine invited me to lunch and we ended up coming here. Drive by this place on my commute home from work all the time but never bothered to stop in to check out the place. The decor is great, the restaurant and bar area were very clean, they have some great artwork on the walls. I was undecided btw the tuna melt and the burger, I asked the server for his opinion an he suggested the burger. Let me tell you one of the best burgers I've had period, and this is coming from a person who loves to eat!!!! I def recommend coming here and trying it for yourself! Had the white chocolate banana bread for desert and that was pretty delicious as well! Overall two thumbs, btw the service and the food ill def be back to this place in the near future!
author: Dmitriy G.

description:
Where IS everybody?  Last week most of the Restaurants around Washington Square and along Columbus Ave. were still closed up at noon.  Yesterday, bright and sunny, walking along Van Ness, someone came out the door of Tommy's Joynt and looking in we were surprised to see the place almost empty as well.    Same for Soluna---three of us in the entire place at noon, and right on the Civic Center at that.  

Hmmm.  Well, the food at Soluna was worth it.  I've eaten here before, had cocktails on a couple of other occasions.  It's not a great restaurant, not a culinary wonder, but it's good.   The burger I had yesterday was one of the best I've had in a long time.  The Partner ordered the Thai Chicken salad and it smelled as delicious as he said it turned out to be.   I had the Big Guy Red wine, which was decent, and the french fries, while the softest I've had---reminiscent of those at In N Out (In N Out's weakest link, in my opinion are their fries)--were none the less very flavorful, I liked them.  It's hard to call them fries though as they're hardly crunchy at all, one would almost think they were steamed (they were not soggy, I must hasten to add).

I must say that the town's cooks really need to brush up on what constitutes Rare meat.  I expressed concern that the last two burgers I'd ordered (at other restaurants) came raw, and despite that, my burger was more on the raw than rare side.   More cooked than the other two, but still a bit too much hot meat, not cooked meat.  The waitress didn't think to ask how it came out until the Partner did, but I was too hungry to let anyone get between me and my dead cow.

I will say this, if anyone at Soluna is reading:  The winter sun shone brightly through the tall windows, exposing every facet of Soluna's decor, and it's not a pretty sight.  The exotic, somewhat Middle Eastern looking color scheme was showing its age.   The tented ceiling looked like it was getting dark from hanging too long without laundering;  the paints looked faded and the light colored wood floor was substantially marked up by the bar stools.  The worst of it though were the banquettes whose velvety fabric was over-worn and dark spotted and looked  bad.   Perhaps acceptable for a bar, but a restaurant?  The feel was that of an old movie theater once the bright lights come up...  Maintenance would have been nice, now more is necessary to revive this decor.

Still, if you're in the Civic Center and don't want an expensive meal, or one at a chain, I'd think you'd be happy to eat lunch at Soluna.
author: Paul T.

description:
It wasn't actually that busy when we came (there were 6 of us).  The bar area was a little bit busy because of their happy hour, but we wanted to sit down and eat dinner anyways.  The dinner area had maybe two tables full at the time - one was a table of 6 and another table of two.  

We asked the waitress for a table, and she immediately responded with "Do you have a reservation?"

"Um.. No"

*pause* "OK. Well, let me see what I can do." 

And here we're thinking, I hope they can get us in! We're starving at this point.  We'd all just gotten off work and drove straight to SF.  She came back to us about 10 minutes later, and said "OK, I had to do some moving around, but we can get you a sea"

Excellent! Amazing! Five stars!!!

No.  Not really. 

The service was AWFUL.  It took the waitress over 30 minutes to take our order and was it because the restaurant got busy? No.  The place stayed pretty much half empty the entire time we were there.   We actually had to get up, and tap our waitress on the shoulder, and ask her to come take our order.

It then took another hour and half for our food to come out.  The kitchen got slammed, she said, should be another 10 minutes.   30 minutes later, we're still waiting.  We've only been sitting here for an hour, sure put all the happy hour people ahead of us.  We don't mind.  We're only STARVING and about to eat a napkin or pass out. 

When the food finally came.. Big fat disappointment.  My friend ordered a steak that he polished off in about 3 bites.  He looked like he wanted to cry or kill someone.  The burger with the supposed bacon in the patty, did not taste like it and was really meh.  I've had better burgers at St. Johns in Sunnyvale.  The bleu cheese was really overpowering, and it just didn't balance right.

The only thing that was amazingly good was the french fries.  But its not enough for me to give them two stars.

I really don't ever want to come back here.  Super over priced, horrible service, and food is just blah. Oh! And because we were a party of 6 they automatically charged us 18%! For what?  Seriously inattentive, horrible service?  If it was up to me, I would've tipped nothing.
author: Pamada K.

description:
Rene, Ed, Ron and the rest of the gang here are the beez-neez! Awesome food (read: local, organic, seasonal and thoughtful), tasty beverages ("orange tic-tacs"= good times) and a super friendly staff (girls greater than guys ratio= vvvvery niiiiceee!!!) means soluna is the place for your executive lunches, after work HH, weekend brunch and other culinary needs! 

Favorites: mac & cheese (arguably the best in sf under $$$$) mussels in flavored juices (order an extra piece of ciabatta!) and the braised lamb shank (as big as my head) are a winning strategy for food coma! 

Cheers!

PS- Soluna is a fantastic option for private parties! Organized event planning with lots of options, thoughtful small touches ( personalized party menus with themed borders and a respectable server to guest ratio has kept me coming here for 3 years straight of private parties for my staff of 20.
author: G M.

description: Slowest service ever. Does it really take 50 minutes to make a burger and fries?
author: Kevin W.

description:
Dinner for two on a Tuesday night. Made a reservation, but only 1/3 of the restaurant was occupied which was nice. I could actually have a conversation without shouting, "WHAT?" every ten seconds. Service was good. We ordered two drinks, one entree and two appetizers to share. That seemed a bit meager so we asked the waitress what she recommended and she that what we ordered was a good amount and to see how we felt after we ate. That was a bit of a surprise to me because I really expected her to take advantage of us and prompt us to order more. We were glad that she suggested so because we were stuffed. 

The waitress was pretty attentive until the end of our meal, which wasn't really an issue; we were not in a hurry to leave. It just took awhile for her to pick up our credit card. The person clearing our plates asked us if we wanted our food boxed but forgot, no biggie. We ended up leaving pretty satisfied.  

Area is a little sketchy. Watch out of the bums!
author: Shirley W.

description:
You will sometimes find this place packed with an awkward mix of recently divorced middle-aged barristers and at times too obviously romantically deprived law students.  It's not necessarily my scene.  But I still go here from time to time.  Why?  One word:  appetizers.  They are excellent, and if you go there during happy hour, cheap.  Now, I'm not talking about anything exotic here.  If you're looking for caviar and Crystal, go elsewhere.  But when it comes to staple appetizer fare, Soluna rocks it.  Pot stickers, spring rolls, skewers, lettuce wraps, they have it all.  And it's all good.

Soluna has a nice, contemporary vibe and fantastic service. Civic Center. This is the heart of our city, people.
author: Jessica T.

description: Totally dissapointing meal. Nothing flavorful. Old, dingy, smelly building. Would never go back. brussel sprout appetizer under cooked, clam & crab spaghetti dull with one jalepeno slice and a small sprinkling of crab. Dessert even dull. chocolat Mousse lacked pizazz and bread pudding just heavy dry and little sauce on it.
author: Kaylah D.

description:
The host tried to make amends by giving us a free sorbet. We were not spoken to for 15 minutes after we were on time for our reservation and seated. We then had the host take our order to have appetizers and entree brought at the same time to get to our curtain time. After 1 hour, all of our food came and we ate in 10 minutes and got to the theater as they dimmed lights
Food: burger was delicious but the Brie is lost in the aoli
Carbonara was delicious. Polenta with sugo was small and of uniform red flavor
Drinks: very diluted Martinis with Mushy onions that disintegrated into the drink
Service: poor. Our waitress explained he had a big table keeping her from us. When we mentioned our rush for the theater,  she said, "Everyone here is going to a show".  I also stared at her to get her attention in the 45 minute stretch waiting for my food and she actively ignored me. We tipped normally and won't return.
author: Jeanette H.

description: Good food, decent price. This place is in my neighborhood and I waited forever to try it. But Im glad my husband and I finally went in. We went for dinner on a Friday night and it was empty. We had a roasted butternut squash and spinach salad which was great. Big enough to share as an appetizer. I had a pork chop which was ok, a little fatty. My husbands burger was really good and his fries were great. The wine was way overpriced. The dessert was not good, we had this crumble thing and we were really disappointed with that. I read bad things about the service here but out waiter was very pleasant.
author: Katelin N.

description: We were there for an early reservation. Several food items on the menu that we ordered were not available. Also they ran out of white wine by the glass and several champagnes but said we could buy a $60 bottle or higher. Could not they have come up with a solution, opened a bottle and sold it by the glass? The food we ordered was very good, however.
author: K K.

description:
Went here before a show at the Orpheum. Very convenient since it is within walking distance. The burger and fries I had were perfectly cooked, and delicious. Fiance had sea bass and cannelloni beans, which were also great, although a few beans were under cooked. But very satisfied with the meal. And the pumpkin cheesecake was outstanding, with a nice brulee on top. Atmosphere was warm, and the servers were professional. Music might have been a bit loud, and it was some trip-hop or something, but it was okay. 

Good place to go for a nice dinner out, that isn't too formal.
author: Jason R.

description:
Terrible terrible service! We were so disappointed!

I had been here once before and it was alright. Nothing great, but an okay spot to grab a drink and a bite to eat before seeing a show at the Orpheum theatre. 

This past time, however, we waited over 10 minutes at our bar table before even being acknowledged. Then our server said we couldn't get the happy hour prices, because it was too late, even though we were there and waiting significantly before 7. We told him we had a show, so we ordered a few appetizers quickly and he said it would be no problem to get our food out. 40 minutes later, no food and no server. We asked a few other servers and bartenders, who all acted snotty and giggled to each other, as if we were being super demanding. The story from the kitchen was that they were still plating. Antipasto doesn't even require cooking! But they couldn't even get that out to us. 

After all of that and the rude responses, we canceled our order, and asked for the check. After waiting for that as well, we finally threw some cash on the table and walked out. I sure hope it wasn't enough for a tip. 

So frustrating to be hungry and aggravated before a 3 hour show! We will most definitely not be frequenting this disaster of a restaurant again.
author: Whitney B.

description: They should call this place Slowluna. Delicious food, but NOT worth the wait or inattentive service.
author: Laura C.

description: There's quite a range of ratings for Soluna Cafe and Lounge.  Hubby and I happened to drop in on a cold winter evening before an event at the Civic Center.  Perhaps it was the weather, but stepping inside was like entering a warm, comfortable neighborhood lounge from a bygone era.  Lighting was dim but nice, and a movie was playing on the far wall.  We only sat at the bar, had a few drinks including a Yelp Check-In deal, and enjoyed a cheese and charcuterie plate.  Though the portions were small, the quality was excellent.  They also had some of the largest green olives I've ever seen!  Fresh and tasty!  Soluna looks like a place for those who like intimate, relaxing and slowly-eaten meals.  I would let the servers know ahead of time if you are on a schedule.
author: Sherri C.

description:
I didn't pay for my lunch and I have no idea how much my three courses cost so I can't tell you about if it's a good value or not, but I can tell you how much I liked my food.

Carrot ginger soup:  Flavorful without being too heavy or too light.  I could taste both components equally, which was nice because I hate when one flavor overpowers the other.

Pumpkin ravioli with brown butter, sage, toasted pumpkin seeds, spinach and parmiggiano reggiano:  Great flavor combination.  Portion was a little small, and the spinach left that weird chalky/dry feeling in my mouth.

White chocolate bread pudding with ice cream: DELICIOUS.  Best of all, there are no raisins to be found!  

Service was really fast and the servers were very attentive and catering to our needs I only had an hour to spare so they packed my dessert to go and even put the ice cream in a separate container so it wouldn't get soggy in the box.
author: Jenn C.

description: I really like this place.  This time I had their carrot soup and the cheese plate appetizer.  The food was very good - as expected from my last visit.  I went in for dinner alone and the service was great, which was a nice surprise.  Sometimes servers see a single person as a "wasted" table and give lousy service, by my experience was great.  The menu is a nice mix of California cuisine and standby favorites.  I'm not a foodie and I can always find something great on the menu, which changes frequently.  I would definitely recommend that you make reservations though, as it's a small restaurant and if you go before the symphony or opera there is very limited seating.
author: Jardee W.

description:
We ducked into Soluna for some shelter against the chill and strong winds.  I was happy to find a nice looking joint to sit down & warm up for a bit.  The weather insisted on some soup so I ordered a cup of carrot ginger.  The carrot was muted and the soup was under-seasoned.

We also ordered some truffle fries to munch on.  The fries were soggy, but damned if they weren't tasty.  Strong truffle flavorings, generous amounts of parm, and great dipping sauces.  It's a shame the fries weren't fresh.
author: David C.

description:
It wouldn't be fair to call out on the entire establishment, so I only went for 1 drink at the bar with a Yelp Check In Deal.  The place is nice and good for a drink.  I had something like a Manhattan but with a small twist.  The drink was good and the bartender was helpful in explaining what was in it.  

I don't know how the food is or any of that stuff, but the place offers a nice atmosphere for a catchup.
author: Vincent K.

description: Not bad for a quick lunch near civic center.  An average cobb salad.
author: Josh B.

description:
We went here yesterday because it was listed on the Orpheum Theater website as one of the nearest restaurants (we went to see Billy Elliott). I made a reservation for two a day before for 630 (happy hour ends at 7). I got there at 6:15 and the hostess said the table will be ready in 10 mins. My friend got there 2 mins later. We were seated at about 630. We asked for the happy hour menu but was told we're seated in the NON-happy hour area (we just laughed). The hostess could have offered us the happy hour while waiting for our table in the first place! Whatever. So we ordered everything at the same time (cocktails, the appetizer fries, main entrees). 

45 mins passed with NO appetizer served to us. And we looked around and there's enough servers so like what's the wait all about? Our lady server came up to us saying that kitchen forgot our fries and it should be be served right away. I made her aware that we have a show to catch at 8 pm. Our main entrees came first. It was 730 pm and we asked again for the fries and she said the kitchen forgot it again and she said that it will be on the house this time. Cool, right?

But after a few mins, she came up to us for the 3rd time and told us that the kitchen forgot the fries AGAIN! And she will give us dessert on the house instead. How can the kitchen forget an order for the THIRD time???!!! Crazy!!! Send out a memo to all regarding COMMUNICATION is they key to success!!! :)

so, the 3 stars are mainly for the entrees we ordered: the crispy free range fried chicken with grilled asparagus and smashed fingerling potatoes, and the orange soy grilled sockeye salmon with sauteed zucchini and smashed fingerling potatoes. I guess, it was worth the wait...but, the garlic-thyme fries will just be forever a dream.
author: Emil J.

description: Tuna salad was not very good.  Based on food alone this would be a 2 star review.... staff was excellent!
author: Emmett C.

description: Maia was our server and she rocked.  My wife and I were heading to the Theatre and we had heard great things about this casual, hip place near the Theatre.  We loved the service, the food was amazing and they had a nice little wine selection.  The soup of the day (Corn with Hatch Pepper - Chowder) was awesome as well as the Fried Chicken.  I will be back before our next Theatre outing!  Great experience!
author: Keith R.

description:
We went in on a Monday night, when they were only serving the bar menu. Easy enough. Good wings and fried string beans. Great cocktails - I had the smoke something, with scotch and a hint of sweetness and bitters really well balanced. 

The burger was awesome! I've never had a burger with bacon mixed in to the ground beef before. They use really lean chuck and add the bacon for the fat and flavor. It was really amazing. Of course, I added bacon on top because, when in doubt, add bacon. Just a personal mantra of mine.
author: Josh G.

description:
I don't know what it is about dim, warm lighting, but I always feel comforted by it. This place was nice in that aspect. 

I came here for dinner  with my aunt and had the mac & cheese (minus the bacon). If you're starving, I wouldn't recommend getting this. Don't get me wrong, it was surprisingly really filling (and the waitress even said so), but the portion is -really- small.  And if your stomach isn't easily sated, I'd probably recommend getting something else from the menu that's a little on the heftier side of a serving. My aunt had a salad - I forgot what exactly it was she ordered, except I believe there were bits of blood oranges in it and it was strangely addicting. Wasn't too fond of their bread, though.

The servers are attentive, and if you have a problem they're pretty quick to fix it and aren't at all rude about it. My aunt and I were a little pressed for time, though, and my aunt had told our waitress about this. Of course, our food didn't come out any faster. No star deductions for this, though. I think it's in poor taste not to properly plan for such things when you know you have to be somewhere at a certain time, but I figure this might help others who have a show to attend and are running a little late.

Overall, it's a decent restaurant.  Good to try if you've never been here before, but I don't see myself coming back unless someone else drags me here.
author: Ashley F.

description:
I was trying to think of a concise little tag line to describe this little spot that has has subtly disappointed me a few times now over the years. Here it is:

This spot has the worst coffee to highest pretense of any restaurant or cafe in the city.

I've all but ruled out their subpar bar menu.

The mac and cheese and reuben sandwich on the lunch menu are good but at prices and portion sizes you'd expect from a hotel downtown.

I have a few gripes with this place. Every time I've been in it seems as if the place is nearly empty. Yet servers and staff move at glacial speed and are fairly inattentive.

The staff seem to have a bit of an intimidating uppity attitude even when you wander in wearing a suit after doing business at City Hall.

But what the HELL is up with charging $4 for a watery, crappy Americano? Are you out of your mind? Why is it that I can get a better product (and less attitude) at any Mission hipster spot for half the price? Guys, if you're going to charge FOUR BUCKS for a cup of coffee, you'd better damn well know what you're doing. Here's a hint: an Americano should never be served in a pint glass and if it is, it better damn well have at least four shots in it.
author: JayBee L.

description: Showed up last night with my girlfriend after the kitchen had closed. (9pm since it isn't listed here) and they reopened the kitchen for us.  Dinner was nice and we were served cocktails after they closed.  Very accommodating and very nice.  Will come back the next time we visit the city.
author: John H.

description:
Stopped in for happy hour and ordered a signature cocktail with tequila, pale ale, and pineapple juice for $7.  The drink was refreshing and had me wanting more!  I loved the combo of the alcohol and to top it off fresh sage.  It was quiet time of day and I didn't order any food.  The bartender was very slow, but the location was good.  
I gave it three stars because they had a happy hour menu, but the service was lacking.
author: Sophie G.

description: I have the civic burger and fries. It was a great burger. Its a cozy cafe and very enjoyable, I thought. Myself and a friend were able to chat and it was a good time, not too loud and the staff were attentive.
author: John M.

description:
The interior looks like the set rejected from that Indian Jones movie with the monkey and the sword vs. gun fight.  It's dark.  It's covered in cloth, it looks mystical, and slightly fire-hazardous.  
The people inside are very independent.  This is my way of saying, they don't care what you think of them, because they have all the positive referrals they need.  
And why would anyone rename a chicken sandwich with lettuce into "chicken ceasar sandwich"?  Pretentious much?  Truffled fries?  Better than truffle mashed potatoes I had at this unmentionable place that made me want to Akins my diet.  
This is not the cream in my coffee.  It is not the apple of my eye.  But it has a not-too-terrible sounding Happy Hour FOOD menu.  If you can stand the independence.
author: Christina C.

description: I've been here a lot. It never gets better. There's a $10 minimum on card, and I generally don't want to be there past one drink, so that makes me pretty upset. I paid $11 for a martini once, just to meet the limit so I could be social and then get the hell out of there. The bartender literally poured me some vodka and put a bit of olive juice in it - no vermouth. And then the olives had pits in them. It was awful.
author: Emily D.

description: Food was delish.   Some of the best French fries ever.   Service however was horrid. Drinks sat at bar till no longer cold, asked for water a number of times and never received.   Seems all the tables around we're having the same problem.  Fortunately we got our check in time to make it to the theater, not sure the table next to us was so fortunate.
author: nancy K.

description: Very average, Was hoping for better.  Place was dead on a Saturday night.  Roasted Tomato soup was good and a very generous size.  Service was good and attentive.  Will probably not be going back here.
author: Greg B.

description:
I do not recommend this place.  I've been there more than once so you can trust me.  

I second Ali K.'s Mothers Day brunch experience.  Change your website if you're not serving brunch or bottom-less mimosas!  AND when we ask you if you are serving bottom-less mimosas, please answer our question, without us having to ask again.  

Please refill my coffee at least once without me having to get on my hands and knees to beg.  Yuck, my salmon sandwich was on a terrible bun - no different than what you'd find at a school cafeteria.  The salmon had all the skin still on it and was cold.  Thankfully I had a cold and couldn't really taste what I was eating because my nose was so stuffed up.

What a waste of time and money.
author: Lauren K.

description: Get the char! It is delicious. Great restaurant to go to before the symphony or opera. Nice intimate atmosphere. Their special Yelp! Cocktail was pretty good, like a Moscow mule with Whiskey. Service is not rushed, be sure to tell them ahead of time if you need to catch a show.
author: Tracey K.

description: All I can say is, Wow, Wow, and Wow!  These are not good wow's ,FYI!  I should have read the reviews before coming here last night during the 7th inning of game 6.  We went intending on ordering a full dinner, and decided not to when our drink order alone took 20 mins., along with the advice of our rude ass waitress to just cancel our drinks if we didn't want to wait, and she said, were really busy as you can see at the bar!  We did not cancel our drinks, and  I told her that I just thought we might get our drinks before we ordered our food, that was all.  Then I noticed the table next to us get 3 orders of hotwings delivered to their table, so I asked about them, saying they weren't on our menu, and her response was rude and annoyed(not surprised), saying well there only on our bar menu which is only being honored during these games.  I then asked if I could please see the menu, and she returned and tossed it on our table and walked away.  At this point she deserved a good slap in the face!  Finally getting our drinks we just ordered wings and some kind of $5 nut and olive mix.  I was not about to order a full meal from this jerk.  Neither of us were.  Long story short, we left still hungry and pissed about the service.  I didn't even want to waste my breathe with the manager, because more that 90% of the time, at the end of the day, they don't care and will probably never mention a word to the problem child!  I hope that the manager sees this and the other posts ,that are  obviously pointing their fingers at the same waitress of theirs that only wants to blame the customer, and has no clue as to what true customer service is.  I work in the service industry, and we all know that you never blame the customer!  If I could give minus 5 stars, I would have!
author: Rachel W.

description: The chicken wings are totally godlike. What else does a place need, absolutely nothing as far as I'm concerned but yelp won't let me post a two sentence review so whatever yelp. The servers are nice and the foods good. Give it a try if you're in the area and you shan't be disappointed.
author: Charlie L.

description: I went here with a group of friends before the ballet. Our friendly server was thoughtful enough to ask if we had a show to get to, and we informed her that we did indeed. I shared several vegetarian dishes with half the table including salads, a risotto, and a white bean dish. Everything was delicious. I especially enjoyed all the salads. They were great about splitting checks, making change, and getting us out in time to make it to the ballet on time. woo!
author: Vrushali P.

description:
I'm not sure what's going on at this overly expensive, pedestrian California cuisine restaurant.  Stumbling out of the Asian Art Museum, three friends and myself crossed the street to Soluna.  We were all famished.  Never before have I been so hungry and not like the food.  

The Lobster bisque was actually quite good - not fishy at all and had a nice hint of chili peppers but didn't burn you.  Was very good.

From there the salad looked and tasted like it came out of a Dole bag and the 'local crab' cakes were fishy and tasteless. Veggie kabobs and Buffalo pot roast also left me wondering if the chef is the same guy who caters for Delta flights.  

Save your time and money and just ignore this place.  You'll do much better anywhere else.
author: David S.

description: Pretty great place. It's close to everything in the civic center. It's got great food and drinks. Try their Bourbon Burger Special during happy hour. Only problem is they aren't always open when you want them to be.
author: David N.

description:
I hate to say it, but this place has gone downhill.

I've been to Soluna a few times over the past 3-4 years. And each time I thought they were decent!  However this last visit really left me feeling like it was waste of money.  The main courses we had were mediocre and over priced. The service was slow and it was really hot in there (granted, it was one of the hottest days of the year but the lack of ventilation made it really uncomfortable).

That being said, we did have some delicious starters and wine. If I were to recommend this place, I would say to stick with the starters and share a bunch of those. 

I was also told that they were changing up their menu soon so for their sake, I hope it works in their favor. As for me, I probably wont bother going again.
author: Melanie N.

description:
We popped in for lunch a few weeks back.  This is my second time eating at Soluna even though I've worked two blocks away for the past 7 years.  It's great for a business sit-down type of lunch spot.  I'd eat here more often for lunch if the prices were a bit lower.  Entrees run on average $11-$12.  

-Housemade soup tomato-fennel soup 3.5
-Reuben sandwich our corned beef, red sauerkraut, gruyere, rye bread, russian dressing 11.5
-Civic burger house ground all-natural beef & applewood smoked bacon patty, arugula, potato sticks, pickled red onion, bacon aioli, choice of pt. reyes blue cheese, white cheddar or gruyere 12
author: Stacey L.

description:
This place has a very mixed clientele because of its location.  Law students from Hastings come here, theatre-goers waiting for their shows come here and tourists out for a stroll by city hall come here.  This bar/lounge feels very light and airy.  Red walls are offset by the blond wood and the light fixtures are eye-catching.

We hung out here for a couple of hours waiting for our show to start.  Speaking of which, when you order a dinner entree and tell them you are seeing a show, your dessert will be free.

We had the savory clams (with chorizo, cherry tomatoes and garlic-herb broth), which I highly recommend!  I assumed that since this was an appetizer that it would be small, so I was shocked at the large bowl  that came out.  The clams were perfect and the flavor, wow.  It comes with grilled ciabatta so you can sop up the broth.  We also had the fries with parmesan and white truffle oil.  The fries are good, but not spectacular.  The aioli dipping sauce is fine, but try dipping it in some of that garlic-herb broth you still have left over.

We also tried the mango creme brulee (vanilla bean custard, mango, turbinado sugar and toasted coconut).  It's not a dessert I'd recommend.  They only call this a mango dessert because of the few chunks sitting on top.  Plus, it comes out cold, so it's pre-made.  Have you had warm creme brulee before?  It's the only way to go.

For drinks, my friend ordered the Sweet Heat (house infused jalapeno tequila, cilantro syrup, passionfruit, fresh cilantro and soda) and I had the Abbey Road (house infused cucumber gin, basil syrup, meyer lemon, fresh basil and soda).  The spiciness of the Sweet Heat was overwhelmed by the passionfruit, so they need to up the tequila (but who doesn't want more liquor in their drink?).  The Abbey Road was much better and a refreshing drink for the summer.

We sat at the bar and the service was pretty poor.  The bartender looked like she was crazed, but it wasn't even crowded.  I can't believe it was so hard to get her attention.
author: Carol L.

description: The food actually wasn't that but, but they weren't very happy that they had to rush our meals so that we could watch Lion King at the Orpheum nearby. Sorry for giving you business!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Soluna had, hands down, the WORST service! We were in town for a concert and decided to stop in for a couple of drinks before the show. It was me and one other person. There was an open table by the bar and we waited a good 20 minutes before we were even helped. Once we finally got someone to help us, the waiter obviously could not have cared less about what we wanted. The drinks (2 beers) took a long time to get out to us. As I got my ticket to pay, I noticed they added some food on there and we had not eaten. When I talked to the girl at the register, she checked my table as if I had been lying. I guess I can understand that part but why was the food on there in the first place?  There were a lot of people but not super packed. We figured they might have been overwhelmed and it was just bad timing for us. After the concert we decided to meet some friends there and try our luck again. We figured most of the people were gone so service would have improved. Oh no! It was just as bad if not worse. The hipster bartender was too cool for school and was so rude. The person taking our order (bearded guy.. big surprise.) was a major ass. We finally just left. I would never come back here and I would steer anyone else I knew away.
author: H R.

description: Very unique drink options, and no wait for a table on a Saturday  night.  The food was pretty good, and the service exemplary.  Also, make sure you check in on your favourite social media outlet for a nice surprise during your meal. We will definitely be back!
author: Dana M.

description:
This is a jewel in san Francisco, I must say this restaurant takes great pride in the food they serve, one can tell the chef is & has traoned/worked in fine establishments.
It's not often I go out of my way to give dibbs to one of the better venues in this city, but my bill was reasonable actually very reasonable considering the very high quality of food & the excellent service we received. I highly recommend this place.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
This was one of the best experiences I have had in a restaurant. The cocktails are excellent. The drink "Castaway" is the best drink I have had, with its strawberry pepper marmalade, adds a nice pepper flavor with a sweet taste. The garlic thyme fries were a very flavorful starter. The dinners were amazing. The pork was hands down the best peice of meet I have tasted, anywhere. And don't forget dessert. We had the truffles and the were a great to end this amazing experience. If you are going to see the opera, let them know, you will be treated to a nice surprise. 

I cannot wait to go there again. Don't  miss the chance to try this place!
author: Ron C.

description:
I'm really confused by the two camps on Soluna. We had a delightful experience at 7 PM on a Friday. The server was extremely courteous and prompt, and we were never out of water or bread or waiting for drinks. The fish and steak were both delicious.

I'm not sure what all the negative reviews on here regarding service or being ignored are about. Maybe it is a crapshoot. We were feeling lucky and had a great time, so hopefully you have a good experience too.
author: Sean F.

description:
I stopped here with a reservation for 1 before I headed to a play that I couldn't convince any of my friends to see with me.  It was a Treat Yo'self-type of night, and the play and the meal were worth it.  I was on a schedule, but the meal was so good and the food came out so quickly that I was able to enjoy a second glass of wine and a dessert before I headed to the theater.  Waitress was great -- I let her know I was headed to a play but that I really wanted the bread pudding before I left, and she worked some magic to get it rushed to me and run my card so that I could head to the show as soon as I was finished.  

Food was good.  I had the pork chop and the peas and carrot puree.  The pork chop was fine, but I realized after it came out that it had a spice on it that I'm not a fan of, but I was too lazy to note that when I looked at the menu.  Not the kitchen's fault, and everythign else was great.  The peas and carrots were so bright and tasty, I started imagining ways to get my sister to copy them for Thanksgiving, even though she will eat neither.  Bread pudding was good -- a little dense, but the accompanying ice cream was just a tiny little scoop, so my semi-professional dessert eating opinion is that a bit more ice cream would make it perfect.

Great price, given what I ordered.  Great service.  Very good food.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Came here with hubby and two friends before the SF Symphony. Now, they're two blocks from Davies and were half empty an hour before the opera AND symphony. Warning sign? Perhaps. 

In a nutshell:
Pork belly app: no-go, not sure what happened but it was way over-cooked and not very appetizing.
Wine/drink list: so-so, not that memorable.
Gnocchi with oxtail ragu: Tasty ragu, not enough gnocchi. Not bad at all.
Fish and beef dishes: Friends tried these, they didn't say much and didn't finish their food.

Biggest issue was that they came back to my husband twice to confirm his order, and STILL got it wrong (gave him gnocchi instead of the beef). However, they were very nice in comping his dinner and sending over four little truffles (the chai one was tasty). 

So-so experience, won't go back. There aren't a lot of choices for a good dinner in the area, so I suggest eating somewhere else in SF and cabbing in to Davies/Orpheum/War Memorial/opera etc.
author: Adrienne C.

description: The restaurant is excellent for theater goers.  The food is great as well as the service. It is rather expensive if you order wine  but quality is worth it.
author: nancy y.

description: This place rocks!  I cannot say enough good things about Soluna - we held a 40th birthday party there recently and I was so impressed with everything!  From the food, to the atmosphere, to the service, to the signature drinks they made and named especially for my event :). They really did a great job and made me and guests feel so welcomed. If you are planning an event you should definitely check them out.
author: Nat L.

description: We had a bridal party here.  Everything was excellent, I can't say enough good things.  The drinks were delicious, the food excellent and the service was fast and friendly.  So glad the bride picked this.
author: Marlene M.

description:
Another pre-theatre meal (Avenue Q!) and I was left torn. I really enjoyed the food we ordered but again, I felt they were so busy and didn't have time to get us out of there before our show. This is the best location for dining pre Orpheum, so I keep coming back. 

Let me break it down - First, my friend had called ahead to reserve tables at the bar for a large (I think 10 or so person) group. We arrived to no tables being saved - awkward. No problem... they let us sit in the restaurant and order off the happy hour menu, which ended up being perfect. Still a little annoying that they had a note to reserve the tables and somehow we slipped between the cracks. 

The small issue occurred when we wanted to pay. We wanted the bill just split in half (1/2 table on one ticket and 1/2 on the other) so it would be easier to pay as a large group and they were unable to do that without us going through the itemized bill and telling them what each person had to eat and drink for the last 2 hours, which wasn't realistic. The servers were really nice, but it was still a little frustrating. :/ 

With that said the food was very good. I was impressed by the burger on the happy hour menu and the delicious crisp fries that came with it. I also had a wonderful Mojito made fresh by the bartender (yum!). Also the Happy Hour menu prices are very reasonable and a good excuse to come back. I would vote this place is better for a group of 2-4.

I guess its just frustrating that both times I have been here we have problems with pre-theatre timing even though the majority of the diners are headed to a show...
author: Natalie N.

description:
Since Soluna is near my school and law students are usually borderline alcoholics, my friends and I stop by here fairly frequently. Their happy hour drinks are fairly priced, and the service is friendly.

My food experiences have been good as well - mmm, truffle fries with spicy ketchup. I once got a Thai salad that was pretty kickass and delightfully spicy. We've had a couple problems with wait times on food delivery (with no explanation), but otherwise I have no complaints about Soluna.
author: Miranda N.

description:
While I was waiting for some friends at the Orpheum, I overheard an usher offer dinner recommendation for Soluna to fellow Wicked spectators.  Since it was so close, my friends (who also read reviews on Yelp that this would be the ideal place to go before watching Wicked) and I decided to go to Soluna for dinner.

The ambiance of the place was really romantic with its dim lights and cozy corners.  The servers were all quite friendly, quick to cater to our fulfillment.  However...that was all the perks that Soluna has to offer.  I wasn't that hungry, so I just ordered the Mac n' Cheese.  For those who know me, I enjoy connoisseuring different types of mac n' cheese-whether it has some fancy schmancy truffles or just your average Southern cheesiness, I like to sample it all!  To my dismay, the mac n' cheese at Soluna was very unsatisfying.  There was hardly any flavor or seasoning nor was there any hint of a cheese aroma!

If you have the time, I suggest making the walk and finding a place to eat elsewhere.
author: Vicki T.

description: Karaoke at this location was nice and fun especially if you're with a big group of people. The small Hors D'oeuvres like the potato wrapped bacon and slider burgers were nice. I did not like the watered down Long Ice I ordered though. If I'm paying $9 for it, I should expect it to have some kick. And I had three of these. All watered down.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Might have had the best meal yet here last night. Branched out from my usual fish-based main course selection and went for beef. It was fabulous. But the biggest improvement was dessert. We had the dark chocolate and banana pie as well as the Zeppoles. Both were simply fabulous.

The service continues to be top notch. 

Also, for this visit, we were seated on one of the little sofas, which are very comfortable. So we've come full circle from our first visit. 

I continue to be baffled by some of the negative reviews of Soluna. This is place is first class through and through.
author: Richard P.

description:
We had been to Soluna a couple of times previously, including Mother's Day Brunch in May 2009.  We had enjoyed the brunch and the special bottomless mimosas, so made reservations to return for Mother's Day again this year.  Noticed that the website had not been updated, and still listed the Special Mother's Day Brunch for 2010, "Chef Hogan's new brunch menu featuring house-made Charcuterie, Corned Beef Hash, Steelhead Gravalax, Tiramisu Stuffed French Toast, and many more... Bottomless mimosas for $15, and a special treat for all mothers!"  Although this was for 2010, we assumed that it was an annual Mother's Day special, since it was similar to their 2009 Brunch.

We were very disappointed to learn that there was no special Mother's Day Brunch, in fact, no brunch menu and no bottomless mimosas.  It was just Soluna's regular Lunch menu.  Several of us were looking forward to brunch items such as omelettes and corned beef hash.  We even considered moving to another restaurant, but we were all hungry and realized that it would be too much of a hassle, at that point, to find another nearby restaurant our party of five.  Our disappointment was somewhat allayed by the food, which was good, but nevertheless, it was not what we had hoped for.
author: Kyle T.

description:
I like how yelp let us share our experiences here, so that others can see it too. i respect other peoples' reviews on this place, and understand that everyone has different views. Here's my experienced at this place:
I don't feel welcome here. I waited a while for the bartender(s) to get me my drink. This was at 530pm on a Wednesday evening and he didn't approached me until I waved at him, which was about 15 minutes later. His name is Ron. 
I can understand if the place was crowed, but the bar was somewhat empty, so I was a little upset and had to write this review. 
By the way, this place has a lot of business people too, and I want to let the bartenders know, that just because I don't dress like business people, doesn't mean you get to treat me differently. My ex coworkers came here awhile back, and they too, didn't feel welcome.
author: Sophan L.

description:
I'd heard rumors that Soluna had a new chef, so thought I'd drop in for another taste. 

I gotta say again, the decor here is damn nice.  I like the vibe of the place, and they had a big screen in the back silently playing "airplane" (classic movie) so I was re-sold walking in.

Flying solo this time, I sat at the bar so I woudlnt look like a  creepy loners (and instead like a creepy drunk heh).  Gotta say though, the waitress here was HOT! 

Drew was the bartender, and I liked his style.  Conversational and friendly, I could tell he was still keeping his shit together behind the bar.  They have some pretty tasty and unique drizanks here, so i'm sure he's used to being busy.

To test out the new chef I had the Steak... medium rare of course.  It came with brussel sprouts sautted with bacon, and some potatoes underneath as well.  Of course i had a glass of red to wash it down

Perfectly cooked, well seasoned and that melty in your mouth sensation left me damn happy with my meal.  No matter how often I go to a fine dining place I'm alwyas a bit shocked at the quantity/price ratio, but the meal was big enough here that I left surprisingly happy.

and the brussel sprouts!!! Shiiiiit, cover anything with bacon and I'll eat it.. these guys were no exception.  Full of flavor and bacony goodness.  I'm not lying when i say I licked a little bit off my plate....

I asked about other changes from the chef, and apparently there's some new menu items, and some subtle changes to others (like a new rissotto for their lamb). 

Well done new chef... well done.  I'll be back for more.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Chill out on the salt please.  Lower your high prices for the little food you serve Soluna.  

If you want over salted olive tapenade on toasted baguettes, then this is the place to go. If you want huge plates with very little food on it, then this is the place to go for dinner.

My guest had  tuna (dinner) plate  which was practically empty.  It was strange to serve very little food on a 14" rounded plate.  Crazy presentation.

I did like my fish ( however a little over-salted), it was served with celery on the top, that was weird and did not like the celery at all as a topping on fish.  Yuck..  The sizzling mushrooms were good, but again,  little salty.  Where is every cooking back there, LAY off the SALT and use seasoning, or infused herbs.   The fish was served over large wedges of potatoes.  The dish would have more of an elegant vibe if the potatoes were sliced thinner,  thus making them easier to eat. Seeing huge wedges under the fish was strange and the presentation was stupid.

There was a court judge and his peers there sitting nearby our table, all they were talking about work and the law.  Gosh, what conversations we were subjected to.  

Won't go back to Soluna Cafe & Lounge.    For those high prices, serve more food.  No more of the tiny portion dinner plates.

PS:  I have eaten there before but I had the Bar Food - Hamburgers and Fries which were good.  So that is why I wanted to try dinner.  Sorry I did.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
My family and I ate her on February 25, 2011. When we arrived, happy hour going full blast and the noise was deafening! We sat at a window seat overlooking the community vegetable garden next door--and City Hall. After Happy Hour was over, the restaurant became very peaceful and enjoyable as there were only about eight people left and they began showing vintage movies.

Food was average and service was very good.
author: Finnegan M.

description:
Met Nish here prior to an event at City Hall. The place was pretty empty at 5pm. It was one of the hottest days in the city so I suppose everyone was hanging out at outdoor bars. 
The bartender insisted on making my Bloody Mary w/Wasabi Saki instead of Vodka..turned out pretty good.
author: Mimi T.

description:
This is a pleasant place close to the symphony and opera. On this particular night was a talk with Steve Martin.
The place was nearly empty when we arrived and apparently the bartender was very, very new. I safely ordered a beer instead of any of the signature cocktails.
The service was prompt and pleasant but again there were only 4 tables occupied.
The filet mignon and pork chop were delicious!!! The chop was super thick cut and cooked perfectly medium rare with a hint of pink inside.... yum. The rosemary bread was also delicious and crunchy on the outside and soft and warm on the inside... funny i like my women like this too. hmmmm?
We finished off with Pot de Creme and were very happy with the blend of scrumptious chocolate with a hint of espresso.
If i am in the area again I would definitely come back
author: Lawrence T.

description: When we ordered our food I tried to find a menu item that didn't have allergic ingredients.  The closest thing was the salmon which had cherry tomatoes (which are whole and can be easily removed).  I explained to the waiter that I'm very allergic to tomatoes and have the chef not put any of them in my food.  When my food arrived I saw no red tomatoes.  It was very dark in the restaurant and what appeared to be cooked pearl onions were on the plate.  I put one in my mouth and realized it was a tomato and spit it out.  Then I proceeded to eat the salmon.   The chef hid tomatoes under the salmon that I couldn't see and I ended up eating one.  I called the waiter immediately and told him the situation.  He didn't offer to remake my entree.  I asked for benedril.  The restaurant didn't have any.  We asked for the bill because we had to leave the restaurant and find a local drugstore that had benedril.  The bill came and they charged us for the salmon I couldn't eat.  My mouth was numb by this point and I needed medication or else I would have argued with the manager.  We got out of there as fast as possible.  The food was lousy.  The service was worse. We'll never go back.
author: Mj J.

description: Three of us (all adults, no kids) went here after a Saturday afternoon at the SF Ballet. Our reservations were at 5:45, which is usually a good time before the kitchen gets rushed. We waited too long for our food and one course never came. When we finally got our main course, it was so-so. I ordered a med-rare steak which was med-to med-well and a bit tough. Between the three of us, only one of us ordered a glass of wine, so it wasn't as though we were delaying our meal because of a big bar tab. This place seemed understaffed, disorganized and basically inept at how to run a restaurant. We did not get out of there until 8:00. Most of the other patrons were there before 8:00 shows. We witnessed one couple leaving mid meal to get to the theater and did not look happy. Poor service, mediocre food and overpriced. We will not be back.
author: Libby K.

description:
This place was horrible. We found it on the web associated with the Orpheum. It took them over 5 minutes to tell us there was only bar seating when the entire place was empty.  Another five minutes to be acknowledged for water or additional drinks.  After 5 more minutes when asked for our order we got up and left. Menu was very limited, overpriced and bathroom
 had doors that led to no where and was smelly.  Observed the bartender making a drink. After stirring the drink he put the stir stick in his mouth and almost back in the drink.  Who knows what goes on in the kitchen.
author: Lauren I.

description:
I wrote this review to say: at least four stars! Three? That's way too low an average. This is a place where I eat at least weekly, often twice weekly, sometimes three times. It's really the only option in this part of the Civic Center/Tenderloin for a real sit-down meal. (The other nearby options are the Asian Art Museum Cafe, which is very good, but cafeteria style; and Lalita Thai, which I also frequent -- very different menu.)

Everything on the menu is very good, nothing is great.

All the salads I recommend. The tuna nicoise is excellent; the Thai chicken just as good.

Burger is just below the gourmet types. Veggie burger is hearty and not out of a package.

Fries are worthwhile for sharing. Lightly dusted with truffle flavoring (?); good aioli.

Only disappointment is the fish and chips. Fish are a little heavy on breading. But serviceable. I eat them now and then, and then regret having done so, but I always go back to them again.

Friendly service.
author: Frank W.

description: House music +  apple martini = happy Susy.
author: Susy C.

description:
Truffle oil fries. I need not say more. Well, except maybe the mac 'n' cheese and chocolate truffles. All exceptional.

The service is good, but not stellar, but then we weren't in a rush. But for the price, I would have liked the waiters to be a little more attentive.

I've been here a couple of times now and would definitely recommend it. Just be aware that they stop serving food fairly early, 9pm I think.
author: Fi J.

description: Went here before a show at the Orpheum Theatre.  Ambiance was lovely, food was better than solid, service was pleasant and nice--and unfortunately slow.  Even drinks from the bar took a very long time to arrive on a Thursday during an early time.  I would recommend getting the comfort food; it was delish.  My daughter's burger was fab--and they were able to make it kids' version (i.e., plain).  Their Mac n' Cheese app was great--with a number of different cheeses in it.  Part of me wishes that it was also offered as a main dish.  We would go back if we had tickets nearby again.
author: Karen W.

description:
We came here before opera, to grab a bite. we were asked for reservation, said no and quickly got a table. The place was mostly empty ( it was 5 pm ) and stayed that way during our stay, so not sure, what this reservation thing was about ...
service was friendly, but slow and ineffective. Lots of staying or running around without doing anything. Though, we were served fast enough. just wonder, what happens, when the place is full ...
We both got the civic burger w/ fries. The burger was cooked as requested, rare and came on a brioche bun, with frizzled onions, brie cheese, and a fried egg ( extra ordered). Very good burger, the reason, i gave 4 stars. We are prob coming back ...
author: Ralph K.

description: Excellent fries.  Good top shelf liquors.   Hit and miss service.  Ordered hamburger no cheese.  Told server about allergy to milk products.  Wait 20 min.  Got hamburger with cheese.  Server took food back to redo.  10 min later got same hamburger with cheese mostly scraped off.  Ran out of time, so my meal was side order of fries.
author: Bill K.

description:
I can only comment on the service for drinks, having not ordered any food.

We were seated at one of the small tables in the bar area. The place was not busy. The waitress forgot about our drink orders twice (two separate orders). Instead, we saw her hanging out behind the bar doing shots with other customers. When we finally got her attention after the second drink-forgetting incident, she eventually brought the drinks and thanked us for our patience--wow. Finally, after swiping a credit card for the bill, she forgot to have us sign the receipt and just took it away. I think she was drunk at that point.
author: Frank B.

description:
The food was good, but the service was HORRIBLE!  Went here on a Tuesday night at 6:15 before a show. The show was at 8:00 PM so we had plenty of time. 

However, we waited 45 for our drinks (appetizers came before our drinks) and another 75 min for our dinner. Our meals were served at 7:45 and were not even hot. We had to ask for the check before we even began eating. 

Given the amount of people compared to the staff it should not have taken this long. Unfortunately, we had a table of 6 so the tip was already included. We will not be back.
author: Beth W.

description: The food is not exactly amazing, but the staff is great & it is a terrific place to go for a drink if you're in the Civic Center. Also, the ambiance is great. Some nights they pull down a projector screen and show old movies in the background, which I found to be a nice (though distracting) touch.
author: Erik C.

description:
It's ok.  I've been here 2x and the entrees aren't really special.  The starters are good though - like the mac n cheese with pancetta or the fried tomatoes.  I ordered a fried chicken plate and the chicken was a bit dry and the coating was quite salty. I wanted more of the pea puree and carrots - and less of the biscuits.  A bit overpriced for the Shake N Bake if you ask me.

One of the guests at our table had to return her burger - it was ordered medium well but came back medium bordering the very rare. This after having to wait forever for our food.

Speaking of service, they are very slow.  

Staff is not incredibly friendly or sincere for the most part. On my first trip, I too had walk around the neighborhood and wait outside because it was still not my reservation time.  Very lame considering that there were MANY tables open which remained opened after I was finally seated.  That's just rude.  Also, the lighting is really bad - way too dark.

Considering the service, meal, the dated ambience and the very hot mens' room, I'm pressed to even give this 3 stars....but I won't be back unless they greatly reinvent themselves.
author: King K.

description: It was my birthday over the weekend and my boyfriend got me tickets to see Dirty Dancing at the Golden Gate Theatre. We wanted to  find a place close to the theatre so that we could park in one place. Found this place on yelp and made a reservation via Open Table (btw love that Yelp links you right to Open Table---so easy!).  It was pouring ran and this place was cozy and cute, with a projection screen of old movies and a dark/dim intimate atmosphere. The cocktails are BEAUTIFUL! Favorite one was called "Grandpa's Favorite Sweater" but the "Long Tall Sally" was really good, too. Boyfriend got the filet steak, and it came with crunchy onions and mashed potatoes. He said it was cooked perfectly. I got the butternut squash risotto. SO GOOD! We had a little extra time before the show so we sat at the bar after dinner and enjoyed our cocktails. What a romantic place with great servers and bartenders. We will def be coming here again on our next trip to the city.
author: Chelsea B.

description: Does anyone else notice the smell?!  I've been there 3 times and it's smelled funky in a very bad way every time.  If you can get past the smell its good food.  Just sit closer to the door, I guess.
author: Bob G.

description: A group of coworkers an I came here for lunch on a weekday, with a reservation. Our food ranged from delicious (per one person, who had the veggie burger and loved it) to blah to disappointing. But the aspect of our lunch that was most unfortunate was the service. Although we were one of the only tables seated (and the largest), it was at least 25 minutes until the waiter even introduced himself. He seemed disinterested. Food took even longer to come, and waiting for the check was endless. All told, we were here for over two hours despite the regrettable food. We have not had this experience at other area restaurants and were confused by the lack of service. I would recommend basically anywhere else other than this restaurant for lunch -- hell, go down the block and get a sandwich at a food cart during Off the Grid, where at least the person serving you will have a pulse!
author: A. L.

description: The 272 Soluna Cafe & Lounge is a good restaurant. With or without reservation, the staff welcomes you quickly. The room is spacious and remarkably quiet. The ambiance is warm and friendly. However, the waitstaff is not at all at your disposal and is not always professional. The menu is neither too long nor too short. Starters are classic but good. Entrees are very good though. I recommend the "Painted Hills Ranch All Natural Center Cut Ribeye Steak with Our Sauce", it's delicious! In contrast, cheese lovers will be disappointed because the selection is irrelevant and the quantities are small. For deserts, it's ok. Bon appétit!!
author: Farid S.

description:
We had dinner here on a Friday night. Needless to say...it was packed. But there was a good reason...there was a Grateful Dead Convention. I was on tie die overload there. 

I did make reservations on open table.com. We were scheduled for 630p, and guess what...traffic from Fremont. So we called & spoke to Page. She was willing to hold our reservation. So big props to Page.  We were seated promptly.

The food was ok. We spend $72 for 2 people. Yah, I know. I did get the mussel chowder, crab cakes, a risotto and some fish dish. Nothing to rave about.

So I may go back...I guess we wil see.
author: Ron R.

description: The service was good but the skirt steak was over done and had very little flavor. It was not a place I would return to.
author: Matthew P.

description:
9 of 10 times I visit SF I drive past Soluna and its inviting storefront. I love the color palatte: very Crayola bold color markers with its vino hues. This weekend I had a reason to park the car & visit since I was attending a wedding at the Asian Art Museum, across the street. Located in the Tenderloin made me a bit apprehensive, but Soluna has been here for years. Time is a good test, right?  

I was greeted quickly & pleasantly -- not b/c there was a lack of clientele, but quite the contrary as this place was relatively crowded for a Sat evening & no city/federal employees or law school faculty/staff! The scene was lively although the lots next door is vacant and the interior had little natural light. The bartender was friendly, and the handcrafted cocktail menu reflected creativity synonymous with the City by the Bay. I echo the 'chill, relax and unpretentious bar (as well as) a cozy and romantic dining area' comments. Great job managing both! 

DRINKS - $10/ea & on par for San Francisco. LOVED both
Highland for me - refreshing, unique cucumber w/ pink grapefruit?
Crack'd Berry for my friend - blk pepper vodka w/ strawberry puree

We wish we knew the wedding ceremony was running late b/c we would have stayed for another round. Would love to visit again SOON!
author: Sunny T.

description:
I don't want to hate on this place but unfortunately it sucks

It just does for the prices they charge

Food is average at best

Servers are pretty bad

They are very considerate owners and will applaud them for that

But honestly, over priced menu for medicore food
author: Charles C.

description:
I've been here several times because it's close to Hastings, and so is an easy trip to make for some drinks and snacks with friends.  However, every time I come, I have a horrible experience.  The waitstaff is rude and non-responsive.  Everything is over-priced, the food is bland, and the drinks are weak.

I came here on my birthday for a celebratory drink and I ordered the chicken sandwich.  I got some serious food poisoning from their food, and on my birthday!!  

If you are looking for a place for appetizers and drinks, head over to Lalita's a few blocks down on McAllister.
author: Carmen L.

description: Overpriced, blandish food. Fish on the fish & chips was funky. Good fries. We were overcharged on the wine and the server wouldn't even entertain our complaint. I wasn't drinking so I know how many glasses the other two had. When pouring the third glass the bottle ran out and one only got a half of a glass. When we flagged down the server, who was chatting up friends at the bar, finally more was poured, but we were charged for another glass. We should have called the mgmt, but we paid and chose to never return. It's a shame, as there aren't that many choices around this location when you're going to a performance at one of the three nearby venues.
author: Scott R. D.

description:
Tried this place for the first time today for lunch, despite walking by it numerous times in the past. It was recommended to me by one of my co-workers I finally gave in and decided to try it. 

I ordered their house made veggie burger and truffle fries. The garden burger had mushrooms, blue cheese, tomato, greens, and a red wine mustard sauce. Not a bad garden burger, but I've definitely had better. The mushrooms were cooked fine and the veggies were fresh, but the cheese was slightly over powering the whole burger. I could barely make out the red wine mustard on the sandwich. Also, it came on a poppy seed bun which was not indicated on the menu. Not a big fan of it, but this just my personal take. I would have much preferred a regular bun or another kind of some sort. The truffle fries, to my surprise were pretty good. They had a nice little kick to them thanks to the hint of  horseradish aioli (big fan). Seasoning was pretty spot on too. Not much to complain about with the fries. Definitely give them a go.

The service seemed to be very friendly and timely when I arrived as well. The inside decor is pretty interesting too. The exterior of the building may fool you to think this is just another ordinary cafe/lounge. It's surprisingly roomy with a very chic approach. All in all, not a bad place to try out. I will probably be back sometime in future to try some other items on their menu (maybe happy hour).
author: Ajay K.

description: Went before Wicked and had 2 hours before the show started to eat. Ordered food and drinks together. We ended up having 15 minutes to eat before running to the show. One of our group ordered mac-n-cheese thinking it would be a veg friendly and no meat was listed as an ingredient. Came with ham in it and was cold. Horrid service and dirty wine glasses is all we got. Food was overpriced for what it was.
author: Melissa W.

description:
not bad, not bad at all.  i had lunch here a few weeks ago with some folks i know.  one friend got the thai chicken salad and she was quite pleased.  i got a chicken sandwich which was... good.  it wasn't memorable and there was something a bit off about it (or actually i just think there was an herb on the bread that i wasn't a fan of).  but additionally, the sandwich was missing something.  a tangy component or something.  and my other friend got a burger which he seemed to like enough.

i like how it's decorated inside and it's a lot bigger than you might think by just looking at it from the outside.  and the presentation of their sandwiches and burgers was nice - served on a wooden cutting board.

so you know.  not bad.
author: Lauren P.

description:
Food was very good, but we didn't have time to enjoy it.  Service was a showstopper, literally!  Don't go if you have a large group or are trying to get to a show at the Orpheum on time.

Made a reservation several days in advance for a large group (15 or so.)  We had tickets to see Wicked at the Orpheum at 8pm and the staff at Soluna insisted we needed to get there at 5:30 to make the show and they gave us a pre-fixe menu - one salad, two entree choices, and one dessert.  

Two people were running late and the staff made the group wait to order until the whole group was present.  The last two arrived at 6pm.  The waiter didn't take our order for dinner until 6:20.  Drinks were slow and we had to ask several times for  bread.  The salad (no choice for this, could have been prepared in advance) didn't arrive until 7:00pm!  Bread didn't arrive until after the salads.  So a group of 15, including several small children, have been sitting with not a single bit of food for 90 minutes!

At this point, several people have "waited" on us and insist that there's no problem, we'll get to the show on time, not to worry.  When dinner arrived at 7:20, we asked for the dessert as well, so we'd have time to eat it, but the whole experience was rushed.

The person with the show tickets had to leave before dessert arrived and the rest of us were scrambling to get a check and get to the show before curtain time.

This place is in the business of servicing Orpheum patrons.  They should acknowledge the business they get and staff up for the rush between 6-8pm.  I have to say we were impressed with the food, but I doubt any of us will return.  Too bad they didn't just get 15 new regular customers.
author: Dee M.

description: My friend went ahead of the rest of the group to get a booth.  He waited 15 minutes.  Didn't seem too crowded, we waited 10 more minutes then decided to just sit at one of the bigger tables by the bar, which needed bussing.  A host? waitperson? said no problem.  10 minutes later, we asked again and she said no problem, and put a towel on the table.  10 minutes later we decided to leave.  They need to lay off the mary jane at this place!!!
author: Kooky B.

description: Great place, really enjoyed the burger. Dessert and coffee were delicious.  Stayed a couple hours extra for a business call.   The place was very quiet and mellow.  They had wi-fi available, as well as a nearby Skype wifi spot.
author: Matthew H.

description:
Sat at one of the bar tables.  Ordered food and food arrived 40 min later.  That is when we asked to remove old water glasses and utensils.  Then we had to ask for new utensils.  Then we had to ask for napkins.  Food was a bid cold already.  Oh yes, we asked for bread and were told they run out (mind you, it was only 6:45 pm on a Saturday.)  I never got my water.  Staff was very disorganized and slow.

Ate here because of the Orpheum but will definitely go elsewhere next time.
author: Hector T.

description: Had a great time, good food but disappointed when I notice on my bank statement that the restaurant increase my final payment without my approval (tip was left and was adequate). Called spoke with manager who said he would correct it, but didn't seem too concerned.  My advise, check your bill!
author: Judy M.

description:
We had a pre-theater dinner at Soluna tonight.  Booked through Open Table

The food was good but the service was very poor.  

Our complaints:

Took 30 minutes for a Nicoise salad and a risotto.  

Ordered soup - the waitress brought it with the entree. 

When the risotto arrived I ordered a glass of wine, the waitress brought it after she cleared the plates. I declined, told her I wanted it with dinner.

Ordered dessert, took 15 minutes for a creme brule.

Couldn't locate a floor manager.

Won't be returning
author: Mike W.

description:
The service was pretty good. Though napkins and silverware were delivered to the table after we arrived, kinda haphazardly.  The water was in teeny glasses, no ice. And the food was pretty awful.  I had the veggie burger with a side of greens. There was something really sour and nasty-tasting in the burger (cheese?)  The greens were minimal, and poorly dressed.
