THE SCENE:  Satuday night, pre-Phantom at the Orpheum.   Perfect location, 5 minute walk. 4 if it's super cold.

Didn't make reservations - (long story) so did a walk in (6:15) and sat at the bar tables.  Nice interior, needs a curtain at the door to block freezing breeze that blows on all the people at the front bar/bar tables.

Despite the air temp, the restaurant has a warm, neighborhood feel.  No pretention or a "trying-too-hard" vibe.

GLASSES DO NOT RUNNETH OVER:  Funny, but I barely remember how the service was.  I guess it's because the staff didn't really pay too much attention to us.  Host was pleasant.  Our waiter was nice.  Friendly validation of what I ordered. Nice touch.  However, let our water glasses run dry. 

MARY HAD A LITTLE LAMB and AN ORANGE:  The menu is simple.  Not too many choices, however; too many can worry me.  I had nicely cooked lamb served on top of blue cheese mashed potatoes. (really? blue cheese, couldn't taste that element but tasty nevertheless)  But with many bites, i did taste something...couldn't put my finger on it.  I guess I was tasting the orange...too much. Overpowered many bites of the lamb, but it was perfectly cooked !!

Brussell sprouts, and side of peas and carrots alll not cooked enough for my liking.  A bit too raw. (my dining companion liked them that way though...)  They needed a little salt and pepper too.

Mr. C had the steak which was also cooked perfectly with green bean sides.  He enjoyed it.  They left the fat on which is always nice to see.  keeps in the juice/flavor of the meat.

Portions were just right.  (had the parmesean fries before at a soiree along with mini-cheeseburgers.  both were great!)

LIBATIONS:  Very simple wine list.  Not many choices.  Good mixed drink list.   My reisling was chilled just perfectly.  A rarity these days.  Friend had an after-dinner scotch.  

THE PRICE IS RIGHT:  All the main dishes were around $25.  Affordable prices as compared to other places downtown. 

IT'S SHOW TIME:  With a drink each,  1 course and good conversation, we were out in 1 hour and 20 minutes.  (anything additionally ordered may have cause a bit of a time crunch.)  

BOTTOM LINE:  It's a no bells and whistles menu, service or atmosphere package, but unbeatable location for any nearby production.  In the end, this simple little place was just about right for me.*

*However, I will make note re: others experiences which were not so great.  Consistent issues seemed to arise.
author: Jackie M.

description: Once again, HALF STARS Yelp. Had a tough time deciding between three and four stars. I had the butternut squash soup and the Waldorf Salad. Both had good flavor and there was nothing wrong with either dish, but at the same time nothing about either was really inspiring. The soup was the bettter of the two, Had good flavor and I would give that a four. But the salad was missing something.
author: Gary W.

description:
Not a proper review but worth writing about.

I have to give massive props to Sergio for opening to us at 10:30am when they were still closed. We were celebrating a special occasion, and needed alcohol to seal the deal, but there isn't much open at that time around City Hall (and the women were wearing heals, so walking far was out the question).

So the four of us sat there talking to Sergio for about an hour, sharing a creme brulee (nice) and washing it down with Guinness and coffee. And then the happy couple got on a plane and flew off into the sunset. The End.

True Story.
author: Chris K.

description:
We went for a very early dinner before a show.  Keep in mind that the neighborhood doesn't bother me, but it is a little sketchy at night.  

Great service, good food.  We were the first ones there, and they were super attentive without being annoying (a very fine line).   I had the steamed mussels, which was yummy - nice white wine sauce, great for bread dipping.  And the haricot verts on the side ... gotta have veggies.  My friends had the tuna, tuna, tuna, and the halibut wrapped in bacon.  The tuna appetizer can be an entree by itself.  And  who doesn't love anything wrapped in bacon?   They threw a bunch of veggies on his entree dish too.  Almost as much as my side of green beans.  The lobster bisque received a fantastic rating (I didn't try it - allergies) ... maybe it was all the butter :-)  The fries, accompanied by ketchup and garlic aioli, were the perfect compliment to my mussels.  My friends also enjoyed their root beer float.  Portions were generous.  

Service was consistently good.  We left there happy as mussels, uh, clams.
author: Lily C.

description: Love it!!!! Great place for a quiet lunch date, happy hour with friends, or a quick small plate and cocktail before a theater show or concert. Wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff.
author: Gina A.

description:
I went here with my girlfriend for Valentine's Day dinner. At first when we got there we were told we had to wait a small while for our table, even though we had already set up reservations earlier that week. This put us off slightly, but once we were seated, everything was 100%. The atmosphere was great, the staff wasn't overwhelming or to pushy. We had ordered the Prefixed 3 course dinner with wine pairing. This was a great choice! Every dish was perfectly paired with our meal. Every dish we had was very tasty and every ingredient stood out on everyone of the dishes we selected. 
 I would recommend Soluna to anyone that enjoys a great meal with great ambiance. I had the New York Strip as well as the Mac n' Cheese, that both exceeded my exceptions. The neighborhood is a bit dodgy, but Soluna makes up for it. Great place!
author: Steven C.

description:
Back in the Day (2 years ago), this was the Spot to be on Tuesdays or the Weekends!!  The staff kicked ass,  Humble and Spirited SF kids dancing and giggling, as they served you tasty and beautiful plates!!  

Soluna now has changed: New owner, who's a amazing human, and a new chef! The bartenders could use a lil more life and oomph! All and all it's NOW a pretty chill and laid back spot. Monday movie nights are coo...and a quick drink before hitting the night is always nice.

Much Luv to the old Gang!!!
author: Moe J.

description:
To die for.  Great dinner all around.  The waitress was really sweet as well.

And to top it off, the strawberry short cake was one of the best desserts I've ever had.  So fresh and flavorful, it was a party for my tastebuds.

Once inside, you don't even notice that you are in a sketch part of town.  Good job, Soluna.
author: Julie P.

description: Skip it.  Hit this place before the ballet on Saturday, and won't be going back.  Service was slow and forgetful, had to ask twice and wait a long time for the drink menu and a spoon after we ordered the soup.  The soup and the clam appetizer were luckily the stars, but my drink was terrible (avoid the Mango Polska - it stinks), and the fish&chips were chewy and had a strange puffy consistency.  Won't be going back.  Such a shame, because it's super convenient...
author: Alison E.

description:
Do not eat here before the theater, opera, ballet, etc.!!!  We went before an 8 p.m. show at the Orpheum.  Got seated at 6:45, thinking we had a relaxing hour to eat.  When the waitress came to take drink orders, we said, "we'd like to get our meal orders in now too, as we have an 8 p.m. show to catch."  So we ordered.  Two of us requested hamburgers; one of us salmon.  The orders were place before 6:55.  Time went by and the food didn't come.  At about 7:15 the waitress told us she'd checked with the kitchen and that our order was coming right up.  At 7:20, she came by and advised that she now had an "ETA from the kitchen. It was going to be 8-10 more minutes.  The reason things were taking so long was because the hamburger eaters had requested that the meat be cooked well done."  Really?  The need to cook the burgers a few extra minutes was the cause of an exceptionally long wait?  Well, whatever.  Also, at this point she offered to bring us bread for the first time (it appeared that bread was brought to all of the other tables out of the gate).  More time passed.  At 7:33, I got rude.  "We ordered two burgers and a hunk of fish!  What's the deal??"  The waitress disappeared into the kitchen and did not return until 7:38, our food in hand.  So, we literally gobbled it down, in under 10 minutes, and rushed out.  Nothing was cut off the bill despite a wait that would have been unreasonable even if the restaurant didn't know we had a show to make (it did), and even though it acknowledged the exceptional wait for food and knew we were upset.  And, to top things off, the hamburgers--which, according to the restaurant, caused substantial delay by virtue of us requesting that they be cooked well--were medium rare in the middle! 

Any, slow, slow service.  Don't trust this place if you're in a rush, or even if you've given yourself what normally should be sufficient time, but you do have an important appointment following. 

Finally, I should say that the waitress was polite throughout.  I assume she was not to blame--it was the kitchen's fault--although it's possible she failed to impress on the cooks that we had a show to catch.  But I'll give her the benefit of the doubt.
author: Chuck P.

description:
Couple of great things about this place.

The staff was great, maybe the other was right in saying someone missed a shift

They do movie nights on Monday, usually play 2

The food was great, I had the pork chop with bacon and yam hash. The pork chop was cooked really well, and the apples really complimented it.
plus
bacon...
author: Kenneth S.

description: We went to this restaurant before seeing Wicked at the Orpheum theater.  I booked through open table the night before for 6:30p and we got in!  The food was good we shared the cheese plate which was delish!  The pumpkin ravoli was nice but was served in a huge bowl.  Trendy I guess.  there seem to be butter in everything.  I think I overdosed on the butter during each part of the meal.  I was feeling a little woozy in the stomach.  My fault... next time will select more carefully.  We parked at the Civic Center parking and everything was in walking distance.  Within 1-2 small blocks.
author: Dana W.

description:
Myself, along with a few others used to be regulars at Soluna for some evening cocktails in between classes (drinking + art school = awesome). We were always greeted with a friendly face at the door and the bartenders were nothing less than pleasantly entertaining on a consistent basis. This place has a very versatile atmosphere when it comes to drinking/dining. A lot of people are just there to get a few drinks before a show in the area (Orpheum, Bill Graham, SF Symphony), and Soluna is the perfect place to do that. They have a full bar along with a good wine selection...so they are able to please the masses here. Grab one of the bar tables next to the window and you have a stunning view of City Hall while you sip down a relaxing cocktail.

If you come here to dine...you're in for completely different experience. The servers at Soluna are very knowledgeable and seem to take their job seriously (which is a nice change of pace). Although the food is on the pricey side, it's always done exceedingly well. The taste is clean and powerful with average serving sizes for an upscale eatery...the presentation is modern and appealing. The booths that you'll occupy while eating at Soluna are very comfortable and inviting, soft and plush with long curtains running down the back walls.

In Conclusion, Soluna provides an ideal location for both large groups looking to blow off some steam, and couples looking for an intimate location to relax and enjoy each others company.
author: Jerry A.

description:
Every bite delicious!

There were 3 in our party and every one of us had spectacular food. I started with the organic mixed green salad. Sounds kind of ordinary but the subtle rosemary and persimmon coupled with the vinaigrette made it anything but.  Followed with the Oxtail ragout with fennel gnocchi. Not usually a gnocchi fan but this rocked! Love fennel. Hubby had the half chicken and it was outstanding. Dessert was their take on a smore (only more gourmet) and it was scrumptious. 

My husband commented on the music--he loved their mix, from Elvis Costello to Beirut--it added great energy to the place.

The only caveat is their wine pours are scant. Our friend commented that he'd like a more generous pour than mine and they gave him a reasonable pour but charged him $2.00 more. 

We originally found this place on Scoutmob and got $30 off. At that price, it was a no-brainer!
author: Jannie G.

description:
I had dinner at Soluna a couple of years ago and was reluctant to try it again after my friend invited me to a birthday dinner party. Well lets just say that it was a completely different experience.   

Our party was pretty large so we had the opportunity to try many items on the menu.  The appetizers that stuck out for me were the crab duet and mac and cheese (w/pancetta......mmmm) both were super tasty and the presentation was cute. For the main course the Petaluma chicken breast and pork chop were my favs and had such great flavor.  For dessert we had the sage poundcake with fig and cheese gelato (yes cheese) and white chocolate bread pudding.  At that point we were so full, but we couldn't leave any behind.

We had such a great time at the dinner party I went back the next week for happy hour.  The bartender made some tasty cocktails with fresh muddled grapefruit and cracked pepper. 

I will definitely be back again...the food, service and atmosphere were perfect! Nice job!!!!!!
author: Allyson T.

description: Not bad, but the advertised "brunch" turned out to be nothing more than special pricing on the combination of an entree, drink, and dessert. That said, the food -- grilled chicken sandwich, eggs benedict -- was good and we liked the atmosphere. The service was a little slow but not bad.
author: John S.

description: The manager just emailed me replying to my previous review... I love this place :)
author: Angela R.

description: It's a shame that a place with such hip decor, great location, and well above average food (although portions are indeed small), has such slow and often surly service....  It would be so easy to move this up to a five-star restaurant!
author: Rory L.

description:
As others have mentioned the place was really warm (hot).  I wondered if they kept it warm for the older crowd  (of which, I am one) that was there before the performances.

Food was okay, but not stellar.  Service was slow, but friendly.

Latte was served to me really luke-warm, and I could tell that it had been sitting on the counter a LONG time given how the foam had congealed.  A great server would have checked the temperature before it was brought to the table.

They look to be cutting lots of costs (or corners) -- no bread, inexpensive silverware (like what you'd get at a diner).  Bathroom was old and ratty.
author: Alison B.

description: came her for st patty day. service was ok but i guess it was too busy. little price on drinks
author: Alan P.

description:
A surprisingly quaint and nice restaurant in a more then slightly scuzzy area.  It would be nice if the city would clean up the area since the cafe is so close the the theater, opera and ballet.  Kinda put a damper on the evening when you walk out and see some guy peeing on the street.

The trio of Tuna is absolutely fabulous, with a sashimi, a seared spiced tuna and a tuna salad with a lemony vinaigrette dressing.  the Garlic Fries are good too. 

As I said it is a good choice if you are heading to the opera, ballet or the theater.
author: Amy P.

description:
Simply amazing!

I arrived first and had a bit of a wait so I sat at the bar.  The bartenders attitude left a little to be desired (but could have been that I only ordered sparkling water).  Then in walked a bunch of free loading politicos (SFWPC).  They basically set up shop and spent very little money (poor manager/owner).

So my two friends arrived and we made our way to our table.  Our server Jennifer (I think) was helpful (truthful in her suggestions) and on top of our every need.

We were given an amose bouch that was very tasty.... wish I could recall all that was in it.

Apps - we shared the following
Heirloom Tomato Salad - It was wonderful the tomatoes were like they were just plucked from the vine.
Ceviche - SO FREAKING GOOD! Wish there would have been more... lol, but still enough for us to share.
Spinach Soup - Also really well done and not too heavy (enough for three of us to share).

Entrees - 
Both my friends ordered the Grilled Wagyu Ranchera Steak - This rocked.  Great flavor and a generous portion.  Tho they don't ask how you'd like the steak cooked and it was a little rare for all of us, but so good we didn't care.
I ordered the Albacore Tuna.  Here is where they really shined in my opinion.  The tuna that was brought out was not to my taste  I knew in one bite that I would not enjoy the dish.  I told Jennifer that the fish didn't taste right to me and she immediately offered to get me another attempt at the same dish or another dish all together.  I opted for another dish.  I asked to have either the risotto or the steak (which my friends were enjoying) whichever would be done first.

Jennifer returned moments later to let me know I'd be having the risotto and to give me a side plate of the quinoa 'salad' to hold me over (and allow me something to eat while my friends were eating) until my entree arrived.



The risotto was by far the star of the entrees.  So well done that I didn't want to share any with my friends (tho I did)

That alone would have me coming back.  Amazing customer service through and through.

We finished with the following Desserts -
Zeppoles - very good
White Chocolate Bread Pudding (huge portion and by far one of the best bread puddings I've ever had).
Peach Baked Alaska (also a generous portion) and so good... and I'm not a fan of peaches.

I for one will be returning and telling all my friends etc. to go here.

It's my understanding that they have at some point changed ownership (don't quote me on this) which might be why the service seems better then the previous reviews.
author: redd n.

description: My mom and I had dinner at Soluna Café on Saturday 08-16-14. We had tickets for Motown The Musical. Selected this place for it's close proximity to the Orpheum We arrived in the city alittle early. Our reservation was for 5:30pm, I tried calling the Soluna to check if they had a lounge to have a drink before dinner. I kept getting a fax tone. We arrived at 5;30 first couple for dinner and, the host takes us way back to the last table looking out of a horrible dirty window  and a ugly view of empty lot. I asked to be moved up and away from this view. The host moved us to a better table with a view coming in and out of the bathroom. I ordered a hanger martini tasted watered down..we ordered a salad for two of yellow watermelon  and heirloom tomatoes which was refreshing but at $14.00 per plate. My mom had the halibut and I had the fried chicken which was wonderful...moist...had a glass of rose..alittle to dry for me. I asked the waitress which way the theatre was and she did know nor did she offer to find out. I doubt we will ever go back. I will prefer to venture out and find a more inviting restraint.
author: Bonnie V.

description:
Went here today around around 11:45AM after taking care of some business at the Civic Center -- the music was mellow and the place was relatively empty so we decided to give it a try (having checked Have2eat and seeing the relatively high reviews).  We were seated promptly and our drinks were good (1 Civic Cooler - very refreshing and the cardamom was a nice touch, 1 Iced Tea - peachy/fruity, no sweetener needed).  Our food came after a short wait (the cafe started to fill up quickly at this point) and was excellent.  I had the Asiago Salad (Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese is wonderfully tangy, mild, and smooth) with added Florida Rock Shrimp = all ingredients were deliciously fresh. We also had a cup of tomato bisque (Fresh and acidic, rounded out by some nice olive oil) and some mac & cheese... WOW, decadent is the only way to describe that sumptuous, molten, sinfully smooth and creamy delight! It wasn't even my dish and I ate half of it! I even tried to get the recipe (*darn!!! No luck*) so that I wouldn't have to catch BART every time I want that dish from now on.  Seriously - it's the best tasting mac & cheese I've had yet (though I've yet to go on a mac & cheese mission yet ^_~).

I'd have given 5-Stars if our waitress hadn't seemed to be running the whole cafe -- she was everywhere and seemed to be doing a good job, but since she was everywhere, she wasn't as accessible for refills or our bill).  The male wait staff were all friendly and prompt (especially the guy who told me "some" of the ingredients in the mac & cheese sauce) and I'll definitely be back to try more :).
author: Joyce K.

description:
Soluna's best characteristic is that it's one of the few nicer restaurants in the civic center area.  The food, while dependable, is not great and lacks imagination.  If the service was better, it might warrant 2.5 stars.  We went for lunch on a Monday and the restaurant was less than 25% full.  Despite this, the service was poor.  We had to ask to have water refilled, our appetizer order was never placed, so we did not receive it until after our entrees arrived, etc.  The staff did not look pleased to be there and though not they were not rude, they were not friendly or warm.  The appetizer (calamari) was overdone and a little salty, so the quality did not make up for its tardiness.  

I will have to find another nicer Civic Center restaurant.
author: C.S. K.

description: Soluna has been one of my favor restaurants for the last 2 years or so. I went there for dinner a few times, happy hour once and my last experience, was the sunday super bowl. The food have a very special chefs signature in every dish, the drinks are really prepared with experience and "love". All staff very friendly and accomodating. It was a very happy surprise for me that my friends decided to have my surprise birthday dinner there. But back on the super bowl I never knwe that they have this huge projector, so watching super bowl with friends, watching so close, feel like I was watching the game live. Detail.......One of their beers, when you drink, you can keep the beer glass after wards, (only 4 per customer) so besides have fun, drink and hang out with my friends, YES , I could keep my 4 beer glasses....THANKS SOLUNA FOR TREAT ME AND MY FRIENDS SO WELL
author: Alex M.

description:
Two Words: NEVER AGAIN!!! 

I wish I could comment on the food, but I can't. So, loyal Yelp reader, why is this so? BECAUSE THEY NEVER BROUGHT US OUR FOOD. We sauntered in last night for a quick meal before I was dragged to see Phantom of the Opera at the Orpheum. Actually we did not saunter. Only cowboys can saunter. I am not a cowboy. I guess I waddled in. (Disclaimer, I needed to mention the show because it factors into the atrocious service we experienced. I would rather clean my ears with sandpaper than ever have to sit through that audio vomit ever again.) 

We were seated quickly at the bar. That was last time anything happened quickly or efficiently. It took the bartender about 10 minutes to ask us for our drink orders. Call me wacky and demanding, but when you are sitting at the BAR, shouldn't this be a priority. (I know, I'm a jerk for being so demanding.) When my Old Fashioned landed in front of me I was shocked to find out that Old Fashioneds were mostly soda water and only a splash of bourbon. What's that you say? Old Fashioneds are mostly bourbon and a splash of soda water? Don't tell LISA the bartender at Soluna that. She'll probably disagree with you. Because she feels the need to make cocktails with as little alcohol as possible. 

We then ordered some food. And waited, and waited, and waited. I saw plenty of food coming out of the kitchen...and all of it went to other people, including a couple who sat down and ordered AFTER us. After 30 minutes, we asked Lisa about our food. You would think that the steamed clams we ordered as an appetizer would have come out. (We're talking about a fairly idiot proof procedure here: put a little bit of water in a boiler, heat it up, add clams.) If you cannot get an appetizer in front of a patron in 30 minutes, there is something seriously wrong with you. It was then that we began to wonder if Lisa the non-alcohol serving barmaid had even placed our order. We asked about the status of our order. She told us that the kitchen was really backed up because of all the people who were there to go to the opera. Then she brought us our water. The water we asked for 30 minutes ago. The Water Resource Board would like to personally thank Lisa for her water conservation efforts. By ignoring requests for water, she is saving one of our most precious resources. 

At no point did Lisa offer an apology or say that she would try to speed things along. My fiance asked me if I wanted to order another drink. I declined because I did not want to be charged for another glass of soda water with some bourbon for color. At 45 minutes we had to pull the plug. We realized that we were never going to get our food. My friend had to literally wave at Lisa to get her attention. WE THEN APOLOGIZED TO HER and said we had to cancel our order because of time constraints. Lisa gave us the bill and walked away. She never offered a single word in apology for the absolutely crappy service she had graced us with. Not wanting to feel like a total cad, I left her a tip anyway. The more I think about it, I want that $5 back. I will need it to buy some TP, because Lisa from Soluna crapped all over us.
author: Chris I.

description:
I had a great time at Soluna, overall.  I'm pretty picky when it comes to restaurants, and I never judge one by the first impression.  My first impression of Soluna was that the ambiance was "San Francisco Cool".  I just hoped the food was good and there weren't tiny little trendy portions.  I hate that and it often goes hand in hand with "San Francisco Cool".  You know what I mean.

So...happy surprise!  I had a great mid-day meal.  BBQ pork sliders were tender and delicious.  A large 'mac&cheese' included chicken and sun dried tomatoes and was almost perfect.  The price was right, the drinks were great and the service was absolutely outstanding.   
In fact, I want to take this time now to recognize specifically the service.  Lauren was our server and she was kind and attentive, as all servers should be.  But I was delighted to find out she was also funny and professional.  She made the whole meal one to remember.  She and Jack, the bartender, had a great time together and they made sure everybody else did too.  Cheers.
author: Lady D.

description:
If this place wasn't so pretty, I'd take away that second star.

I concede that it was packed when I came here for happy hour, but it took forever for the bartender to take my order and then it took forever for her to get my order to me...my order being a draft beer.  Maybe Thursdays are not the best days to come in for happy hour, but really, everyone knows that the 'happy' in happy hour comes from having a drink in your hand.
author: Masha B.

description:
*note* - this review pertains only to lunch at soluna, perhaps dinner there is not so abysmal...

because i go to school down the street from soluna, i've eaten lunch at this overrated, overpriced hellhole more times than i care to admit.  i feel that my last experience at soluna pretty much sums up what a person can expect from lunch there:

four friends and i enter the establishment and approach the minimally populated dining room.  we wait to be seated, are then told by one of the staff to sit wherever we like.  we sit, and are then accosted by a sneering, wretched man who turns out to be the manager, who demands to know what we are doing at this table, and who allowed us to sit there.  he then goes over to the staff person who let us seat ourselves and not-so-discretely terrorizes the poor woman for her apparent transgression.  debate ensues at our table as to whether we should leave.  this debate is able to continue for nearly ten minutes since that's how long it takes for our frosty server to arrive and disdainfully offer us menus.  for whatever reasons we stay, and eventually are able to order our food after patiently waiting another extended period of time.

the food, as usual, was totally mediocre.  my burger arrived on a stale bun, and dripped in an unwholesome way (meaning, it dripped for reasons other than it being loaded with delicious burger grease).  nobody finished their food, and our server *tossed* our check on the table.  i then coughed up $17 for a crap lunch with utterly crap service.

i have not been back to soluna since, and do not plan to go back.  i can tolerate somewhat overpriced, mediocre food if the staff are kind and make me feel welcomed.  conversely, i can handle some obnoxiousness from staff if the food is outstanding.  but when an establishment not only serves food that is mediocre and overpriced, but is also apparently willing to treat its customers like complete crap, i must cry foul.  and cry foul i do with soluna.
author: genevieve g.

description: If you see a show at the Orpheum, your nearby dining options in the Tenderloin are limited.  Luckily, Soluna Cafe is two blocks away.  The food was very good, and the waitress was proactive about insuring we made our show on time without rushing us.
author: Steve W.

description:
So , we got there early  and had a seat at the bar. Bartendar..cute but stupid... no menu and ignoring my cute girlfriend and I. The white wine  and sparking was tepid. Gross!!

Sat down,  pretty booth with great lamps and AWESOme male host who was the only one NOT on drugs (staff wise) and had fun info about wine and city for us.

Stoner Ass waitress was nice but died ,no emotion or ideas about meals for us.... Order bottles of wine, again tepid.  Great salads( goat cheese spinach) and Mac and cheese was soooooooo good. The best was the Brussels. My Ahi was good. Dessert was yummmy. 

would not go back based on staff and warm wine(yuck)  heard its changing to " Civic Bar and Grill"?? Hopefully will be better...
author: diana q.

description: So i have to say service has been pretty flaky, the guy (i think he's asian) while it was empty decidd to come to our table and tell me friend and I to move because it was just the 2 of us and not 4 people- he also seemed to have an attitude. I would have gladly been fine with his request had it been peak hours but the place was empty. That's just bad customer service. However, I will say Lea our server was fantastic! Very friendly, made us feel welcomed and truly made the happy hour worthwhile! Food wise, get the truffle fries, they are delicious!! and for a happy hour drink specials are pretty reasonable.
author: sue c.

description: Great!  Loved the menu, ambience, and service.  Parking 1/2 a block away on Larkin. very convenient.  I went for lunch and would go again. The only drawback is  less than desirable location at night.
author: Connie H.

description:
Made reservations for New Year's Eve thinking that it was close to do a pre-Orpheum dinner and the prixe fixe menu that was on the website wasn't too expense. I should have known something was wrong when I tried to call the day before to add one more person to my party.

I called at 11:28am, not realizing that the restaurant didn't open until 11:30am. But the phone was picked up, and no one said a greeting. I said "hello," phone was still off-hook, and then was promptly hung up. Okay. Maybe they didn't realize someone was on the other end.

2 hours later the restaurant called me to confirm the reservation. I added an extra person to my party and then asked if there was a fixed menu only for New Year's Eve. The hostess said I could order whatever I liked from the menu. She did not say that yes, there was a fixed menu, nor said what the price would be. I assumed what was on the website was correct. She was about to hang up on me when I stopped her to ask if there was a vegetarian option. I can't remember if she put me on hold or not, but did say that yes, there was a vegetarian option.
Imagine my surprise when on New Year's Eve, I go back to the website to find out the type of food being served to notice that the 3-course fixed prix is now $60, same menu as before, but is labeled as a 4-course, when there is no 4 courses. 
I still go to the restaurant with my party to find out what the true story is, only to find out that the $60 is correct. And that there is not a vegetarian restaurant. The hostess was told by her manager to say that there was, and that they would create something on the spot for any vegetarians. No thank you! So, we decide to leave and go to a not confused restaurant down the street.
I don't know how the food was since we didn't get that far, but I don't have any intention of going back to find out.
author: Janice O.

description:
Made a 6:30 reservation before and 8:00 show at the Orpheum. Told our waitress as soon as we sat down that we were going to a show. Drinks took 45 minutes to get to our table. Waitress  was very nice and apologetic, but said the round would be on the house, it was not. Brother ordered a Macallan 12 on the rocks. He got some bottom shelf crap minus the rocks. Sister ordered Bloody Mary, had to pour about 1/2 shaker of pepper into it to give it any kick. 
Food took forever and a day to get to us. We literally were able to take two bites before boxing at 7:50!!! I think this is inexcusable. Still, only two drinks were comped, one of which was probably the crap scotch. The two sisters had the ravioloi, mom had the sole, brother had the steak, I had the seared ahi. We all agreed that the food would have been delicious, if we had time to enjoy it and if our moods hadn't been ruined by the slooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooow service.  Now it will all go to waste. Who wants to eat leftover seared ahi?
VERY disappointed. Like another reviewer on here said, luckily Wicked saved the night. Don't go to SoLuna unless you have a lot of time to waste bu thanks so much for the migraine brought on by starvation.
author: deb C.

description: Went here for lunch before heading over to the symphony.  We were promptly seated because there weren't that many customers.  Waited 5 minutes before the waiter came to ask us what we wanted to drink.  Waited another 5 minutes before he brought the drinks.  Waited another 20 minutes before he came back to take our order.  During that time, he took the orders of two other tables whose occupants arrived after us.  What the f...?  The food was so-so.  My truffle fries were very good, but the grilled chicken sandwich was way over-cooked.  During our meal, not once did anyone come by to re-fill our iced tea or water glasses.  It wasn't a dump, but the service absolutely sucked.  Good thing we allowed plenty of time before we had to leave for the concert.  So longa, Soluna.
author: J. L.

description: Great food, affordable prices, convenient for going to the theater in civic center or clubs in the 'loin/SOMA. Nice and tasty, but not too fussy. Later in the night, the dance floor is pretty fun.
author: Ellie P.

description: Staff was nice. Came back with all of my work crew and we all got burgers. Not going to return. Burger was average at best.
author: B S.

description:
Almost but not quite.  Good but not great.  "So what was that?"

Went here pre-opera when Absinthe was booked.  The menu looked great, and we tried a wide range of items (thanks to many small plates).  Everything was good, but not great.  Something seemed to be wrong with each item, even though nothing was bad.  For drinks, they assembled a Westland martini as ordered (vodka with Bombay Sapphine instead of vermouth).  Plenty of good wines by the glass, too.  The first item was a mixed-green salad, which was a bunch of fresh but undistinguished leaves drenched in vinegar.  No oil detected.  Strange, but we were 3/4 of the way through it before we really figured out what was wrong (too focused on the conversation).  The garlic and truffle fries WERE good, though.  Hot, crispy, flavorful, light on actual truffle spirit but simply good no matter what they're called.  There was an aioli afterthought on the plate, too, which didn't get much attention.  Next was tuna three ways--ceviche, crudo, and seared ahi sashimi.  The first two ways were great, the last...almost but not quite.  Something about the seasoning made the sashimi strangely bitter, in a Lagunitas IPA sort of way.  But, yeah, OK.  Last was lamb chops, medium rare.  The chops were oddly tiny, but the meat was good, there was little fat to trim off, and the preparation was perfect.  A side of green garlic and asparagus risotto had wonderful flavor, but odd texture (why the clumps of unseasoned rice in the middle of the mix?).  Also odd, but good for me, was the vast plate of cooked vegetables that flanked the tiny lamb bits.  4 whole cooked carrots.  A pile of tasty brussels sprouts.  4 long sprigs of broccolini.  All coated in a wonderful sauce and cooked to the right texture.  But why did they chill the plate?  The plate rim was well below room temperature when I first touched it, and the food quickly chilled as well.  Yeah, odd.  Dessert was a strawberry shortcake with vanilla ice cream.  The shortcake was baked with a hard outer shell, and the top of the crust was sliced off and used to cap the whole assembly--but it was hard, dry, and seemed a little stale.  Yeah.  Great fruit and ice cream, though.  

Prices were not outrageous, the atmosphere was pleasant, and the service was warm, friendly, helpful, and efficient.  The friendliness of the staff won me over, and for that reason (as well as potential), I'll keep it in mind for lunch or a quick drink and snack.  They have a lot going on, but they need to get it together.
author: Matt R.

description: I've eaten lunch here a couple of times, the best gourment mac 'n cheese in memory. They have dinner as well, and have started to have some pretty funky DJ nights as well. This is a good spot to go after a visit to the Asian Art Museum.
author: Nish N.

description: Service is very friendly and accommodating.  Great happy hour.  The short ribs are amazing... I wish they were an entree and not just an app.  I won't be sharing that app plate next time around! The mac and cheese was wonderfully decadent with chunks of perfectly smoky pancetta. Spinach salad was a great mix with beets and warm, breaded goat cheese..... yum!  How could the pumpkin ravioli be bad?.... basted in brown butter, sage and spinach.  Good wine list, and great cocktails!
author: Danielle R.

description:
Last night we went to Soluna with high expectations. Unfortunately, the service was a real disapointment. 
At first, we were repeatedly greeted and addressed by multiple servers. Then once we ordered they couldnt seem to get it straight. Drink orders took between ten and fifteen minutes and one was completely forgotten. 
The food was above average. Yet here again, the service showed through. The petrale sole was good. The crab bisque was excellent; but the side dish was forgotten. The salads were weak and tasted flat (the beets in the spinach & beet salad were underdone). 
Ultimately, the food was good enough that it could have been a great experience; however the service was so poor that we probably wont make it back.
author: E C.

description: I've only been here for drinks, and the one time I ate here I was completely drunk already so I can't comment on the food.  The place itself is very nice.  It's got a really cool hip, yet unpretentious feel.  The bartenders make you feel very welcome.  They can also make some great fresh fruit mojitos.  My favorite is the mango mojito.  I don't get to visit this place nearly enough.
author: Luis M.

description: I came here for lunch and had the Ahi Sandwich that came with a side salad.  I came in just before the lunch rush and I was starving on my way home since I was feeling sick that day.  It was raining and requested the host to seat me away from the door because I wasn't feeling well. I didn't want to be smacked in the face by a gush of cold air while I was trying to get warm and feel a little better.  They sat me in the far corner at a small table near the rear large window.  Perfect.  People won't be bothered too much by me sneezing and blowing my nose.  The food was great, the server was young and hesitant to approach me but did a fine job.  I'd definitely come back!  When I'm not dying with a cold...
author: Bernadette M.

description: MMkay... Im giving this place a generous 4 stars based on the yummy food we had. (we were also stoned.) I had the Beet Salad with a fried Goat cheese ball..and Brussels Sprouts (some of the best I've had!) The problem I had was the it took a few minute to be seated..There was Nobody there. Plenty of open tables. I guess they wanted us in the back. Then... our server was SO rude... Maybe because he was not educated correctly on what kind of beer they were serving...and got schooled by my girl.. Anyhoo..The server was super rude, and short with us throughout our visit.  At least the food was good. I liked tha Bartender too. He was cool.
author: Karlee D.

description: So I find it kind of amusing that they're doing DAT when their normal dinner prix fixe is actually cheaper -- but maybe it'll increase their business.  I go to the law school down the street that is currently renovating its cafeteria, which means I've been spending way too much $$$ here lately. Just about everything is tasty.  I just wish the salads were cheaper!
author: Nat K.

description:
Skimming the other reviews, it looks like others had similar experiences to mine.  The mystery is why this place has so many stars.  

I went in with a group of four others planning to have drinks and appetizers. The place was pretty much empty.  Nonetheless, we were seated at a table and then told that we would be charged full price for drinks even though it was happy hour -  since we were sitting at a table - huh??  

So we all volunteered to sit in the empty "bar" area.  Then the "host" offered to see if we could get the happy hour price anyway - WTF?  

. . . 10 minutes . . 10 more minutes . . . the bar tables fill up . . . we leave.  The "host" didn't seem to notice.  I guess we didn't look like the right clientele (everyone else looked so, um, classy?).

I won't be returning to see if the crappy service and long wait are somehow justified.
author: am m.

description: Stopped in here for dinner before a friend and I saw Wicked. So much fun! The scene was lively, the waitresses and bartenders were really friendly and gave great service and the food and drinks were DELICIOUS!!! The Brussels sprouts were bursting with flavor, the pork slider sandwiches were sinfully tasty and the cucumber muttled gin cocktails were perfectly spring inspired!! Can't wait to come back and and try out the other items on their mouth watering food menu and cocktail list!
author: Rachel A.

description:
yum yum yum.

my friend took me to soluna for three reasons;
1- it's across the street from his work
2- very close to our destination- the opera
3- his cats are named sol y luna

i loved everything about it. i was a bit bumbed when the waiter let us know the lobster bisque was n/a. then i ordered the sangria which sounded amazing on the menu but the bartender would not serve it since it had not fully developed. the fact that i wasn't able to have two of my favs was sad but when everything is made fresh sometimes you have to find something else, which we did.

i had muscles, they  were perfectly cooked and the buffalo stew was full of flavor with plenty of fresh veggies that were cooked just enough and the buffalo was so tender there was barely need for a knife.

will i go back? hells yeah! i was a bit late and didn't get to try any of their desserts but they looked amazing.

ian was our waiter and he was on top of everything.

great food and excellent service. i loved it!
author: tinkerbell e.

description:
I really don't know why anyone has complained about the service at Soluna. I had dinner at Soluna with 2 friends last night before seeing Wicked at 8 and our server, Tony (?), was absolutely wonderful. He helped my friend, Nicky, choose her Manila clam appetizer (which she loooved), made jokes, kept our glasses filled and even made me aware of the pork in the mac and cheese that I ordered because (I'm assuming) he overheard my conversation with my friend about why I, as a Jew, can't eat clams. I ordered the prix fixe dinner ($36 +3 for steak) with the mac and cheese (minus the pancetta), NY strip with broccoli and potato puffs, and white chocolate bread pudding with cinnamon gelato. It was amazing:) Especially the dessert. Mac and cheese was a little bland...I'm guessing it would have been awesome with the pork. Steak was very tasty, as were the broccoli and onions. Potato puffs tasted a little strange...like there was cinnamon in them. My friends had the Manila clams, lamb shank with baby carrots and blue cheese risotto and huckleberry creme brulee (Nicky), as well as the Goat cheese and spinach salad, Ahi tuna and trio of sorbets (Desiree). Both loved their meals, although the sorbets weren't that impressive to D. The clams were spicy and plentiful and the lamb was cooked to perfection and awesome with the tangy blue cheese risotto. Desiree raved about the Tuna, as well. The food was definitely about 4 stars, but the service pushed it to 5. 

Especially when you factor in the fact that I had initially made reservations for 515, but called to say I was late due to parking (at 520) and the hostess pushed my reservation to 530 to accommodate me. Very cool.
author: Rena H.

description: Great place to go before going to opera or symphony, or after an arduous day at court or City Hall.  Their lobster bisque is some of the best I ever tasted.
author: Rick E.

description: Myshelle and I shared the most amazing anniversary dinner here. Possibly one of the best meals of my life. We were looking for somewhere close to the Orpheum for a special dinner. This fit the bill.  The incredible service started 2 weeks before our reservation when the owner called to inform me that a party had booked the front of the restaurant for a private event. We were still welcome but he wanted to make sure it wouldn't be too noisy. I told him that we had theater tickets for that night and decided to keep the reservation. He offered us a bottle of champagne to make up for it. When we arrived the hostess wished us a happy anniversary and escorted us to a plush velvet booth in the back corner where a bottle of champagne was waiting on ice for us. I don't remember all the things we ate, but I do remember that they were all amazing, including 3 or 4 small dishes that we didn't even order but the chef sent out for us to try. By the time they brought out the 3 home-made sorbets we were completely stuffed. Every single person working that night stopped by over the course of the evening to wish us a happy anniversary, including the owner. It was truly a magical meal. With the free champagne and several free dishes, the bill ended up being quite reasonable as well. As we left for the theater, Myshelle told me she felt like a queen. Exactly how my girl deserves to feel on our anniversary. Thanks Soluna for an unforgettable anniversary!! We look forward to sharing another one with you next year.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Food is not bad.  Our table ordered crab-stuffed sole and lamb shank.  Both were delicious.  The scallops were a little disappointing --three small unexciting scallops for $12.

Most people who go there are either seeing a ballet or a show at the Orpheum.  The kitchen is very very slow.  We went there at 5:45 hoping that we could get out of there by 7:45 to catch the 8 o'clock Wicked.  Our entrees were served at 7:30!  We ended up getting our dessert to go (since we ordered the prix fix).  Expect madness at around 7:45 as EVERY table is trying to pay their bills.  

You would think by now that the restaurant knows most of their guests need to leave for their 8 o'clock show.  Shouldn't they work this into their business plan.
author: Larry W.

description: Wonderful food, great atmosphere, slightly strange location... but that is what makes San Francisco so great, right? Wish it would turn into a club at night like it used to, but them's the breaks.
author: K. C.

description: Definitely the least sketchy place for a cocktail in the 'loin.  I haunt this place on a fairly regular basis, always making sure to show up early enough to take advantage of the happy hour drink specials.  The bartender is friendly, and the fries are awesome.  And it's one of the few bars smart enough to install hooks under the bar, just the right size for all of my school accoutrements.  Because learning and alcohol go hand in hand.
author: Jess T.

description: This place is loads of fun.  I went for dinner and wound up seeing belly dancers, fortune tellers, and the odd bunch that came to see them.  It's a very eclectic mix without attitude and with some really great drink and food offerings.  I'd say it's fashion-easy-gourmet, so you get good food that has a gourmet touch without having to wear a tie or button down
author: Jared F.

description:
We had our first (and last) experience here a few nights ago. Aside from the rather unpleasant physical appearance and layout, the food was decidedly subpar. Our caeser salads were good, but after that the main courses erased most memories of the salad. I had the lamb shank. It was barely tepid and looked as though it sat out all day waiting to be served. It had a most unpleasant seasoning and watery, cold mashed potatoes underneath. The accompanying brussel sprouts were virtually raw. My companion's dinner consisted of barely warm fish. 

If you go there, you have been forewarned!
author: Menlo Man n.

description:
Had drinks and appetizers last night before "Wicked" -- was blown away by not only the quality of the food but by the service. Matt and other servers were awesome, offering detailed answers to our questions and making suggestions. We had a light supper out of 4 different small dishes, that were big enough to split. Topped with two desserts, we had big smiles on our faces when we went to the theater, and weren't hungry even though the show ended at nearly 11;00.

I'd be glad to go back again and recommend it to others.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
A friend recommended this place to go to before seeing Wicked. I really enjoyed the food and service here. I shared the crab stuffed sole with my friend and also a caesar salad and parmesan, truffle oil fries. All were very tasty. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. 

The only downside is that my friend's chicken wasn't completely cooked in the middle. She said the parts that she ate on the outside were good though. However, when we brought it to the waitress' attention, she was very sweet and apologetic, and brought us out a free dessert--very yummy creme brulee! I would definitely go back next time I see a show at the Orpheum.
author: Julie H.

description: Wasn't sure what to expect... it was the first thing suggested on the Orpheum Theater's website, but my mom went here after a show once and said it was quite good. And I have to agree! Our waiter was very nice, I think we were a bit of a relief from the usual pre-theater crowd. They did check with us when we were seated about our ticket/curtain-time status and made sure we made it through the meal at the right pace. We enjoyed the food immensely, especially the tuna 3-ways appetizer. Delicious! The seating is comfy and loungey, with lots of pillows and there's lots of pretty lanterns hanging. Even our cocktails were great. All in all it was a really nice meal that just happened to be somewhere convenient to the theater. Who knew!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I've only been to Soluna after hours to listen to great hip-hop and drink some great drinks.  I love the decor here.  It's very cute.

My boyfriend and I used to come here every Tuesday night. after 10Pm when the restaurant closed.  The DJ played "real" hip-hop like Tribe Called Quest and De La Soul, not the commercial stuff that's on the radio.  The crowd was real chill.  I never saw any "hyphys" there.

The drinks were awesome.  I remember always ordering one called "Painkiller."  I can't remember what was in it, but I remember it having coconut flakes on the top and soooo loving it.  

It's been a few years since my boyfriend and I came to Soluna on a Tuesday night, not sure if they still do the hip-hop anymore.  I do want to come back and visit, just to relive those good memories.
author: Charlene R.

description:
This is a reasonable place for a pre-theatre or pre-symphony dinner.  The service is friendly and prompt.  The decor is attractive and comfortable.  The food is good but not exceptional.  I enjoyed the lobster bisque  even though it was rather light on the lobster.  The lamb chops were good and came in a nice sauce.  The effect was ruined a bit by the bushel of steamed bland vegetables on the plate.  My wife had the salmon which was fine but the couscous was bland and the quantity of vegetables was, again, frightening.
I give them kudos for having a wine list that actually has interesting selections in the $30 range.
This place is probably worthy of a 3.5 stars but to make 4 the food needs to be kicked up a notch.  Right now it is just good, not exciting.
author: Peter H.

description: Went here with a group of friends. Wasn't too impressed with their food. BF ordered NY steak... didn't look too apetiting... my Seared Ahi Tuna was okay... The restaurant was empty on Saturday night...
author: Mel L.

description: Very good food in an area that's mostly devoid of it, so that's a big plus. Prices are similarly way off from restaurants in the same neighborhood, but are in line with other fine dining establishments. Portions are somewhat on the small side, but are very nicely prepared and very tasty. Can be a problem getting a table for dinner during pre-show/concert hours, but ample seating at the bar tables.
author: Bruce C.

description: Can I give Soluna a half-star? The service was awful and the bartender was too busy counting his tips to provide any service. I had been here one other time and experienced the same thing. Not only was the service awful but the food was crap.
author: Chris G.

description:
I really, really wanted to give this place a good review.  The ambiance was fabulous.  The service was pretty good.  And the first course was delicious.  We ordered the caesar salad and the clams.  The clams came in this incredible sauce with a hunk of toasted bread that was perfect for sopping up the sauce.

In fact, I was so excited about this place that I told my boyfriend I couldn't wait to write Soluna a great review on Yelp.

Then came the salmon.

By far, the worst salmon I have ever had.  It was dry and overcooked.  I should've sent it back because it was almost inedible.  My boyfriend ordered the butternut squash risotto and it was pretty good.  However, I agree with what another review said about the lack of flavor.  It was a little bland.

The dessert menu was rather uninspiring...there was a lot of sorbet and gelato.  I dunno...to me that says, "we're too lazy to put together any real desserts."  However, I had the bread pudding and it was quite good.  The caramel sauce they drizzled on top of it was really yummy.

Soluna has the potential to be a really great restaurant.  Hopefully they'll figure out how to spice up their dishes and how to cook fish properly.  Until then, I don't think I'll be going back.
author: Piper H.

description: I was very impressed with this restaurant.  From the outside this restaurant is not attractive but once we opened the door I was delighted with the decor.  I arrived late (only an hour before Wicked started) and they were very accommodating in getting us to the show in time.  The food was great for the price.  We both ordered sandwiches ($10 & $13).  I definitely would recommend this restaurant to anyone going to a show at the Orpheum.
author: Allison M.

description: Really busy at lunch time, but also great for dinner. The "dirty" risotto and roasted organic chicken are my two favorites! I also highly recommend the mango mojito!
author: April M.

description:
We had dinner at Soluna before a show at the Orpheum. It was also my husband's birthday- 
We started with the tomales pt. mussels- they were pretty good. He had the lamb shank, I had the stuffed sole - they were also tasty. I especially liked his risotto with blue cheese and my sides cipollini onions and asparagus with lemon hollandaise. I have to make a note of their bread, too- it is quite tasty, I liked the crunchiness of the crust -just right- . 

Ambiance is well done! 
Service was very good, both the host and the waiters were pleasant. We even got a cup of coconut sorbet/ice cream with a birthday candle on it as a nice surprise, just before we left. I would definitely recommend Soluna for dinner before a show at the Orpheum.
author: A Z.

description: My fiance and I went here before a play at the Orpheum. There are not many restaurants near the theater or in walking distance, which was the main reason we came here. Soluna gets pretty crazy from 6pm on as the theater crown fills the restaurant. We were seated a half an hour late. As we waited at the bar, we were not acknowledged once other than the one time the bartender took our order. When we were finally seated, the servers were curt and hardly gave us the time we deserved. Plus, the tables are so close together that my elbows were practically touching the diners on either side of me. Once we got our food - in reasonable time - we didn't see the server again until we had to flag her down for more water and the bill. Our entire dinner, we didn't get a water refill and we didn't get checked on. We were asked if we were going to the theater, thinking they had intentions of making sure we made it out in time, but they practically ignored us. The food was mediocre, I probably would have liked it better if I wasn't in such an unfriendly atmosphere. Also, fairly unrelated, but still a first impression - not only were the servers curt and overall not warm, they all had very little pride in their appearance, most with uncombed and wild hair - I felt uneasy that there was a very good chance that I would find hair in my food. Anyways, while you may not have many options for other restaurants in the area, opt elsewhere if you want a friendly environment and more than one glass of water during your meal.
author: Kathryn P.

description: I'd probably not venture here after work or even during the workday lunch time... but for a quick mid-afternoon bite or drink its excellent. Bartender is always friendly and prompt, and the butternut squash soup is SO GOOD.
author: J J.

description: Nicely lit (read dim) with a great bar, Soluna does deserve to be more popular, perhaps I'll have to start throwing a monthly there. Next Yelp outing anyone?
author: Stellah D.

description: This place is really nice.  It's a lot fancier than I thought it was going to be when I got there, in the sense that the dishes are small and expensive.  So don't go here expecting to chow down or you'll leave hungry.  The ambiance is really cool, great curtains and painting and all that.  Service is a little slow when the place is full but still quite courteous.  Tables a little too close together but then this is a small venue so it's understandable.  A cool place to go if you're looking for something kind of upscale in a not upscale neighborhood.
author: Cassio P.

description: It wasn't what I had hoped for. We got the crab duo, warm goat cheese salad, fried chicken, and salmon, and a side of fries. For dessert, we had the strawberry shortcake and souffle cake. The best part of the meal was the fries and strawberry shortcake. Really good with what seems to be strawberry sorbet? Not sure but it was good! The fries were also good and I couldn't keep my hands out of that cone filled with fries! The chicken was OK and the salmon was dry.. The service though was extremely slow and the waiter was a little bit weird? Took forever to take our order, get our drinks, and even give us  our check. I doubt I would go back.
author: Juliane N.

description: Took my nieces to see Wicked on a Wednesday night; we had about an hour to kill before curtain and needed sustenance. The hostess seated us quickly (without a reservation), our server was there in a flash and the food's arrival was nearly immediate. Despite my request that they hurry, we received nothing but gracious service throughout. 10 year-old Nessa didn't care for the gourmet mac n' cheese (4 kinds of cheese, with pancetta in the mix, encrusted with breadcrumbs...to die for), but she readily ate the grilled chicken off her older sister's tasty ceasar salad. Meanwhile, I was concerned that my pumpkin ravioli was swimming in what looked like a pool of brownish oil. Turns out this was a rich butter and brown sugar sauce, which doubled as bread dip. Dessert was the white chocolate bread pudding served with coconut ice cream, and before I could finish my entree it was gone. Not sure if we received special treatment because there were cute kids in tow, but I'll come here again after such great food and service.
author: Kris I.

description:
i was just revisiting places that i use to hang out when i first moved to SF and SOLUNA pops out..

i never actually ate here but i use to hang out here on their Tues night when  Sake use to spin here.. he brought the NYC vibe here and i was feelin it..

it was always crowded but the place had a great vibe and layout that brought out the best times.. *sigh*  just talked to the new owner last week and they said they are closing the restaurant, and remodeling, and reopening.. the  unused side patio is going to be incorporated into the restaurant.. (more space!)

looking forward to the facelift..
author: Carlo M.

description: Seems like a good place for a lunch meeting. Service was good and quick. The food didn't overwhelm me but wasn't bad either. The portions were about the right size for lunch and the server kept my iced tea filled. No major complaints!
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Conveniently in the Civic Center area and not dirty and cheap like many other restaurants nearby.  Food okay.  Service sucks.
author: CAKE E.

description: Food was awesome!! I went here for an IIDA event and had super fun! FOOD was fantastic!! Wine selection is okay. Our server gets a 5 star!! Kind of scary on the way here, so from Union Square I took the cab. hehe!! Safety first!!
author: Joanne D.

description: I first stumbbled upon Soluna a few years back during the love parade. Its a great centrally located spot for dinner on my way downtown from the sunset. The food/drinks are always great and the staff is always friendly.
author: Rosalind S.

description: Been here twice and both times was encouraged to repeat visiting.  Its just so hard as there are so many places to try in the city!  Pretty hip at nite on the weekends with the DJ and lightshow. The drinks are as good as the food, and the service is friendly but not too imposing. It's a cozy space and never too crowded. Great place to eat or catch drinks before going to a show.
author: Ikeb I.

description: Went here before going to the Orpheum Theater to go see "A Light in the Piazza".  They gave us a free apetizer with our dinner.  The service was nice.  They food was okay.  The ambience was so-so as well.  Nothing spectacular.
author: Julie G.

description: Great for drinks after the theatre and has a very charming atmosphere but the food needs some help.  We all had the Prix-fixed menu which is a great price and it changes seasonally.  We all started with the Local Dungeness Crab Cake but it was so orangey it overwhelmed the plate.  The steak was a bit fatty and the Seabass had a very strange flavor that I was not expecting.  You never know they could have had an off night.
author: Angela D.

description: Went there for a pre-theatre dining on a Friday night; dull foods and sluggish service, the restaurant was 40% full, not recommended.
author: J S.

description:
I wanted to try this place out because of the good reviews it got on Yelp, but I was kinda disappointed.

I really liked the 'decor' of the place (the moroccan feel of the chandeliers, the bordeaux colouring,...) and the bartender.  The service was friendly.  The food was good (we had the crab duo, the chicken and the steak, the strawberry shortcake), but for the price you pay, I expected something better (in this price range you can find better food in the city).
author: Marijke D.

description: The three stars are mostly because it's the only place to get risotto in Civic Center. I find the staff slow and the atmosphere lacking. The nicoise and crab cakes are passable. They do have a full bar so it's not a bad choice if you're in the neighborhood after work.
author: Angela K.

description:
Nice little bar.  My coworkers and I sometimes come here after work.  The bar has a nice lounge type of atmosphere and really good drink specials during happy hour.  The last time we were here I ordered the honey baked brie cheese, which was absolutely outstanding.    Waitstaff are friendly and the live music is usually quite good.

Updated review:  I had originally given a 4 star review, but am downgrading it to a 3 star based on their reduced lunch options for vegetarians/pescetarians and my attempt at ordering takeout from them today.    I requested a veggie burger, which is on the menu, only to be told that they were out of veggie burgers today, but was told they also served an Ahi Tuna Burger.  The person on the phone also mentioned a veggie pita.  I said, "you have a veggie pita?  I'll have that.".  I was then informed that they don't make the veggie pita anymore. They were unable to suggest any other vegetarian meal options,  so I asked for the Ahi Tuna burger that had been suggested earlier.  I was then told that they were also out of Ahi Tuna Burgers, but they could replace it with crab.   As the conversation was starting to resemble an Abbott and Costello skit, I decide to cut my losses and order from someplace else.... 

I ended up ordering nothing, and with so few vegetarian and seafood  options available, I doubt I will be attempting to order lunch from them again.  I may still come by for happy hour once and awhile, but that's about it.....
author: Kimberly T.

description: This is the classic sort of place that invites you to come in, stay a while and come back.  It's got this nifty fusion of neighborhood bar, cafe and trendy restaurant.  I love their soup.  The two mainstays, tomato and rosemary corn, delight my palette at luncheon a couple of times per week.  I also love the happy hour- $3 wells poured with solid mid-grade liquor, 1/2 price off the reasonably well managed wine list.  I recommend the ham and cheese sandwich at lunch and the sea bass at dinner.   Stop by on most Mondays for a drink and a double feature after work; the lights go down and movies play on the back wall.  Friendly, attentive staff care about the business and the neighborhood, which needs a few more places like Soluna to grace its streets.
author: Melissa L.

description: I came here with my coworkers for happy hour and I thought the food was only OK...nothing special...I was glad that we only stayed for a couple of hours! You can't go wrong with the drinks!
author: JenJen W.

description: Rule number one for Soluna Cafe - show up for happy hour.  5 - 7pm.  The bartender makes up the two new drink specials every week.  Well freaking done.  Some vodka, chartreuse, vanilla thing for $5 - I would have easily paid 10.  Macaroni and Cheese (the cheese being guyere, bleu, parmesaen and more!) perfectly baked in it's own little dish FABOO!  The pork sliders (2) were a win as well.  Also looking good, the caeser salad and the cheeseburger.  Food was great, atmosphere is perfect for a bite and a cocktail, service was friendly (albeit one guy) and location is perfect for stopping by before a show at the hebst theatre, opera house or other event in the neighborhood.
author: Natalie M.

description: I love Soluna Lounge! Great food, friendly staff, and stiff drinks...what more could you ask for?! This place is totally laid back and chill. I chatted it up with the bartender, I think her name was Cecilia, when i was there and she made me some delicious but very strong cocktails and was super fun...I'd go back there in a heart beat.
author: Georgia S.

description: I was here over a year ago and I just have to ask -- has it changed hands or something?  I went  in with a friend who works at SF Library -- and we had a burger, etc.  I just remember it as a burger-salad-pasta place.  I remember the server was nice the burger was quite decent, it was very quiet when we were there (about 1:30) and that decor-wise, etc. it was nothing memorable or special.  I just went on their website which makes the place look really romantic and all - and "romantic" was NOT my memory of it. I remember just a kind of lunch bistro -- no cloths on the tables or anything.   Has it changed a lot recently or -- am I not remembering correctly?  A friend was asking me about it recently and seemed to think it would be a really great place for a group to go for dinner for a senior prom -- which I couldn't image in my wildest dreams  Limo, ballgowns, corsages, tuxes...at SOLUNA?
author: L M.

description:
I almost didn't eat here.  Recent reviews complaining of poor, slow service made me wary that my BFF and I might be hungry (and late) to see "Wicked" at the Orpheum Theater last night, even though this place is right around the corner.  We decided to walk by and check it out, and ended up at a cute little table for two in the bar.  Our server appeared right away, took drink orders, then had my lemon drop remade after I discovered a salty, instead of sweet, rim on my drink.  We both had delicious, fresh spinach salads with grilled chicken.  We shared a tasty Pot du Creme for dessert.  My only complaint is that the "warm ciabatta" they offer on request turned out to be a luke-warm roll without much flavor.

The decor was warm and upscale, the service was friendly.  The price of the meal came in a little high for what we got, but given its proximity to the theater I'm okay with that.  As we were leaving, a gentleman offered to call us a cab if we needed one.  We didn't, but it was a nice touch.
author: Paige L.

description: I don't get why this place isn't packed everynight, but I suppose it's because of the somewhat desolate area (at night). It's also a bar so check it out on weeknights and weekends.
author: John B.

description:
they do "ahi three ways"!

staff and owner are courteous and patient, passionate about food. 

a bit out of my usual price range but well worth the occasional splurge. lunch is a great time to go.

give this place some business...they deserve it!
author: Anne D.

description: I dine out a lot and find it hard in SF to find a poor meal.  We were dining pre-performance and had a hard time finding a resv, so based on Opentable reviews, we thought the restaurant sounded like a good option.  My experience at Soluna was so bad I wanted to warn other people not to waste their time. Unfortunately my review was removed from Opentable - perhaps the star rating was too low.  Some of the dishes were inedible, the service was terrible.  I couldn't eat the gluelike potatoes which were so overcooked they dripped through the fork, and I skipped the other veggie which wasn't appetizing, eating only the salmon on my plate.  Despite having very few tables it took 10-15 minutes to receive our drinks each time we placed an order.  The bathrooms were grimy - yuck.  They seated us with a view to the outdoor garbage cans - really - in an almost empty restaurant?  Although it's hard to pinpoint to their restaurant, within 3.5 hours after dining with them, I became ill with food poisoning. Huh.
author: Cynthia S.

description: It's Thursday night, and I just got a call from Soluna.  We've had a reservation there for Saturday night dinner before a show at the Orpheum Theatre for nearly a month.  They called to say we'd have to finish our dinner and be out the door by 7:15 because they're having a private party!  Why did they wait until less than 48 hours beforehand to tell us?  It was very inconsiderate.  We've dined at Soluna many times before shows at the Orpheum, but I doubt that we'll do it again.
author: Sheryl E.

description: Our server was great. Food was not so good. We ordered the tiramisu stuffed french toast which sounds a lot better than it tasted. We also had the fruit bowl which tasted like the fruit had been sliced with a knife that had also been used to cut onions and garlic. The over easy eggs were cooked too fast which made for a rubbery consistency. We went to celebrate a birthday for a 6 year old and specifically alerted the restaraunt on the reservation, however no mention of her birthday was ever made by the restaurant, which was fine because we were planning on coming back to the restaurant after seeing the matinee show of Wicked. (Soluna advertises a complimentary dessert if you show your ticket stubs for Wicked). When we returned after the show was over, Soluna was closed so the option for dessert did not happen. I would NEVER go here again.  I think the ONLY reason they get business is because they are close to the Orpheum.
author: K C.

description: Stopped by Soluna for some drinks and appetizers after the Giants World Series Parade.  The service and food were excellent.  Great atmosphere.  Ended up leaving my credit card and the manager Rene went out of his way to get it back to me.  Thanks Soluna!
author: Andreas M.

description: This is a probably great place to go for a business lunch, as it is one of the more upscale places in the neighborhood (which, unfortunately, doesn't say much). Otherwise, it's better to pass Soluna on by. Yes, it's clean, and, yes, the food is overall pretty good. What torpedos this place's rating: 1) The food is definitely overpriced, and 2) By and large, the service is sub-par. Take a swing if you're in the mood for something only Soluna offers (say, a burger). If you're just looking for a healthy lunch, go to Morty's. If you just want something  cheap and tasty, check out one of the taquerias within 1-2 blocks of this place. Seriously, don't believe the crowds in this place -- they are all paying through the nose.
author: Wendy J.

description: Trying to find a decent restaurant in walking distance of the Orpheum Theatre, I stumbled upon Soluna.  This was a fantastic dinner.  For the first course I had the sliced duck breast with salad and an incredible vinaigrette. For the main course two of us had the pork with mashed potatoes and cabbage; absolutely delicious; my husband had sea bass; and my girlfriend had the salmon.  The four of us were absolutely impressed with the dinner.  Two of us ordered the prix fixe ($35.00) and shared the first courses and desserts with our husbands who ordered just an entree.  That was more than enough food for all of us, and lowered the bill to a more than reasonable amount.  Nice wine selection.  Only minor complaints were: service a little amaturish, and the cocktails could have been better; but they were still pretty good.
author: Christine S.

description:
I have been to this place in the past, and had a GREAT experience.  It was my ex's 25th Bday and he had broken his elbow the day before.  Not only did the staff accommodate us on very short notice (I wasn't sure if he would want to do anything) , but they also cut up his steak into medallions so that he would not have to worry about cutting it, or worse-having ME cut his food in public!  
Well, all the nice things that made me like Soluna so much went out the window last night.  So my new squeeze and I (yes I move on quite quickly) had reservations for 8pm.  We were running a little late (I could not decide on an outfit) and so I called to see if I could bump the reservation to 8:15.  The host proceeded to tell me that they were "keeping the kitchen open for us, and it would be appreciated if we could make out reservation".  CAN YOU BELIEVE IT!  A Friday night, and they are closing the kitchen at 8?  Needless to say I was very turned off.  We ended up canceling our reservation and headed out to B44 (which I will also review).  Had an amazing time and didn't have to worry about the kitchen closing on us. :)
author: Stephanie P.

description: The seafood here is very good, ONE of the best I've ever had, but they should serve less pasta with it. I went with two other people, they got some sort of fish with fingerling potatoes and the pork chop. I don't eat pork, but the chop looked good and he said that it was cooked well but that the apples that came with it were a little tart. The fish was cooked well and the tapenade with it was delicious. Of the desserts, the bread pudding was the best. It's made with sourdough bread, so be warned if you don't like sourdough, but who doesn't?
author: Trisha P.

description:
unfortunately, we didn't get to eat the food here. this review is mostly for service.  we made reservations and were excited to try the food.  the happy hour menu looked very tempting.  when we arrived, it wasn't busy but the hostess seemed a bit frazzled and we had to wait a bit just to get seated, even though we had a reservation. 

the place looked nice but our waiter (a tall, thin asian with black hair and glasses), don't know what his problem was, had a major attitude.  the drinks tasted weird.  but we were ready for food and asked if we can have the happy hour menu instead because the regular dinner menu wasn't very inspiring.  he stuck his nose up and told us the happy hour menu was for the bar only. ok. well, that's why we came here, we wanted the happy hour menu. you'd think since we were already seated, they'd want to get some business.  but nope. he just walked away.  

ah well, we took a few more sips of the drinks and decided to try another more accomodating place, hayes street cafe.  now, they know service.  too bad.
author: Food Is L.

description: anyplace with "french 75" on their cocktail menu deserves high praises! to me, that's a big deal. i dont get out this way too much, but worth coming to when i am. yes, the next Yelp event should be here. great idea stellah DV!
author: Michelle I.

description: Don't waste your time and money with this place unless you enjoy being treated like crap.  I made my reservation 2 months ago, confirmed 2 days before, and arrived 10 minutes early.  Our reservation was for 6 last night.  First we stood up front for over 5 minutes waiting for someone to acknowledge us and when Dave finally showed up to greet us, he informed us we could have a seat in the dining area until 645 and then move to the bar for dessert or just sit in the bar.  I'm sorry but WHAT?!  We had reservations.  So I told him we would be dining in the dining room since we had a reservation.
