Dave walked up and down the aisle the entire time looking at us and looking at his watch.  At 645 our waitress brought us the check and we weren't even close to done eating!  The ridiculous thing is that the place was not even crowded.  There were empty tables all around us so there was no reason we needed to vacate our seats nor could Dave provide us with one.  He claimed to be the manager but could not produce a business card to prove so and when we asked for one he changed his tune and said we could keep our seats.  Our seats amid many empty tables mind you.  When it came time to leave, Dave hid like the weasel he is to not have to provide us with the business card we asked for.  Totally put a damper on the evening I planned as a gift to my Mom.  And the grilled pecan chicken was burnt, dry, and nasty.  Awful experience!
author: Trina B.

description: This place has amazing food and service. My husband and I were greeted right away and shown to a table, where we pored over the menu. I was offered a sample of wine since I was unsure which one to order. The waitress brought out a free appetizer, compliments of the chef. Though a small size, the taste was rich. I ordered the lamb chops and he ordered risotto. Both were fantastic. For desert we has bread pudding and truffles. The pudding was fantastic, we didn't care much for the truffles. Probably because we're used to See's Candies and Godiva; they are hard to compete with chocolate-wise. The experience overall was great. We'll definately be back, when visiting San Francisco.
author: M. D.

description:
We went to Soluna before Wicked at 8pm on a Friday night.  The bar was packed, but at least the tables in the back were a bit quieter.  Our server seemed to be a bit on the rushed-side, but we were able to order our food and drinks soon enough.  The food was great - I had the steak, my husband had the lamb shank.  Everything was surprisingly tasty!  The wines were also quite good, and good selection by the glass.  
My biggest complaint was that, at our table of 4, each of us had to wait for what felt like forever for our server to remember that we were back there when our glasses were empty.  We eventually got refills, but it seemed to take a wee bit too long.  
Also good to note is that if you have tickets to Wicked, you get a free dessert (one per table).  The desserts were yummy, with the exception of the cheesecake - we all decided we'd skip that the next time. But the truffle sampler and the bread pudding were yumtastic!
author: Marie L.

description: We came here for brunch to celebrate Mother's Day right before watching Wicked.  The restaurant wasn't that busy, but it took them 45 minutes to serve us our food.  The service is incredibly slow and almost made us late for our show.  The food was not impressive.  A bit on the bland side.  I definitely would not dine there again.
author: Mina O.

description: great "undiscovered" place in the civic center area. ive been here several times and the restaurant simply never gets full at night. dont let that deter you however, the food at solluna is delicious. try the chicken, dirty risotto, steak, and chocolate pot de creme. best of all, the place offers a nightly 24.99 prix fixe. the environment is warm and very intimate. highly recommended!
author: Christian S.

description: yummy everything was sooo good... had the duo of crab appetizers (amazing)...the pork tenderloin with this bacon sweet potato mixture...(which you would think is weird..but was actually an amazing combination of flavors)....and rounded it all off with the strawberry shortcake which was good but not the best I've had. Overall a great dinner and for a great price.  My friend had the salmon which was really really fresh and cooked to perfection...and I heard the risotto was to die for =)...also the restaurant was EMPTY at 7 pm on a Saturday...so would also be great for a last minute night out...=)
author: Joy Y.

description: Went before seeing The Color Purple at the Orpheum - great location, easy to get to and ample parking in the Civic Center underground garage.  The decor is great - lots of original abstract art and the seating is lots of comfy booths with velvet pillows.  For the amount of food and quality, the $35 always offered Prix Fixe menu is awesome.  I had the lobster bisque to start, lovely and simple with a little kick of pepper, followed by the most amazing bacon wrapped halibut in lobster chardonnay sauce.  Dessert was the only drawback - ordered the Pot de Creme, which was recommended by the waiter, and it was good, but WAY too thick and rich - it seemed to be just dark chocolate that had been slightly softened and poured into a large cup - the portion was just way too big.  I overheard something going wrong with an order at the table next to us and they were apologized profusely to and then had their drinks paid for - very good service and an enjoyable meal overall.  Definitely make a reservation - it's just easier.
author: Kristina N.

description: Everything that could've gone wrong went wrong. We were seated promptly but because we were seated in corner table, our waiter didn't notice us, waited over 15 minutes before we got served. I had scallops appetizer and they were burnt like as if they were just reheated; burnt on the outside and dry on the inside. I had the pork loin with a side of creamy potatoes. Pork loin was dry and luke-warm and the potatoes were still cold in the center. I informed our waiter and he just brought me another plate of the potatoes and reassured me this time he asked them to 'heat' it up warm but it was still cold again. My husband ordered the steak and it seemed odd when the waiter asked 'how warm do you want it' as we took it he meant 'how well you want it cooked' and my husband said 'medium'. His steak turned out to be slices of beef which was also luke-warm. I tried to make reservations for the night before but they were closed for a private party and with the food that night, it just led me to believe that we probably were served leftovers.
author: Cuisine N.

description: Though I've not eaten here, I can truly say that I enjoy stopping in for my morning coffee.  It's a really cozy, yet hip kind of place.  Their staff has always been friendly and attentive to my order - I tend to switch my choice of drink every now and then...For those of us who work in the Civic Center area, it's an ideal location for coffee, drinks, or dining.  One thing that drew my attention to this place was it's name and the colorful scheme used on the exterior.  Once you're inside you can enjoy sitting either on their bar area or the tables set aside to give you some privacy, or should say, a chance to hold a conversation without interruptions.  I'm sure I will be pleased with their dinner/menu, so I'll make it a point to stop in for that.
author: Yesenia S.

description: used to be "the spot" before where my friend dedan spun soulful house music and graciously moved to spin at luka's in oakland -- been here a couple of times for their happy hour sessions. nice quiet spot to meet up and go to another bar..love their cosmos with belvedere -- service is friendly and sleek, narrow digs to get cozy at.
author: Mika D.

description: We were looking for a place to eat before heading to the Orpheum for THE DROWSY CHAPERONE.  I made the reservation through Open Table (easy) and we got there at 5:35 for a 5:45 reservation.  Lots of room, good service (unlike some of the other reviewers had) and really delicious food.  The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is that I don't want to top out too soon.  Not cheap, but hey, parking on the street and walking to Soluna and the theatre saved us $10 over parking at the garage, so it all works out...
author: Brian H.

description: My husband and I had dinner here before heading to the Orpheum for our anniversary and the food and service were fantastic.  The lobster bisque was one of the best I've ever had in my life.  Our meat was cooked perfectly, as we had ordered, and the wine list was fairly extensive and well suited to the food selections.  It is not cheap, but you get what you pay for!
author: T. S.

description: Silly me, I should have read the other reviews here before dining at Yelp. Big mistake. The service here is indifferent at best. My husband and I walked into a nearly empty Soluna on a Friday night. Bad sign. The waitress seemed displeased that we didn't order wine. I had the goat cheese and spinach salad -- nothing spectacular. That was followed by a pretty dull plate of pecan encrusted chicken breast over mashed potatoes. The chicken was overcooked, and the pecan crust was incredibly bland. The accompanying cranberry relish reminded me of 1970s cranberry from a can. The mashed potatoes had dried herbs on top, and there was an odd after taste to everything. I had been here before for lunch, and really liked their risotto. Service was pretty haughty then, and I wanted to give Soluna one more chance. I really wanted to like it because it's fairly close to my home and I like supporting local businesses. Definitely won't return.
author: Lilia A.

description: The food was wonderful ... we ordered pecan crusted chicken and also ahi tuna, both wonderfully prepared, beautiful presentation. Because we had an 8:00PM curtain at the Orpheum, we got a free dessert, which was fantastic (bread pudding w/ ice cream). Unfortunately, it was slow to come out of the oven and it made us a bit late for our show ... although once it came it was worth the wait. We both thought the service was slow and our server kept forgetting things (silverware, cream for the coffee) and not bringing them even when we reminded her. We actually had to get up and go to another table for a spoon. But, the venue and food are great, and we'd both return without hesitation. Just have to leave plenty of time to accommodate the slow service.
author: Eileen A.

description: The seared ahi tuna on top of my nicoise salad was not a bright fresh  pink color, but a deep dark red. Ew. This was my third time going there. The first two times were just as disappointing. I'd rather stick to Lalita's Thai Restaurant or the Asian Art Museum Cafe, or better yet, Taqueria El Castillito on Golden Gate.
author: Laura C.

description: Good atmosphere but poor service. Our party of 4 was charged 18% gratuity on our bill. Since when is that acceptable?  Especially as we sat in the lounge and had to walk up to the bar to order our food and drinks.  There are too many good restaurants and lounges in SF to go back to this one...
author: Tracy P.

description: Nice atmosphere and yummy -sounding menu and cocktails, but the food was so-so and the service was bad. Convenient to the Orpheum Theater, which is why I went, but I probably wouldn't go back otherwise.
author: C P M.

description: I enjoy coming here. The sandwiches are very tasty, the fries are cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the salads that come with the sandwiches are always a nice plus.  Today I went again and, while the service was very good, I was slightly annoyed that the lady refilling my glass of water would repeatedly rest the pour spout of the water pitcher on my glass.  I get grossed out whenever any server does this - this would mean that every glass in the restaurant is getting refilled and the same spout keeps touching each of them.  Sorry to rant, but this is the only reason I will give this spot a 4 stars instead of a 5.
author: Chris W G.

description: Best grilled chicken sandwich in the area.  Love the place.  I've been here 8 times and have ordered the chicken sandwich every time.  Amazingly juicy.  Service- depending on who you get.  I got a real nice one that actually refills my water and then the very next time, I got a grouchy looking one that never came back to check on me until I asked for my bill.
author: Gina R.

description: My friend and I went there for dinner before an opera.   We asked our server if he could help us with our wobbly table.  He got upset and without talking, started moving our glasses and silverware to another table and  asked us to move.  He was so violent in his gesture that he spilled some of the wine.  I didn't think our request was unreasonable and we both were surprised by his behavior.  I understand it's a difficult job and maybe he was having a bad day, but it was not professional to put it out on innocent customers and ruin our evening.  To make things worse, another waiter mixed our orders and brought wrong dishes.
author: J c.

description: I made a reservation for a group of 6 before going to see Wicked on a Saturday night show.  I made the reservation for 5:15 to make sure we weren't rushed in getting to the 8 pm show.  I'm glad I did because the service was slow and the waitress was not very attentive after taking our initial drink orders.  We were seated around 5:20 and our waitress came by shortly after to take our drink order.  So far so good.  After we had a bit more time to look at the menu, she returned and took our food order.  This was also good, but then all of a sudden our waitress went MIA and we finished our first drinks, hadn't gotten our food and weren't able to order another drink for another 30 minutes or so.  We did get plenty of water refills from other servers, but our waitress had vanished.  We even asked one of the other servers about our waitress so we could place additional drink orders, but it took another 10 minutes for her to come back.  In the meantime, our appetizer of french fries arrived and they were delicious.  We also received a complimentary appetizer because during one of the many water refills, the server spilled a full glass of water all over the table and a couple in our party.  Very nice gesture on their part.  Anyway, when our main entrees finally arrived, they were quite good.  I ordered the ahi which was pretty good, but very salty (glad they kept our waters filled).  My fiance had the pumpkin ravioli which was excellent.  The other dishes at the table also looked good and everybody seemed very happy with their selections.  Overall, this was a decent restaurant, but kind of lacked in the service department.  Definitely make sure you have some time if you are on a schedule to get to a show at the Orpheum.  We ended up leaving the restaurant at 7:15 when we were seated nearly 2 hours before.
author: Mike F.

description: I met two friends for lunch today and I was looking forward to a tasty treat at Soluna Cafe. The place was pretty full by noon but we were quickly seated at a nice banquette and the server was friendly and efficient. I ordered a Crab Louis anticipating a salad piled high with lumps of crab and was very disappointed with the sorriest excuse for a Crab Louis I could possibly imagine. The rather large triangular plate was carpeted with pieces of lettuce, then garnished with two thin slices of hard boiled egg. The Louis consisted of a small piece of toast adorned with a tiny ice cream scoop-size serving of what looked like hospital cafeteria tuna salad. It was a mushy mass that tasted mainly of lemon juice with no hint of the advertised crab and shrimp. The total amount of "crab" would have been about enough to cover a couple of Ritz Crackers. On the plus side however there were a few capers. If I hadn't been feeling weak after a recent bout with the flu, I would have sent it back for something else but I just didn't have the energy. One of my companions had the burger and said it was OK but didn't compare to the really wonderful burger at Spruce. My other friend had the crispy chicken sandwich and pronounced it "nothing special". Next time I will have lunch at the cafe at the Asian Art Museum. I've never been disappointed there.
author: Mike H.

description: went to this place a couple of years ago after winning a free dinner from a website on restaurant reviews...anyway, should have wrote this earlier but here i am nevertheless...we had a rude, slow and stupid waitress who i now think was purposely rude to us.  i saw here sitting at the bar while we waited for our dinner, which came late and cold...she "forgot" our fries and never asked how things were...i think she was racist, either that, she was plain a terrible waitress...i wish i had never even tipped her....food was just decent...food in the City is just okay...overpriced and very touristy...
author: just m.

description: I am very tolerant of restraunts and service having worked in the industry, but I draw the line here at Soluna. Soluna is a disgrace to the restaurant industry. First, the decor (more specifically the lamp shades) is shabby and in dire need of repair. There was no toilet paper in the bathroom... But I am getting ahead of myself. Namja, our waitress, was frightenly slow. We waited over a half hour for drinks, about 45 minutes for appetizers, and by the time our food actually arrived we had to cram it down in ten minutes as we were going to be late for a show. We had over two hours set aside for dinner. Our waitress was sullen at best and to top the whole lovely experience off (there was a group of us) she did NOT deduct the cash we gave her from the tab and divide the rest on credit cards. We now have to go back. Oh, and the food - boring, bland and entirely unremarkable. Do not waste your time here - it is a disaster
author: Molly R.
